loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer emprendedora que ha dedicado toda su vida a confeccionar prendas de vestir; aprendió el oficio hace 40 años gracias a una prima quien se encargó de enseñarle y desde entonces se ha dedicado a saber más acerca de la confección.
 
Trabaja día a día de 7a.m. a 6p.m debido a que tiene gran cantidad de pedidos por entregar, sin embargo el tiempo a veces no le es suficiente puesto que Yolanda necesita una máquina  plana para agilizar la producción. Con la compra de esta herramienta ella podrá darle mejor calidad al acabado de sus productos y generará un empleo adicional.
texts.en:
Yolanda is an entrepreneurial woman; she has worked all her life in the business of making clothing -- a skill that she has learned 40 years ago thanks to a cousin who took the time to teach her. Since then, she has always tried to learn more about the manufacturing process.

Yolanda works every day from 7am until 6pm, due to a large amount of orders. Even so, sometimes she does not have enough time because she does not have a flat sewing machine -- something that she needs to speed up the manufacture. Once she can purchase this tool, she will be able to give a better quality finish to her products and to obtain additional work.

loans.use: to purchase a flat sewing machine for manufacturing clothing

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 30-year-old Mrs. Duong R. 's daily duties in the garment industry. She has been engaged in her job since 2008 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction field. The couple help each other to earn money to feed their three single kids. All of the kids are attending school. 

Mrs. Duong R. would like to apply for a loan in order to purchase a used motorcycle to ride to work. Then she won't have to pay for a motor taxi when she needs to go work as before.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle to ride to work.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 58 years old and married with three children older than age 25.  He supplies potatoes and onions to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 18 years.  He has employed two people to assist him in the business.  He also does transport business for extra income. 

Since he joined a group in Faulu Kenya, he has gained a lot of business ideas from the group members.  He has also learned how to manage his finances.  He has requested 90,000 KES to buy potatoes, onions and a cart for transportation.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, onions and a cart for transportation

loans.name: William José

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor William Jose es una persona que se desempeña como operario para llevar el bienestar a su hogar y ha logrado mantener a su familia con esfuerzo de su trabajo y así darle una buena condición de vida a su familia. Él se ha caracterizado por ser una persona excelente y con buenos valores morales como persona.

Se presentó en esta oficina de Ceprodel el señor William Jose a solicitar crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro esto será utilizado para hacer un baño en su vivienda y así mejorar la condición de vida.
texts.en:
William José lives in the city of Managua.  He is employed as a manual worker and works to provide for his household.  He has managed to support his family through his hard work and provide them with good living conditions.  William José is noted as being a man with good moral values. 

William José came to Ceprodel's office to request a loan to improve the condition of his home.  He needs this loan to buy construction supplies such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel and iron.  These supplies will be used to build a bathroom in his home which will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home, buying construction supplies

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Agusta; tiene 37 años de edad; la socia es conviviente y tiene 7 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de artesanía, la socia elabora telares, ella realiza mantas de todo tamaño, así como ponchos, chullos, guantes entre otros trabajos, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales tales como lanas de alpaca, y tintes naturales para teñir las lanas de diferentes colores, la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de mantas y vender.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Augusta is a member of the "Sr. De Tayancani" community bank.  She lives in Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Augusta is 37 years old, lives with her partner, and has seven children.  She divides her time between her household chores and her business selling handicrafts.  Augusta weaves products with a loom.  She makes blankets in all sizes.  She also makes ponchos, 'chullos' (woolen hats with ear flaps), gloves and other items.  She needs this loan to invest in buying materials such as alpaca yarn and natural dyes for dying her yarn different colors.  She needs this loan to invest in buying materials for making blankets to sell.

Augusta appreciates the loan that she has been granted and is infinitely grateful for it as it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for making blankets to sell

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es: Marivel de 30 años convive con claudio de 43 años de edad, juntos tienen 3 hijos con quienes vive en su propia casa  en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Marivel es una mujer de ardua labor que desde muy niña tuvo que trabajar por ganarse la vida para poder tener un futuro con buenas expectativas. Es así que decidió emprender un negocio que es la venta de pollos, claro que a los inicios le fue muy difícil mantener en pie su negocio y tener clientes ahora cuenta con un ingreso económico estable y el apoyo de su esposo e hijos. El  único problema que ella tiene es que los pollos tiene que comprarlos desde san Francisco que queda a una distancia no menos de 45 kilómetros y trasladarlos hasta Canayre que es donde queda su negocio. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella esta agradecida y a la vez se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles desea adquirir más pollos para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marivel, aged 30, lives with Claudio, aged 43.  They have 3 children together, and live with them in their own house in the town of Canayre in Llochegua district.  Marivel is a hard-working woman who has had to work for a living since she was a little girl, in order to have a future with good prospects.  She therefore decided to start a business selling chickens.  Of course, at the beginning it was very difficult to keep her business going and to have customers.  Now she has a stable income and the support of her husband and children.  The only problem she has is that she needs to buy the chickens from San Francisco, which is at least 45 kilometers away, and transport them to Canayre which is where she has her business. 

This will be her second loan through MFP, for which she is grateful and also agrees to pay her repayments promptly. With the 1,000 New Soles,she wants to buy more chickens to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: A 55-year-old single mother of one school-going child, Florence has practiced farming in the town of Njabini for the last seven years and normally sells her produce at Njabini market. She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan which she plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, Florence hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
María, vive con dos hijos, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos y venta D. ropa, el negocio lo inicio por el apoyo D. sus suegros, la granja D. cerdos la tiene en su vivienda y el negocio D. la ropa la tiene instalada en un puesto en el mercado municipal.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. cerdos y también para invertir en el negocio D. ropa, comprándose blusas, camisas, ropa interior, la compra le ayudara a incrementar los dos negocios, permitiéndole servir D. una mejor manera.
Su aspiración es tener éxito en sus dos negocios, poder comercializar con los clientes, ofreciéndoles mercadería nueva, también que su hogar cuente con todo lo necesario para su vida diaria.
texts.en:
María lives with her two children.  She raises pigs and sells clothes.  The business was started with help from her in-laws.  She has her pig farm at home and the clothing sales business is in a stand in the municipal market.  

She is asking for the loan to buy pigs and also to invest in clothing; she’ll buy blouses, shirts and underwear.  The purchase will help her increase both businesses allowing her to proviD. better service.  

Her goal is to be successful at both businesses to be able to sell her customers new merchandise and also that her home has all that is necessary for daily life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to buy clothes.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is a Rwandan rice farmer who is married with six children.  She has been a farmer for the past 10 years, and she learned rice farming from a formal training program.

She will use her Kiva loan to cover labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and finally in harvesting activities.

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Santana

texts.es:
Santana, vive con sus hijos de 19 y 14 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace 11 años trabaja en el negocio, ubicándolo en una calle muy transitada con afluencia de clientes, ella tiene una dificultad con sus estantes, pues están dañados y necesitan reparación; Para esto solicita un préstamo, pagando la reparación de los estantes y comprara mas mercadería, como manzanas, bananos, sandia.
Este préstamo será una gran ayuda para Santana, quien depende del negocio, y también sus hijos, pues son dependientes, Ella quiere lograr un desarrollo en el negocio con mejores ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Santana lives with her children ages 19 and 14.   For the past 11 years she has been selling fruits and vegetables for a living.  Her business is located on a very  busy street with a lot of customer traffic.  She has been having problems with her shelves as they are damaged and in need of repair.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to repair the shelves and buy more merchandise such as apples, bananas, and watermelons.  This loan will be a great help to Santana as she and her children depend on this business  as they are still dependents.  She wants to grow her business by improving her sales and income.

loans.use: repair her shelves and buy more merchandise such as apples, bananas, and watermelons.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosario es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, su variada gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños.

Doña Rosario tiene 44 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 17 y 5 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una universidad de la ciudad, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su último hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora Rosario se dedica al cuidado de su familia y a la cría y venta de pollos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de materiales de construcción para hacer algunos arreglos de su vivienda.
 
Su meta es darles a sus hijos los mejores estudios para que salgan adelante
texts.en:
Señora Rosario is a member of the communal bank "Luz y Vida", (Light and Life").  She lives in the Monay sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cool climate, and it is the third most important city in the country.  It's people keep up the culture and traditions of their forefathers, and its varied gastronomy cultivates the palate of locals and visitors alike.

Doña Rosario is 44 years old.  She is married, and has 3 children from her marriage aged 22, 17, and 5 years old. Her eldest daughter is studying at a university in the city.  Her second child, a son, attends high school, and her youngest son is in a primary school in the city.  Her husband is a mechanic by profession, and the house where they live is their own property.

Señora Rosario takes care of the family, and raises and sells chickens.

She has been a member of the communal bank for two years, and her new loan is to invest in the purchase of construction materials to make some repairs to her home.

Her goal is to provide her children with the best education so that they can move ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Enercida is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress) 1 & 2. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She decided to take a loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza International, because she joined a group with very good friends and all of them are hard workers, dedicated to their businesses.

Enercida is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling a well-known brand of cosmetic products through catalogs and also selling second-hand clothing. She will purchase a bag of such clothes and different cosmetic products to be show in a product display stall, which she also will buy with this loan. Enercida is planning to save part of her business profits to get a site for her business, because she wants to improve her business.

Enercida dreams of having her own house and of seeing all her children go to school and become professionals. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a product display stall and a bag of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with two children who attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past three years. Her customers are from her neighboring community. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of its loan products.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Koleta

texts.en:
Koleta is 59 years of age and she is a widow with six children. Koleta owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Koleta needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 108 talas or US $45 per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2008, Koleta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Koleta's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old. She is married with four children.

Myrna buys ready-to-wear clothes like blouses and t-shirts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional clothes for selling.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Myra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes like blouses and t-shirts for selling.

loans.name: Gandaria 3 Group

texts.en: Taryamah is 52 years old. She is a widow with two children. She is selling snacks and ice from her rented house. She has been doing this business since 2010. The business is going well. With the income, she can buy food and pay the rent. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She wants to use this loan to increase her capital and buy more variations of snacks and ice to sell. In the future she wants to buy a house and have her own shop. Also she wants to go on a hajj (pilgrimage) to Mecca.

loans.use: to buy more variations of snacks and ice to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en: Tsogtbayar is 22 years old and lives with his brother in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His brother is a student. Tsogtbayar started his cell phone repair and sales business in 2009 by renting a counter in the market when he finished his cell phone repair training. He also sells secondhand cell phones. Now that cell phones are becoming more advanced, Tsogtbayar needs to buy some equipment in order to repair these phones. He has already taken training in repairing Smartphones; he only requires the appropriate equipment. Due to his cash shortage, Tsogtbayar is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy new cell phones from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To buy new cell phones from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious and optimistic. She operates a grocery retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located at Athiru gaiti in Maua town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased cost of goods when buying them. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of cereals. Her business goal is to triple the stock within five years.

loans.use: to add to her stock of cereals

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en: Melecio is 47 years old and has earned a living as a farmer for the last four years. Recently, he has faced several large challenges, including an unexpected typhoon, pests and other insects. He is applying for a loan for PHP 25,000 to help his farm recover by buying corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. He hopes that this loan and his hard work will allow him to recover from these difficulties.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a farm.

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Self Help” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. However, with this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Ya Marie. Ya Marie is age fifty; she was born in Magburaka town but she is currently residing in Makeni together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a carpenter and one of her children is in primary school and another is in college. Ya Marie has been a businesswoman for more than twenty years now. She sells rice, vegetable oil, sardines, Peak milk (canned milk brand), etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy rice, cigarettes, vegetable oil, etc. in large quantities to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy rice, cigarettes, vegetable oil, etc. in large quantities to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 36-year-old married woman with five children – four of them are in school. She has been selling bread in Yambio, South Sudan, for five years. Victoria is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, refrescos, conservas y otros productos para tiendas de barrio. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más mercadería, arroz, azucar, harina, bebida espirituosa como el Singani Casa Real, Singani San Pedro (Singani es una bebida hecha de uva) y champagne, y así poder surtir su tienda .Martha  es casada y tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a kiva y la séptima vez que solicita un crédito a través de IMPRO.
texts.en: Martha has a store where she sells groceries, soft-drinks, canned goods and other products for neighborhood stores.  She needs the loan to buy more merchandise like rice, sugar, flour, spirit beverages like Singani Casa Real and Singani San Pedro (Singani is a beverage made from grapes) and champagne to stock her store.  Martha is married and has two children.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Irpavi zone.  This is the fifth time she’s worked with Kiva and the seventh time she’s asked for a loan through IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: El Comité Inmaculada Concepción De María Group

texts.es:
El comité Inmaculada Concepción de María se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  pero también realizan conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.  Ellas están muy contentas por formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y desean llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La Señora María es una de las integrantes del comité, ella es Docente y también se dedica  confeccionar sabanas , almohadas , y fundas, los cuales vende mucho, pues siempre tiene muy buena calidad los productos que ella hace. Cuenta que está casada y que su marido es guardia de seguridad, y de esa forma ambos se ayudan con los gastos de la casa, juntos tienen  2 hijas quienes son el motivo de lucha de María y de su marido, ya que quieren darles una vida cómoda y sin privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas de diversos tipos, hilos, agujas, y demás insumos necesarios para elaborar sus sabanas, fundas y demás. Ella al igual que sus amigas agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad que les dan.
texts.en:
The Inmaculada Concepción de María committee was formed by the union of a number of neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the members of the committee have their own independent businesses, but they also carry out activities jointly, which strengthens group bonding. They are very happy to make up part of the program for enterprising women of the Fundación Paraguaya and would like to reach the program's maximum level. 

Ms. María is one of the committee's members. She is a teacher and also devotes herself to making sheets, pillows and pillowcases of which she sells a lot, since the products she makes have always been of very high quality. She says she is married and that her husband is a security guard, and thus they both help with household expenses. Together they have two children who are the motive for María and her husband's struggles, since they wish to give them a comfortable life without deprivations. 

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of various kinds of cloth, thread, needs and other supplies needed to make her sheets, pillowcases and other items. She along with her friends gives thanks to Kiva for the opportunity they are being given.

loans.use: to purchase various types of cloth, thread, needs and other supplies.

loans.name: Bintumwa Ii Group

texts.fr:
Magnifique fait partie du groupe Bintuma II.  Elle habite à Gitega, elle a 28 ans. Elle est mariée à Credo, un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 4mois à 13 ans. Quatre enfants étudient.

Elle est  commerçante de boutique (savons, riz, haricot,…)depuis 10 ans.

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame.Avec  le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va   augmenter son capital, en achetant beaucoup d’articles de  sa boutique (savons, riz, haricots,...) à  revendre afin gagner plus.

Avec les bénéfices de son commerce, elle assure les soins de santé de la familiale,et elle paie les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Magnifique is a member of the Bintuma II group. She lives in Gitega, she is 28 years old. She is married to Credo, a tailor. They have 5 children between the ages of 4 months and 15 years. Four of the children attend school.

She has been a shopkeeper (soap, rice, beans....) for 10 years.

This is her third loan from Turame.With this loan from Kiva, she will increase her capital, by buying many articles for her shop (soap, rice, beans...) for resale in order to earn more.

With the profits from her business, she pays for the family healthcare and the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying many articles for her shop (soap,rice,beans..) for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Therese

texts.fr: Therese est une femme de 39 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants dont l'age entre 2 et 21 ans. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 4 ans déjà. son activité c'est la vente des vivres frais(macabo, manioc,plantains)en fonction des saisons depuis 8 ans . Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit parce qu'elle aimerait acheter en grande quantité les régimes de plantains, sacs de macabo et de manioc dans les brousses pour venir revendre. Mais la petitesse de son capital ne lui permet pas de le faire, d'où la nécessité de ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.Ceci augmentera son capital, ses ventes et donc son bénéfice.Elle économisera ce bénéfice pour agrandir son activté et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Therese is a 39-year-old married mother of six children between the ages of 2 and 21 years old. She has been a trader in one of the capital city's markets for four years. She has been selling fresh produce (macabo, cassava, plantains) for eight years. She is looking to take out a new loan because she would like to buy bunches of plantains and sacks of macabo and cassava in bulk in order to re-sell them. But her limited capital restricts her from doing this, which is where the need for this loan to bolster her business comes in. This loan will increase capital, her sales, and thereby her profits. She will save her profits to grow her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of cassavas, macabo and bunches of plantains

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 43 años, está casado con Victoria quien es madre de sus 02 hijos.  Vive en su casa propia junto a su familia. Victo se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, en su tienda la cual siempre se encuentra abierta desde muy temprano, es por eso que sus múltiples clientes van en busca de algún artículo o producto de primera necesidad ya que saben que lo encontraran y que serán atendidos con su amplia sonrisa y un buen trato, tiene 8 años en su negocio. Le gusta su negocio pues no tiene que salir mucho de casa  y puede apoyar a sus hijos con las tareas escolares. Agradece mucho  el apoyo que le brinda su menor  hija,  quien está siempre a su lado para ayudarle algunas veces en la atención de sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 3000, está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos y mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceites, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas y otros, para poder ofrecer en mayor cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victor is 43 years old and is married to Victoria, the mother of his two children. He lives in his own home with his family. Victor works selling groceries is his store, which is open from very early in the day. His many customers come looking for some basic food item or product because they know they will find it and that they will be looked after kindly and with a big smile.

Victor has had this business for eight years, and he likes it because he does not have to leave the house very much and he can help his children with their schoolwork. He is very grateful for the help of his youngest daughter, who is always at his side to help him look after customers.

Victor is requesting this loan of 3000 PEN to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, candy and soft drinks to be able to offer larger quantities and variety to his customers. He is very happy to know that he has this financial support, and he feels confident in being able to advance his business. He promises to again make is payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, candy and soft drinks for his grocery store.

loans.name: Ma. Lorna

texts.en: Ma. Lorna has just started a Sari-sari store business in San Miguel, Bohol. This is in hope of helping her husband in raising their family which is compose of three children aged 2, 6 and 11. Ma. Lorna requested a loan at CEVI to buy and increase her inventory. She intend to use the loan to buy cigarettes, liquors, tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar and bath soap. It is her dream to make a bigger store someday, increase her business profits and provide the needs of her children for a good life in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, liquors, tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar and bath soap

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married and has 4 children. In addition to their own children, they have more 4 other people to be cared for in their family.

He started by growing 1/2 an acre of sorghum. He sold it and realized some profit which he committed to business of buying and selling dry cassava and other produce.

Given a loan of $500 to this bussiness, they plan to increase the stock of the produce to be taken to Soroti or Mbale town for better profit. They will target the most needed items by their middleman's market.

Right now the capital amount of money that they have is 520,000 Uganda shillings that is equivalent to $300. This capital is very little for this bussiness to excel.

These people are respected in the community as people of integrity. He attained business skills training with Village Enterprise Fund He is capable of handling the loan money and refunding it.

loans.use: Increase the stock of the produce to be taken to Soroti or Mbale town for better profit.

loans.name: Monica Alejandra

texts.en:
Monica has three children and it is she that supports them financially with the income that she gains from the business she manages, the sale of seasonal items. She lived through very difficult times. She started her business because her husand abandoned her and he never returned. Today she and her children live with some family members, as she cannot afford to rent their own home. This is why she works arduously every day, with the dream of being able to save enough money to purchase a small plot of land and build a home for her children.

To realize her dreams, Monica needs to purchase more merechandise to increase her sales and her income. But she does not have enough funds to do so, which is why she needs a loan of $250. You can make her Monica's dream a reality. Do not leave her, she needs you and she thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mónica tiene 3 hijos y es ella quien lo sostiene económicamente con los ingresos que obtiene de la actividad comercial que realiza, la venta de artículos de temporada. Ella ha vivo momentos muy complicados, pues ella comenzó con esta actividad debido a que su esposo la abandonó y no volvió jamás. Actualmente ella y sus hijos viven en casa de uno de sus familiares, ya que no puede pagar una renta para vivir en una casa aparte. Por esta situación ella trabaja cada día arduamente con la ilusión de poder ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un pequeño terreno y construirles una casa a sus hijos.

Para poder lograr sus sueños, Mónica requiere comprar más mercancía para poder aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos, pero ahora no cuenta con el capital necesario, es por ello que necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 DLLS. Tú puedes hacer realidad lo que Mónica tanto desea, no la abandones, ella te necesita y te lo agradece.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is a hairdresser and has her own business, C's Hair Salon. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva for working capital

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
G. Asif Mirzaga oglu is a 38 year old farmer and head of an IDP (internally displaced persons) family settled in Buldug village in the Sabirabad region. His family consists of 2 children, his parents, wife and himself. He has a small business in animal husbandry. This business is his second income source for his family. Asif is the only earner in the family. His first income is as a teacher. Through his animal husbandry business all family members participate in the income making process. But the business is very small. 
He applied for credit to Agroinvest for 1200 USD to purchase additional animals, because he has a large enough facility to keep them.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina R. R. is 36 and has seven children between the ages of 6 and 18. She's taking out her third loan with Friendship Bridge after two previous successful repayments. This time she will invest in a calf to raise for milk production and in a number of chicks. Last time around she invested in four sheep and now has a flock of nine. Her plan is to buy another calf with the proceeds from the sale of the sheep and thus make another step forward for the family. Catarina also has a little tiny store that serves her rural neighborhood.

Catarina is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a calf to raise for milk production and chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Nima

texts.en:
Nima is forty-six years old and married with seven children. She runs a business selling used clothes which she started two years ago. With an unemployed husband, Nima is the main breadwinner for the family.

Her previous loans enabled Nima to increase her stock and generate more profit. She purchased a sewing machine with the profit and has put it for rent for more income. Nima says most of her income goes to her children’s education requirements and food. She now needs another loan to allow her to further expand the business.

loans.use: Diversify her business further to generate maximum profits

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis and his young wife, who is 22, are dedicated to raising and selling alpacas. They started their small breeding center with only six alpacas that their parents gave them when they decided to form a family. Now, after three years and with two children of their own, the number of animals has increased notably, thanks to the diligence and dedication that they put into their work. Presently they have 55 animals. Sometimes their work is very exhausting and straining, but at the same time rewarding, due to the favorable results that they are obtaining. Luis's wish is to buy better breeding alpacas to keep growing in this noble work. This is why he's requesting a loan that will turn into a good investment in the hands of this young entrepreneur with many dreams of prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Luis y su joven esposa Celia de 22 años de edad, están dedicados a la crianza y comercialización de alpacas. Ellos iniciaron su pequeño centro de crianzas teniendo sólo seis alpacas que sus padres les regalaron cuando decidieron formar su hogar; ahora después de tres años y con dos niños por quienes velar, la cantidad de sus animales se ha incrementado notablemente, gracias a la diligencia y dedicación que pusieron en su trabajo.Actualmente cuentan con 55 animalitos y debido a este hecho es que a veces su labor suele ser muy agotadora y esforzada pero al mismo tiempo recompensada por los resultados favorables que van obteniendo.El deseo de Luis es comprar alpacas reproductoras y mejoradas, para seguir creciendo en esta noble labor, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo que se convertirá en una buena inversión en las manos de este joven emprendedor con muchos deseos de prosperar.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of better breeding alpacas to increase the quanity of animals and profits.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 37 years old, married, and looks after his own six children as well as three orphans. For the past 15 years, he has been packing dried beans and peas into sacks for wholesale. The 50 -100kg sacks are sold wholesale to retail stores who then weigh out the amount requested by customers. James is also a subsistence farmer. The farm land of the Ntugamo District, where he lives, is quite fertile and it is not uncommon for farmers to be able to grow extra crops for sale. James is a particularly good farmer who stands out because of the large volume of dried goods he can provide for sale.

loans.use: James plans to use his loan to improve his farm.

loans.name: Limpia's Group

texts.es:
The contact for the creation of this group was a woman who was a member of another group in the same region. She was told about the program by Sra. Agustina S., and later she organized her neighbors to form this group.

Limpia A., Mónica A., Agustina S. and Mirtha G. sell clothing and lingerie. They will invest their money in the purhcase of merchandise such as t-shirts, pants, bermuda shorts, skirts, undergarments, etc.

Sra. Ydalina L. sells ice cream and soft drinks. She will invest her money in the purchase of soda, ice cream, beer, etc.; Sra. Amalia G. sells milk and wants to invest her moeny in the purchase of food for her dairy cows.

Sras. Ricarda G., Clemencia Martínez, and Ángela R. sell food for breakfast, lunch and snacks. These women will each invest in the purhcase of ingredients for the preparation of their meals: noodles, milk, flour, salt, meat, cooking oil, etc.

Sra. Graciela sells produce, Sras. Mirna S., Irene A. and Nélida M. each own their own shop where they sell staples like sugar, canned goods, flour, noodles, fruit and vegetables; they will all invest their loan funds in the purchase of merchandise for sale.

Aida G. sells novelty goods. She will invest her money in the purchase of different articles for sale, such as picture frames, makeup, school supplies, etc., and Maria G., who is a midwife, will invest her money in the purchase of supplies such as towels, disposable gloves and medications.

In the photograph the women are shown, accompanied by two American visitors who came to Paraguay several months ago to work with Funcacion Paraguay working on different projects, including Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva volunteer.

El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue una mujer que pertenecía a otro comité de la misma zona y le informó sobre el programa a la señora Agustina S., luego de eso, ella organizó a sus vecinas para formar el comité.

Limpia A., Mónica A., Agustina S. y Mirtha G., se dedican a la venta de ropas y lencería, ellas invertirán su dinero en la compra de mercaderías como remeras, pantalones, bermudas, faldas, ropa interior, etc.

la señora Ydalina L. se dedica a la venta de helados y bebida, ella invertirá su dinero en la compra de gaseosa, helados, cerveza, etc.; la señora Amalia G. se dedica en la venta de leche y desea invertir su dinero en la compra de alimentos para sus vacas.

Las señoras Ricarda G., Clemencia Martínez, y Ángela R. se dedican a la venta de comidas para desayunos, almuerzos y comidas rápidas, estas señoras invertirán cada una en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas como: fideos, leche, harina, sal, carne, aceite, etc

. Las señora Graciela V. vende verduras, las señoras Mirna S., Irene A. y Nélida M. poseen cada una sus tiendas en donde venden todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como azúcar, productos enlatados, harina, fideos, frutas y verduras; las mismas invertirán sus créditos para la compra de mercaderías.

Aida G. se dedicará a la venta de artículos de mercería, ella invertirá su dinero en la compra de diferentes artículos para la venta como porta retratos, maquillaje, artículos escolares, etc. y Maria G. quien es partera, invertirá su dinero en la compra de utensilios como toallas, guantes desechables y medicamentos.

En la foto aparecen las señoras, acompañadas de dos pasantes estadounidenses que vinieron a Paraguay hace unos meses atrás para realizar una pasantía en Fundación Paraguaya trabajando en diferentes proyectos, entre ellos Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of milk, sugar, tea, flour, soft drinks, dairy products, t-shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, undergarments, picture frames, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his clothing business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. is a widow and supports her 1 child.  She has been selling clothing materials for 5 years.  Mary takes her clothing materials to seamstresses who buy them and turn them into men’s and women’s clothes.  She is requesting $425 to buy additional clothing patterns so she can attract more customers. Mary is also a member of a lending group called, “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing patterns so she can attract more customers.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.es:
Nancy and Edith have been members of the Sol Radiante (Radiant Sun) Community Bank for 1 year and 4 months, respectively.

Nancy lives with her boyfriend, is 23 years old and has a 6-year-old daughter. She sells breakfast made of grain products such as soy and maca (Peruvian ginseng) in a small marketplace in her neighborhood. She also has sold sweets near a school entrance for the last 3 years.

Edith is single and 28 years old. She has run a beauty salon on a busy block in Ayacucho for the last 2 years.

Nancy and Edith need a loan of 400 soles (about $150) and 1,000 soles (about $375), which they will use to purchase liquids, dyes, peroxide, display cases and tables, in order to sell more products.

Nancy and Edith’s dream is for their children to have professional careers. They also would like to expand their business and have several branches.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Nancy y Edith pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sol Radiante hace 1 año, 4 meses respectivamente.

Nancy es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hija de 6 años, Nancy vende desayunos elaborados con cereales como soya y maca, sus ventas lo realiza en un mercadillo de su zona . Además Nancy vende golosinas en la puerta de un colegio, actividad que realiza hace 3 años.

Mientras que Edith es soltera y tiene 28 años, Edith tiene un salón de belleza en una cuadra concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza hace 2 años.

Nancy y Edith necesitan un préstamo de 400 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de líquidos, tintes, oxigenta, vitrinas y mesas para vender más productos.

Lo sueños de Nancy y Edith son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar sus negocios y tener sucursales.

loans.use: Purchase of liquids, dyes, peroxide, display cases and tables

loans.name: Nasirullo

texts.en: Nasirullo K. is 38 years old and is married with six children. Nasirullo sells foodstuffs like tea, sunflower oil, baby food, soft drinks and sweets. He rents a place for selling which is located in one of the local markets. Nasirullo has been running his own small business for 2 years. At the same time he raises cattle. His wife, who is pictured in the photo, helps Nasirullo with sales. The business is the main source of income and at the same time requires considerable funding. Nasirullo works very hard to give his dear children a good education and to make them happy. In order to cover the higher education expenses of his elder son as he’s going to enter the university, Nasirullo is planning to increase his working capital in order to increase the range of his selling goods. Besides he wants to purchase small cattle in order to increase the number of his cattle. Today Nasirullo requests $1200.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. Nasirullo thanks everyone for support and promises to pay the loan in time. Nasirullo is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Nasirullo’s business.

loans.use: Nasirullo would like to purchase foodstuffs for increasing the range of goods in his store and small cattle to raise.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a well-known businessman in Primorsk, a town at the Azov sea. He offers entertainment services for tourists who visit the resort areas at the seaside. Some of the fun options he offers are water scooters, catamarans and banana boats (a banana-shaped airboat, pulled by a motor speedboat). The location of his business is very favorable as it is a busy beach with lots of tourists who come to swim and tan there. Many seek entertainment and fun and that's exactly what Alexander’s business is all about.

In the summer season he usually makes about 3000 Ukranian Hryvnias a month. He has about 9000 Ukranian Hryvnias invested in inventory right now. Alexander is seeking a loan for $550 US to provide quality equipment maintenance this summer season. He is hoping to have a second start-up and open a vending facility in the market, too. Alexander believes this summer season is going to bring him good profits, providing a decent livelihood to his family.

loans.use: For equipment maintenance

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
For 10 years, Maribel and her sister have made a living selling pastries. She's responsible for making the pastries and distributing them to bakeries, markets and schools. She's been in poor health recently and has had to leave the business in the hands of her sister. She hopes to recover soon and return to the business. In the meantime, she's been selling clothes to order.

The loans that she's applied for have been used to buy wholesale supplies of the ingredients that she needs to make her pastries. Maribel would like to have her own bakery and leave a person there to sell. She wants to continue delivering the pastries and finding new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 10 años, Maribel se dedica a la venta de pasteles junto con su hermana. Ella se encarga de preparar los pasteles y repartirlos a panaderías, mercados y colegios. Sin embargo, Maribel se encuentra delicada de salud, por lo que ha dejado el negocio en manos de su hermana. Espera recuperarse pronto y volver a su negocio. También ha vendido ropa por pedidos.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita para hacer sus pasteles. Maribel quisiera tener su propia panadería y dejar una persona encargada de las ventas. Ella desea seguir repartiendo pasteles y buscar nuevos clientes.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for bakery business.

loans.name: Mwajuma's Uvivu Si Kazi Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 26 years old and married with 3 children, aged 10, 4 and 2. She has been a charcoal, firewood and snacks seller since in 2005. Every day she works from 6 AM to 10 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Mwajuma now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Zuhura and Khadija, who also have businesses dealing with the sale of fish, clothes, and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal & firewood for her business.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang H., 41, is a widower and lives with four children. Living in Kampong Cham, he is able to make around US$ 2.50 each day from construction work. He has been a construction worker since 1998. He told a loan officer that he sometimes needs to go outside of the village to find construction work.

One of his children is still a student and the others are employed at different jobs to support the family. As now he is getting older, he needs to find other jobs for himself that use little labor and make easy profit. Currently, he is requesting a loan from Kiva to breed pigs for extra profit.

loans.use: To breed pigs for extra profit

loans.name: Mario De La Cruz

texts.es: Don Mario tiene 48 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y tiene tres hijos de 23, 25 y 30 años de edad, su esposa es comerciante y juntos salen a vender en los diferentes barrios de Managua. El negocio de Mario es la venta de elotes, creolinas, pinesol,  y otros productos de limpiezas, son cinco años de experiencias en las ventas e iniciaron con fondos propios. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en los productos variados de la limpieza y comprar otros productos para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad. Espera en un futuro poder establecer su negocio de manera formal para no estar saliendo a las calles a vender.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario, 48, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He is married with three children ages 23, 25 and 30. His wife is in business, they sell together in the various neighborhoods of Managua. Mario's business is selling corn, disinfectants, pinesol and other cleaning products. He has been in sales for 5 years and began with his own equity. He is requesting this loan in order to invest in various cleaning products and to buy additional products to offer to his varied clientele. He hopes in the future to be able to establish his business in a permanent way so he won't have to be out selling in the streets.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning products for the home

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
"Muraho!" (Greetings!) from Jean N. from Burera, in the northern province of Rwanda! Jean is 35 years old, married with 5 children, and he owns a small local bar selling locally produced beer: “Sorghum beer". He buys it in 5 jerry-cans of 20 litres each and sells it to the local people. Besides selling the local beer, he also roasts goat meat which local people enjoy, especially in the evenings after hard work on their farms.

This client is looking for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to buy more beer for his customers and goats to slaughter for meat to roast. This roasted meat is commonly called "brochettes". He will also buy other equipment for his beer garden such as tables, clean cups, and bottles and increase his beer stocks for this Christmas season! This loan will be repaid over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his pub and more sorghum beer

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The group is comprised of three people. The borrowers live in Knasondaiy Commune in Siem Reap Province.

Mrs. Hing E., 30, runs a store in her home selling rice. Her profits are the main source of income for her family. She has been in this business for a year. She also takes care of four children, all of whom are single and live at home. Her husband, Mr. Pot Chanty, 37, is in the Cambodian military and receives a salary of $50 per month. To expand the business, Hing is applying for a $400 loan to order more rice to store and sell.

Mrs. Chin P., 29, a widow, is a local grocery seller. She needs a $400 loan to buy mores groceries to sell.

Mrs. Chen P., 33, makes a living selling fish at the local market. Chen is requesting a loan of $200 to buy a motorcycle to make transportation easier.

Mrs. E., Mrs. P.'s husband, and Mrs. P. are pictured.

loans.use: to order more rice to store and resell

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La Sra. Susana Ines R. de Zárate es de la ciudad de Quiindy esta casada con el Sr. Hugo José Zárate, tiene tres hijos y habita en casa propia.

                La familia es propietaria de una casa  comercial dedicada a la venta de muebles y electrodomésticos con una antigüedad de más de diez años, empresa que surgió de la iniciativa de la Señora teniendo en cuenta que en ese entonces había pocos comerciantes que se dedicaban a este rubro.
                Con el crédito obtenido pudo realizar la compra de una oferta de electrodomésticos para la temporada de verano, que le dejará un buen margen de utilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Susana Ines R. de Zárate is from the city of Quiindy; she's married to Mr. Hugo José Zárate, has three children and they live in their own home. The family has owned their furniture and appliance store for ten years. Mrs. R. de Zárate started the business back when there were few businesses like it. With this loan she will be able to to advantage of an offer on electric appliances for the summer season which will provide her with a good profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electric fans

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es:
José Jaime S. S. tiene un hijo en un centro de rehabilitación a causa de un accidente que tuvo toda la familia. Ahora el muchacho necesita estar al cuidado de personas especializadas para su pronta recuperación. Este centro pide su pagos cada 4 meses el cual este señor no completa para pagar ahora el solicita la cantidad de $10,000 pesos.
El y su esposa recibe pensionados de una institución de México a ella se la dieron por su años trabajado y a el por discapacidad.
texts.en:
José Jaime S. S. has a son at a rehabilitation center following an accident the family had. Now his son needs to be cared for by specialists to speed up his recovery. This center is asking for payment every 4 months, and this man is unable to pay the full amount. He is requesting a loan of $10,000 pesos. He and his wife both receive a pension from a Mexican institution--she for her years of work and for he for his disabilities.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rehabilitation Center

loans.name: Darling

texts.en:
Darling A. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Darling is 21 years old, married, and has 4 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. She lives with her family in the Nyalenda area of Kisumu.

Darling has been selling used clothing in her Nyalenda neighborhood since 2005. She is a primary school dropout who was initially working in a hotel in the town of Rongo. When she moved to Kisumu she decided to start selling used clothes because it is a beneficial business that enables her to make large profits. She sells ladies' and children’s dresses. Darling purchases her inventory from Kibuye Market in Kisumu.

She has requested her first loan from K-MET – a loan of approximately $150. Darling will use the money to buy a larger stock of clothing.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor vive en la calle “ Loayza ”  de la zona San Felipe de Seke en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa  y  sus hijos en su casita propia ubicada en una zona periférica de la ciudad.
 
Trabaja como costurero junto a su esposa, en la confección de buzos deportivos, los cuales los distribuye al por mayor y los vende en la frontera Perú Boliviana
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de telas al por mayor y así abaratar sus costos. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Nestor lives on “Loayza” Street in the San Felipe area of Seke in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and children in their own small home located in the outlying area of the city.

He works with his wife, sewing sports apparel, which he distributes wholesale and sells on the Perú Boliviana border.

The loan will be used to buy materials at wholesale, lowering his costs. This is his first loan with Impro, the evaluation of Nestor qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of material for making sports apparel.

loans.name: Gyssel Carolina

texts.es: La Joven Gleyssel Carolina R. A. tiene 22 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. La  Joven Gleyssel tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado municipal, su esposo labora en una finca de capataz ya que ambos están contribuyendo a la educación de sus hijos. Es por eso que los propósitos de Gleyssel es mejorar la atención al cliente ya que muchas veces posee mucha demanda, es por eso que con ciertas técnicas que ha implementado a su negocio podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes la atención que se merecen. Y solo con el financiamiento invertirá en  capital de trabajo y así comprara productos como granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, aceite, café, jabón entre otros. Los sueños de Gleyssel son de mantener su negocio con un buen inventario y así proporcionar lo que sus clientes soliciten. La cantidad que solicita es de C$14.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Gleyssel Carolina R. A. is 22 and is married. Gleyssel has had a small grocery store for more than three years. Her business is located in the local market. Her husband works as a foreman on a farm, and both are contributing to the education of their children. Gleyssel's goal is to improve her customer service since many times she has a lot of demand. This is why she has implemented certain tecniques in her business to offer her customers the service that they deserve. With this financing, she will invest in working capital and buy products like basic grains, rice, beans, oil, coffee, soap, etc. Gleyssel's dream is to maintain her business with a good inventory and offer what her customers request. The amount of the loan she is requesting is 14,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Awawu

texts.en: Awawu is 39 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs, provisions, and kerosene. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions, and kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, provisions, and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe Rolando

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Guadalupe Rolando D. H. le está haciendo falta el vitropiso pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder llevar acaba la mejora. 
  Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poner lo más pronto posible el vitropiso ya que su esposa la señora   Fidencia García está pronto D. tener a su hijo y quiere que tenga un buen hogar donD. vivir.
  La persona que nos atendió cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor Guadalupe fue la señora Fidencia quien aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Rolando D. H.' home doesn't have flooring, but at the moment he doesn't have the necessary funds to make the improvements. It's for this reason he is requesting a loan to put in a tile floor as soon as possible because his wife, Fidencia Garcia, will soon give birth to a son and he wants to proviD. him with a good home. The person who met us when we maD. our visit to Guadalupe's home was Fidencia, so she is the one in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put in tile flooring throughout his home

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
Vidalina es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Vidalina es soltera, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Vidalina de dedica a la agricultura de verduras en terrenos alquilados, la venta de sus productos los realiza en el mercado de abastos al por mayor y también compra las verduras de los productores y luego los comercializa. Además Vidalina viaja a las ferias y compra cereales.
Vidalina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su carro con el cual trasporta las verduras.
Los sueños de Vidalina son comprar un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Vidalina is a member of the community bank of Tulipanes. She grows vegetables in a rented field, and sells what she harvests, as well as what she purchases from other farmers, in the wholesale food market. Vidalina also travels to fairs and buys grains. Vidalina needs a loan of 600 soles which she will invest in the repair of the car that she uses to transport her vegetables. Her dreams are to buy a place in the wholesale market of Ayacucho and to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the car she uses to transport vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy protection for the windows

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: Doña Maria Lourdes M. tiene la edad de 54 años, reside en el bario Hialeah en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo de oficio taxista, sus hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Trabaja de cocinera desde hace veinte años es un trabajo agitado y de mucho exigencia ya que los alimentos tienen que quedar buenos. Por falta de financiamientos y de recursos no ha podido poner su propio negocio. Sus planes es poder seguir construyendo su casa, con este crédito lograra comprar materiales de construcción y construir un muro para tener seguridad. Su meta es poder poner un pequeño comedor y vender variedad de alimentos ya que tiene la experiencia adquirida y lograr una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Lourdes M. is 54 years old and resides in the Hialeah neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a taxi driver and they have adult children who live independently. She has been a cook for the past twenty years. The work is long and hectic, and demands that her food always be good.

Due to lack of funding and resources, she has not been able to open her own business. Her plan is to continue with the construction of her house. With this loan, she will purchase materials to build a security wall. Her goal is to build a small diner and sell a variety of dishes, since she has the requisite experience. She hopes this will improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: preparation and sale of food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions of various types

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: arame N. est parent beneficiaire depuis plus de sept ans elle capitalise pluseurs annees d'experience dans la ventes de provisions alimentaires.parallelement aussi elle exerce la vente de parfums.face a l'accroissement de la demande de ses produits elle sollicite un credit de cinquante mille(50 000)frs pour renforcer son fond de roulement.son activite lui permet de participer a l'entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Arame N. has been a parent beneficiary for more than seven years, and has gained many years' experience in the sale of food items. At the same time, she also runs a business selling perfumes. Faced with an increase in demand for her products, she is seeking a loan for 50,000 CFA to strengthen her working capital. Her business allows her to participate in supporting her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more food goods

loans.name: Géronime Mèdélidji

texts.fr: T. Géronime Mèdélidji est née le 01/01/1963 à Abomey Calavi. Géronime Mèdélidji est mariée à HESSOU Valère, un électricien. Ce couple a à sa charge six enfants dont cinq sont les leurs. La famille réside à Akpokpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Géronime Mèdélidji vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Géronime Mèdélidji a fait juste le cours primaire ; maintenant elle vend les condiments de sauce (tomate, oignon, cube, piment, ail, poivre, légumes, etc.) et les produits vivriers (haricot, riz, maïs, farine de manioc, sorgho, etc.). C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Géronime Mèdélidji achète ses produits et elle les vend chez elle à la maison. Géronime Mèdélidji a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Géronime Mèdélidji a eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Géronime Mèdélidji demande un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
T. Géronime Mèdélidji was born on January 1, 1963 in Abomey Calavi. She is married to HESSOU Valère, an electrician.  This couple has six children to support.  Five of them are their own.  The family resides in Akpokpota, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  Thanks to the income from her business, she comes to her husband's aid in covering family expenses.  Géronime Mèdélidji only completed elementary school;  now, she is selling sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, bouillon cubes, chili peppers, garlic, black pepper, vegetables, cassava flour, sorghum, etc.).  Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where she purchases her goods, which she sells out of her house.  She already has three years of experience in this business.  Géronime Mèdélidji had three ALIDé loans before and has repaid them.  She was able to use them to raise her level of business.  To continue to develop her business, Géronime is asking for a fourth loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sauce condiments and staple foods

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Miguelina is the coordinator of her group. Her story is representative both of the members of her group as well as Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR) clients more generally. Her group is based in Santiago, the second largest town in the DR, which is a region known for agricultural production and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure of concrete walls, a tin roof and a dirt floor with her husband and two children.

Miguelina has just completed her first loan cycle with Esperanza and she is excited to take out her second loan. With this loan she plans to further invest in her business selling candles in her neighborhood. She has identified a market for candles in her neighborhood as a result of the frequent, extended blackouts common in her area. She believes that this business will provide a steady income and improve her quality of life and the lives of her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Candles to sell

loans.name: Sueba

texts.en:
Sueba is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Sueba sells provisions, and has been in this business for over 12 years now. She has been in LAPO for over 2 years. Sueba is soliciting a loan of 70,000 to purchase more provisions to sell so she can meet the high demands of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells foodstuffs like melon seeds, tomatoes, etc. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She hopes to be a foodstuff distributor in the future. She is 56 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a retired government worker. She sells long hours to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her immediate family members. She has been in this business for a long time. Joy hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kukatoner Group

texts.en:
Varney M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called “Kukatoner”. He is a 25-year-old student who’s fending for himself through business. He lives in Arthington but works in the Molton corner, Brewerville community, north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Varney’s business is growing and selling vegetables. He grows vegetables to be sold at retail to residents of Molton corner. He has been running this business for two years and is hoping to improve his business to establish a large farm in the future. He sells good vegetables at an affordable price in order to encourage customers to continue buying from him.

Varney started by burning charcoal but decided to get into agriculture. The only problem he encounters is the rainy season because when it rains heavily, it spoils his crops.

Varney needs this loan to purchase fertilizer and other chemicals for his garden to improve business. He dreams of giving his children a better education and building a house for them.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other chemicals for his garden

loans.name: Ork

texts.en: Ork A. is a 45-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province. To earn a living, Ork A. sells a few mold cakes that she produces from her home to her  village neighbours, normally earning about $1.50 a day. She is married to Mao My, 55, a taxi driver, and they have six children, two of whom are married while the rest are single. Two of their children are employed: a daughter is a garment worker and a son works in construction. Ork A. is requesting a loan to buy a used motorcycle for her employed children to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 46 years old and lives with her husband and four sons in a house in the Tuv province of Mongolia. Her youngest son is in high school, and the next older one is in university.

Bayarmaa operates a retail clothing business out of a stall in a local trading center. She began her business in 2005 after working as a salesperson in another person's clothing business. At first, her working capital was 400,000 MNT, but her business grew quickly and steadily so that now her working capital exceeds 5,500,000 MNT.

Because of her business success, she was able to purchase a house for her family to live in as well as send one of her sons to study in Korea. She says, “I plan to continue to grow my business in the future in order to help my children with their finances.”

Bayarmaa is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a car which will be used to transport her clothing from China and Ulaanbaatar back to her shop.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 34 years old and she just got married to a police officer. She is the owner of a Beauty Home where she makes different hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions, bags and shoes and has been in this business for a long time.

Cynthia needs a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more hair extensions, shoes and bags to sell. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

Cynthia is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar G. is a 51-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Talakdan, Cuayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living operating a repair shop and buying and selling rice. Pilar’s husband helps her run the business and they have nine grown up children. Some of them have their own families, while the others work to help cover the household needs.

Pilar joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family's income with her repair shop and from buying and selling rice. Now she earns an average monthly income of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities.

Pilar is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her repair shop and rice business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 13th loan, in the amount of 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use on her repair shop and to buy more rice to resell. Pilar is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem  that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa del Carmen T. J. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar en construcción, así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad los cuales estudian educación básica en la escuela del lugar. Rosa posee una venta de tortillas desde hace un par de años atrás, debido a la necesidad que su familia, Rosa tomó la decisión de convertirse en la ayuda económica de su esposo, lo cual le permitió solventar junto a su esposo todos los gastos del hogar. Ella trabaja haciendo y vendiendo las tortillas en el mediodía y en las noches, contado con la ventaja de ser la única tortillería en los alrededores de su hogar, gracias a esto Rosa cuenta con un negocio muy estable el cual le permite obtener ganancias muy buenas. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, para de esta manera atender mayor cantidad de clientes y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa del Carmen T. J. is 30 years old and a resident of the Department of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband, who is a construction worker, and their two dependent children who are studying in a basic education program at the local school. Rosa started selling tortillas two years out of family necessity. She decided that she should help her husband with covering their household expenses.

Rosa makes and sells tortillas at noon and in the evenings. She has the advantage of being the only tortilla stand in her neighborhood. Rosa has been able to build a very stable business that generates good revenues. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy corn in bulk so that she can serve more customers and generate a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn in bulk

loans.name: Santos Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Santos Antonio O. B., tiene la edad de 35 años vive en el Barrio Los Rios es acompañado y su mujer trabaja como comerciante, ellos son una familia de cuatro miembros, tienen dos hijos de las edades de 15 y 13 años, ellos ayudan a sus padres en los trabajos del campo y estudian la secundaria. La familia O. se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 16 años.

Ellos siembran Piña, y uno de los principales problemas que han experimentado dede mucho tiempo atras, ha sido la afectación de las plagas a los cultivos y las enfermedades del suelo, es por esta razon que ellos solicitan se le apoye en la compra de fertilizantes que aporten un buen mantenimiento a sus tierras y con esto producir un producto de calidad que se venda a un buen precio y que les garantize un aumento en los ingresos que venga a beneficiar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Santos Antonio O. B., age 35, lives in the Los Rios neighborhood with his life partner. She works as a businesswoman. There are four members in their family. They have two children, ages 15 and 13. The children go to high school and help their parents with the field work. The O. family has been in farming for 16 years. They grow pineapples. Pests that attack the crops and bad soil are the main problems they have had for some time. That is why they are asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to provide good maintenance for their land. This way they will produce a good quality product, which will sell for a good price. It will guarantee them an increase in earnings, which will benefit the family’s living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mayquelin

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	La Sra.
