Mayquelin H. es profesora de secundaria de unos de los colegio del municipio ubicado en la zona de san pablo, el dinero lo solicita para compra de un electrodoméstico una refrigeradora para el hogar, es casada tiene dos niños menores uno de ellos en edad escolar. El crédito que obtuvo anteriormente lo invirtió en la terminación de su casa y este va a comprar un electrodoméstico la Sra. H. se siente agradecido con ceprodel ya que estos créditos le han ayudado mucho a salir adelante y tener su casa terminada.
texts.en:
Mayquelin H. is a secondary school teacher in one of the city's schools, located in the San Pablo neighborhood. She needs funds to buy a refrigerator for her home. She is married and has two, minor children, one of whom is still school-aged. She used her previous loan to finish her house and will use this one to buy an electrical appliance. Mrs. H. is grateful to Ceprodel because the loans have helped her a lot to get ahead and finish her house .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace W. G. is forty years old and the mother of a son aged ten years. She sells clothes and handbags at Mwembe Tayari market in Mombasa. She has been doing this business for ten years. She says the business is good and the only challenge is that rent is very expensive and security is also compromised as the premises are shared. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow her business. She hopes to work hard to open her own boutique. She is a very hard-working lady.

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El Señor  Blas G., tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, ambos en edad escolar.
Para poder comenzar con esta actividad trabajaba como chofer en una distribuidora de productos embutidos, de apoco fue vendiendo en forma independiente, hasta que montó su propio negocio.
    Esta actividad ya lo realiza hace aproximadamente 2 años, ya no trabaja en forma dependiente, pero ese trabajo le ayudó a conseguir sus clientes actuales.
    El negocio tiene mucho éxito, porque ofrece los productos a un precio menor y con mayor calidad que sus competidores.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de más mercaderías (embutidos en gran cantidad como, fiambres, mortadelas, chorizos, panchos, y otros), para tener una mayor diversidad de productos.
 El deseo del Señor Blas es ampliar su local, para una mayor comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blas is 45 years old and has two children who are both of school age. To be able to start his current activity, he worked as a driver for a distributor of cured meats, and little by little began selling independently until he was able to set-up his own business. He has been doing this for about 2 years and no longer works for anyone else, but his previous work helped him to find his current clients. The business is very successful because he offers products at a lower price and higher quality than his competitors. The requested loan is for buying more merchandise (cured meats in large quantity such as cold cuts, bologna, chorizos, hot dogs, and others) so he can offer a greater variety of products. Blas' wish is to expand his premises so that he can offer greater comfort to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cured meats

loans.name: Emelita's Group

texts.en:
Emelita B. is from the village of San Luis, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Emelita is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Emelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
In the small town of Katikara in Uganda lives a gentle man called John. He is the father of six and operates a motorcycle spare parts shop. He is aged 37 years and is the breadwinner for his family in terms of their welfare and paying school fees for his children. He dreams of educating them to university level so that they can be independent and responsible citizens.

John first operated a produce business in which he would buy and sell dry foods but later left it to start the spare parts shop for motorcycles which has now operated for six years. This is his third loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to purchase motorcycle tires and oil to sell.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle tires and oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and three young children in Lebanon. Ten years ago he started working for a company by transporting supplies. In 2006, he purchased his own minivan and started working on his own.

He is now requesting a $1,200 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve the van's condition and paint it.

loans.use: To improve the van's condition and paint it

loans.name: Holga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Holga ella tiene 26 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos la socia se dedica a comprar y vender granos en el mercado de San Jerónimo vino canchón, La socia también cría animales menores y vende hortalizas en algunas temporadas La socia solicita el préstamo para compra de mercadería como frejoles, maíz, papa al por  mayor para la venta de granos secos. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Holga belongs to the "Virgen Purificada - Angostura" (Purified Virgin - Angostura) village bank and lives in the Angostura district of the Saylla province in the department of Cusco. She's twenty-six-years-old, and has a common law spouse and two children. She earns her living buying and selling grains at the Vino Canchón Market in San Jerónimo. She also raises young animals and sells seasonal vegetables. She is seeking a loan to buy merchandise wholesale, including beans, corn, and potatoes to sell in their dried form. Holga values and infinitely appreciates the loans she has gotten as they have allowed her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member is seeking a loan to buy merchandise wholesale, including beans, rice, and potatoes to sell in their dried form.

loans.name: Tepa

texts.en:
Tepa I. is 49 and married with 4 children (ages 12 - 19).  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Tepa has many years of experience in this business.  Tepa needs a loan of 1500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve the business.

In 2008, Tepa joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. 

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson M. M. is 35 years old and married. He has three children between the ages of 3 months and 8 years whom he hopes to give a quality education to the university level. 

His business is located at Egoji house at the heart of the capital city of Kenya and is well known by the name Nutro General Merchants. He has been selling glass and glass accessories to customers within the city and others from far and wide. He has been doing this business for five years now and has one employee. 

He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is giving excellent customer service. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two glass-drilling machines and one glass-cutting machine to be able to drill and cut glass for clients as per their requirements. 

He sees himself owning his own plot in the future. He also hopes to grow his business and add more items that his customers demand. He describes himself as hardworking, dedicated and courageous.

loans.use: Two glass-drilling machines and one glass-cutting machine

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes L. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children. Agnes has a business that deals with all types of drinks, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more drinks, especially mineral water.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Agnes hopes to generate greater profits and to educate her children.  In the future, Agnes hopes to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more drinks like beers, mineral water, and soda

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
La Sra Fermina S. de 45 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr Luis Espinola, con quien tiene 6 hijos, cuatro mujeres y dos varones, es comerciante, tiene una pequeña despensa en su domicilio hace mas de 20  años, gracias a este negocio ella pudo ayudar a su marido en los gastos de la casa, como estudio, alimentacion y vestimenta de los hijos.
La Sra es muy trabajadora, llego a la fundacion Paraguaya a traves de una vecina, solicito apoyo crediticio para la compra de mercaderias para su despensa como fideos, panificados, lacteos, harina, huevos, gaseosas, cervezas, etc. la Sra tambien vende empanadas y sandwiches, que ella misma elabora.
Ella agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo recibido porque gracias a eso va a poder seguir creciendo en su actividad.
texts.en:
45-year old Sra. Fermina S. is married to Sr. Luis Espinola with whom she has six children, four daughters and two sons. She is a businesswoman and has run a small store out of her house for more than twenty years. Because of this store, she has been able to help her husband with household expenses such as school fees, food, and clothing for the children. Fermina is a very hardworking woman. She approached Fundación Paraguaya on the advice of a neighbour and is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her store such as pasta, baked goods, milk products, flour, eggs, soft drinks, beer etc. Fermina also sells empanadas and sandwiches which she makes herself. Fermina is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support she has received. Thanks to this support she will be able to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pasta, bread, dairy products, soft drinks & beer

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de cultivo de hortalizas, su esposo trabaja como estibador de triciclos en el mercado de Urubamba y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para la construcción de su  casa para comprar materiales de construcción.

 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luisa, 30, lives with her life partner and their two children. She alterntes her daily activities with vegetable farming. Her husband works loading and unloading three-wheeled cargo vehicles in Urubamba’s market. Together they support their children. She wants to do some home improvements and is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Zoraida Ysabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Zoraida Benítez, es casada de 50 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, es comerciante, vive en el Barrio Villa Rossana de la ciudad de Ita.
 Se dedica al comercio hace mas de 17 años, posee una despensa de nombre Villa Rossana donde atiende a una buena cantidad de clientes que se encuentran muy satisfechos con la atención y los servicios de la Sra. Zoraida.
Hace mas de 5 años que se encuentra trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya y nos comenta que se encuentra muy a gusto trabajando con la empresa y que seguirá esforzándose día a día para cumplir con sus obligaciones y seguir trabajando y de esa manera ir aumentando sus ingresos familiares y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
Ella desea seguir cargando su despensa con mercaderías para no dejar de abastecer a sus clientes, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como panificados, fideos, azúcar, harina, y otros productos de uso domestico.
texts.en:
Zoraida Benítez is 50 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the Villa Rossana area of the city of Ita. She has been in business for over 17 years, running a small grocery store called Villa Rossana. She has many customers who are satisfied with the attention and services provided by Zoraida. She has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for over 5 years and tells us that she enjoys working with the company and will continue to work hard everyday to fulfill her obligations. She will continue working in this manner and increase her family's income so that she can provide a better quality of life for her and her children. She would like to carry on stocking her grocery store with goods so that she can continue to supply her customers, and she is requesting the loan to buy products such as baked goods, noodles, sugar, flour and other everyday items.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, rice, noodles, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: God Na We Right Group

texts.en:
Yeanoh F. (pictured right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born twenty-nine years ago in Bombali District, northern Sierra Leone, Yeanoh is married to a police officer and has one child.  For four years now, Yeanoh has been selling rice. Yeanoh will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy bags of rice to add to her business.  

This is the first loan that Yeanoh and her group members have applied for a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana (holding the blue book) is a resident of Kamoki, a small industrial city known for its rice and other agricultural crops. She owns a single-room brick house where she has lived with her family for over 14 years. She is 38 years old and makes thread rolls; she gets thread from old worn sweaters and sells it to thread sellers for a profit. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband, M. L., operates a printing shop in the market where he prints newspapers, visiting and marriage cards on order. He has been doing this for over five years. Rehana has given birth to six children: three sons and three daughters, all except the youngest one in school. She and her husband work very hard to pay their children's school fees. They want them to complete their education and have successful lives. 

Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s printing business. With the loan, he will buy printer toner, paper and other supplies in bulk to fulfill larger orders on time and generate more profit. Rehana is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy printing supplies

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 32 years old. Ma. Lourdes is married and has seven children. Her eldest child is 12 years old and the youngest is only 5 months. To make a living, Ma. Lourdes owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals.

Ma. Lourdes joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha de 26 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Como no tenía oportunidades de trabajar ella comenzó a vender lotería y frutas en la calle para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. Con algunos ahorros y ayuda de su esposo que es taxista compro víveres y ubico un pequeño local de tablas en la parte delantera de su casa para la tienda. Comenzó a tener rentabilidad y se quedo con el negocio vendiendo verduras, frutas, arroz, enlatados etc. Ha venido trabajando desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, arroz, verduras y frutas para surtir mas su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener su propia casa ya que ahora la alquila.
texts.en:
Bertha is 26 years old.  She has a grocery store in the front of her home.  She lives in a peri-urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil called Duran which is noted for its deteriorating ecosystem.

As she didn't have any opportunities for work, Bertha started selling lottery tickets and fruit in the street so that she could help with her family's expenses.  With some savings and the help of her husband, who is a taxi driver, she managed to buy some groceries and set up a small premises in the front of her house for her store.  Her business began to be profitable and she stuck with it, selling vegetables, fruit, rice, canned goods, etc.  She works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.

Bertha will use her loan to buy drinks, rice, fruits and vegetables to better stock her store.  In the future, she would like to have her own home since her current house is rented.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables and drinks

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa de 32 años, vive en Santiago de María departamento de Usulután junto a su hijo de 5 años llamado Jefferson, es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta  de tortillas, negocio que comenzó por la necesidad de darle a su hijo lo necesario y velar por su bienestar.
Ella trabaja de 7:00 am a 8:00pm, la venta la realiza en su casa y en el mercado municipal  de Santiago;  María está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz, gas que son los principales materiales para preparar las tortillas, con esta ayuda ella se impulsara con materiales en su inventario para aumentar la producción de tortillas.
Sueña con tener un negocio cada día mejor y estable, que sus ventas aumenten  y que no le falten los ingresos para poder darle a su hijo la alimentación necesaria y el desarrollo.
texts.en:
María Teresa is 32 years old.  She lives in Santiago de María, in Usulután department, with her 5 year-old son called Jefferson.  She is a single mother and sells tortillas.  She started her business as she needed to provide for her son and look after his well-being.

María works from 7.00am to 8.00pm.  She sells her tortillas from her home and in Santiago town market.  María is requesting a loan to buy corn and gas which are the key materials she needs to make her tortillas.  This help will drive her business forwards as she will have materials in her inventory to increase her tortilla production.

María dreams of having a business which is better and more stable every day.  She dreams of her sales increasing and of having enough income to provide her son with the food he needs and to ensure his development.

loans.use: To buy corn and gas

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of three school-age children. He works hard because he is the main income provider for his family. He has eight years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2002. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. He cultivates citrus fruit products. Today he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work.  He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%. In the future, he is hoping to start large-scale farming.

loans.use: To purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sonia Abigail

texts.es:
Sonia B. es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos asisten a un colegio cercano a su casa, Sonia creo su negocio hace 2 años vendiendo saldos de ropa usada, debido a que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y con el paso de los meses las ventas han generado ganancias y le han dado la oportunidad de comprar pacas (ropa americana) por mayor y ella las distribuye en los asentamientos cercanos al lugar donde ella vive, y esto ha generado mayor demanda en las ventas de ropa que ella necesita poder vender a todos sus acreedores pero para ello Sonia solicita un Prestamo a FAPE y Kiva para poder comprar 14 pacas mas ya que cada paca le cuesta Q. 1,000.00.
El sueño mas grande de Sonia es ver a su familia unida siempre y a sus hijos con un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Sonia B. is married and has 4 children who attend a school near to her house. Sonia created her business 2 years ago, selling used clothing, since her husband was out of work. As the months passed, her sales generated an income and provided her with the opportunity to purchase pacas (American clothing) wholesale. She distributes it to neighbourhoods near to where she lives. This has generated greater demand than she can satisfy, so Sonia is requesting a loan from FAPE and Kiva in order to buy 14 more pacas, as each costs Q. 1,000.00.
Her greatest dream is to see her family together forever, and for her children to have a better future.

loans.use: the purchase of clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a newer and bigger store

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr:
Femme de 41 ans, mariée avec 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 11 et 27 ans.Depuis bientôt 13 ans; voyant les difficultés de sa famille et les revenus de son mari ne pouvant suffire pour prendre soin de sa famille, elle se lance dans la vente de la farine des tubercules de manioc.
Sa stratégie est d'aller acheter a la gare routière des sacs de tubercules de maniocs sèches, qu'elle écrase et se transforme en farine  dans un moulin.Cette farine de foufou est vendu au marche et cette farine est l'aliment de base , très apprécié au Congo.
Ses ventes sont de 10.000 fr a 20000frs par jour, cette activité l'aide a subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et a aider aussi a payer les frais d'écolage de son premier fils qui est universitaire.
A l'octroi de son premier prêt , elle compte renforcer son stock en achetant 10 sacs de farine et vendre au fur et a mesure que son stock s'épuise et rembourser et faire des épargnes pour atteindre ses objectifs, faire des plantations de maniocs dans son village et vendre des sacs de foufou en gros et détails .
texts.en:
Marcelline B. is a 41 year old woman, wife and mother of four children aged between 11 and 27 years old. Having seen the economic struggles of her family and given that her husband's salary was not large enough to support the entire family, she began to sell tuber and cassava root flour 13 years ago. She purchases large quantities of dried tubers and cassava root at the traveling market which she herself turns into flour with the help of a grinder. This flour, which is a staple food much appreciated in the Congo, is then sold at the market.

She earns between 10,000 and 20,000 francs a day [approximately 11 to 22 USD] which allows her to provide for her family's needs as well as help pay fees for her eldest son's university education.

She is asking for her first loan in order to purchase 10 bags of flour to sell little by little as her other stock dwindles. She would also like to begin planting cassava root areas in her village and sell bags of flour wholesale.

loans.use: Purchasing six bags of 50 kilos of cassava root flour

loans.name: Julia Josefina

texts.es:
Julia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Julia, tiene 37 años D. edad y tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad D. Urubamba del departamento del cusco y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad. 

Julia trabaja en la empresa privada llamada “Cerámicas Seminario” donD. se dedican a la elaboración D. artesanía como por ejemplo cerámica artísticos, decorativos, utilitarios, joyería, murales, esculturas y entre otros, ella trabaja desD. las 8 D. la mañana hasta 5 D. la tarD. D. lunes a sábados. Ya son 18 años que trabaja y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor.  

Julia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal con el dinero desea hacer mantenimiento D. su casa.
texts.en:
Jula belongs to “Los Solidarios” (Those in Solidarity) Communal Bank, pertaining to the Arariwa Association.  She is very grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and, also, she promises to comply with the loan's corresponding schedule of payments.

Julia is 37 years old and has 2 children.  She was born in the city of Urubamba, in Cusco department, and actually lives in that same city.

Julia works in a private enterprise called Ceramicas Seminario where she makes artisan crafts, including, for example, artistic, decorative, and utilitarian ceramics, jewelry, murals, and sculptures, among other things.  She works from 8:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon, Monday through Saturday.  She has done this for 18 years, and things are going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her labor.

On this occasion, Julia needs the loan for her personal use; with this money she wishes to carry out maintenance on her home.

loans.use: FOR PERSONAL USE, TO PERFORM MAINTENANCE ON HER HOME

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 29 years old and married with two children between the ages of 3 and 5. He has been a motorbike taxi driver for 6 months. He transports people every day from 6am until 12pm.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy essential materials for his motorbike. With any profit, he will pay school fees for his children and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy essential materials for his motorbike

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio, de 44 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo Yasmani de 17 años y esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. El cultivo de café y plátano es la actividad a la que se dedica Lucio, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a trabajar en sus chacras, con el único fin de esforzarse mucho para que sus cultivos tengan muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar debido a que los químicos pueden afectar su salud. Con el tiempo, espera sembrar más y así tener una mejor producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro aporte, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más plantas de café para ampliar sus campos cafetales.
texts.en: Lucio is 44 year old and he is a very simple and kind man. He lives in a house that is his own together with his 17-year old son, Yasmani. He is always ready to work very hard to make a living. Coffee and banana is the activity to which Lucio is dedicated. Every day from the very early morning he sets out to work on his land. His only goal is to put in a great deal of effort so that his plantations will be high in quality. What he most enjoys about his work is cultivating the land. He has 25 years in the business. The most difficult part of his work is having to fumigate because the chemicals can be harmful to his health. In time, he hopes to plant more in order to increase production. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He knows that he needs to make all of his payments on time if he wants to access a future loan. In his communal bank he is a member who has integrity and who is very active. With the one thousand nuevos soles that he requests he will purchase more coffee plants to expand his coffee plantation.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour, lard, sugar, yeast, raisins and piñatas

loans.name: Kuluva

texts.en:
Kaluva is 40 years old and married to Agnes who contributes to the family income. He lives in Matuu and his business is in Malikiti. He has been farming for a period of about 20 years with an income of about 8000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his fourth loan with Kadet and he wants to use it to buy fertilizers and seedlings. He hopes to grow a variety of crops and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Yesu Asobola Development Group

texts.en:
35-year-old Rose  (pictured with a raised hand) has been retailing for 6 years in Natete, an upscale suburb of Kampala city. 

The happily married mother of 2 says she began this business with the little savings she had from her charcoal sales business. She says that hard work has enabled her make the strides she has made over the course of the last few years. Rose also runs a small clinic. Her weekly profits are to the tune of 50,000 shillings. 

With this loan she says she is going to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, soap and rice to sell at her shop.

Aidah is not seen clearly in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar and soap to resell

loans.name: Paula Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Paula Antonia de la ciudad de Managua es una persona responsable que quiere  un mejor nivel de vida para su familia y así salir adelante para el futuro de sus hijos y que sean profesionales y ser unos excelentes trabajadores.
En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó la señora anteriormente mencionada a solicitar crédito para mejorar su vivienda que se encuentra en mal estado, este crédito lo invertirá en compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, bloques, hierro, piedrín y pagar mano de obra , para levantar pared de hogar.
texts.en:
Paula Antonia is from the city of Managua.  She is a responsible person who wants to improve her family’s standard of living and get ahead for her children’s future and that they become professionals and excellent workers.

The aforementioned woman came into Ceprodel’s office to request a loan to do some improvements to her home which is in poor state.  She will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like sand, cement, concrete blocks, iron rods and gravel and to pay labor costs to erect a wall.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Evelia Alvina

texts.es: Evelia tiene 37 años. Es una mujer muy responsable tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio como vendedora de ciertos productos como calzado y telas y al ver que obtenía suficiente ganancias con esta actividad decide seguir adelante. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar productos como sandalias, zapatos deportivos, zapatillas y telas. El sueño de ella es seguirle proporcionado mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Evelia is 37 years old.  She’s a very responsible woman; she has two children that depend on her.  Her economic activity is general merchandise sales.  She’s been in this business for over 12 years.  She started out selling certain footwear items and fabric and seeing that she earned good profits with this activity decided to continue doing it.  

She is asking for this loan to use as working capital to buy such things as sandals, athletic shoes, slippers and fabric.  Her dream is to continue doing home improvements.

loans.use: to buy sandals, athletic shoes, slippers and fabric.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 25 years old and lives in Pimampiro, Ecuador. She is single and lives with her parents and her six-month-old son. Norma is an entreprenuerial woman who is honest, humble, and has a strong desire to overcome obstacles and move forward with her son. Norma learned to plant, cultivate, and harvest from her father. She began her own farming activities sowing a cucumber crop on her father's land. Her past harvest was good, and, at this moment, she is cultivating her crops on good land. The loan she is seeking will help her buy seeds to plant beans and take care of her crops. This loan is her seventh, and she believes that she has improved the quality of life for herself, her family, and her son. Her income has increased as the production of her crops has improved. Norma's dream is to have her own house and her own farmland where she can grow her produce. Her other goals include giving her son an education, good nutrition, and proper clothing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant beans

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last six years. He is 51 years old and married to Veronicah; they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans, which he used to boost his farming, well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jeremiah hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Marta, es comerciante, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos,  se traslada a otros municipios para ofrecer la mercadería, pues ya tiene clientes a quienes les distribuye, lleva 7 años en el negocio.
Actualmente necesita financiamiento para la compra de mariscos, pues quiere incrementar la mercadería comprando al mayoreo pescado, langostas, camarón, que en su mayoría demandan los clientes.
Su visión es generar nuevas rutas de venta, pudiendo conquistar otros clientes que le permitan crecer y generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta is a saleswoman who lives with her husband and two children.  Her business is buying and selling seafood.  She travels to other towns to sell her merchandise as she already has customers who she delivers to.  She has been in this business for seven years.

Marta currently needs a loan to buy seafood as she would like to increase her stock of merchandise by purchasing fish, lobsters and shrimp wholesale.  These are the products that most of her customers request.

Marta's dream is to create new sales routes and gain new customers which will allow her to grow and make better income.

loans.use: to buy seafood (fish, lobsters and shrimp)

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra tiene la edad de 28 años, asistio a la escuela hasta la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Esequiel que trabaja de chofer y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 7 y 6 años que estudian la primaria en su comunidad.
Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 3 años inicio a vender ropa de dama y caballero con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella realiza sus ventas casa por casa e inicio a vender comunidad y poco a poco como ha ido creciendo el negocio ha entrado a vender a otras comunidades como el Cedro y Ixtacap. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa interior, vestidos, shorts para su posterior venta.
Ella espera que con esta invercion su negocio prospere ya que desea dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y continuar pagando sus estudios, tambien  nos platica que le gustaria a futuro construir un pequeño local en el cual venda sus productos.
Ella se encuentra muy agradecida por la confianza que la Fundacion le ha otorgado este prestamo.
texts.en:
Sandra is 28 years old, attended classes up to preparatory school, and is married to Esequiel, who works as a driver. They have 3 children, ages 8, 7, and 6, who study in primary school in the community.

Sandra tells us that just a little over 3 years ago, she began to sell ladies and mens clothing to friends and neighbors in her community. She sold door to door, beginning in her own community, then little by little, as her business grew, she began selling in other communities, such as Cedro and Ixtacap. Sandra needs this credit to invest in purchases of underwear, dresses, and shorts for future sales.

Sandra hopes that with this investment, her business will prosper, because she wants to offer her children a better quality of life, and to continue paying for their studies. She also wishes to construct a little shop in the future in which to sell her products.

Sandra is very grateful for the confidence that the Foundation has demonstrated in her by offering this loan.

loans.use: buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Senia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas de Agua Fría.

En este lugar vive la señora Senia, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad, la menor estudia en colegio y  los dos  aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de mariscos, el esposo trabaja los sabados y domingos en el mercado de Ayacucho, el vende todo tipo de mariscos como: pescado por libras o al menudeo, chamaron, conchas, cangrejos, etc.  De lunes a viernes él recorre por toda la localidad, el pescado lo va a comprar a Manta cada dos días. Lleva 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón, conchas, cangrejos, entre otras variedades de mariscos. Esta desde el inicio  en el banco comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y se ayudan mutuamente.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro para ir a comprar y recorrer la ciudad  con sus productos con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Damas de Agua Fría' community bank meets in Ayacucho parish, in Santa Ana canton.  This area is known for its beautiful freshwater spas which are a great tourist attraction for the canton and province.

36-year-old Senia lives here.  She has a common-law marriage and two children aged 17 and 15.  Her youngest is in school and both children still live at home.  Her husband is a salesman.

Our friend is taking this loan for her husband's seafood business.  Her husband works in Ayacucho market on Saturdays and Sundays.  He sells all kinds of seafood such as fish by the pound, shrimps, shellfish, crabs, etc.  From Monday to Friday he travels around town.  He buys his fish in Manta every two days.  He has been in this business for 6 years and it is doing very well.  He has a sizeable customer base.

This loan will be used to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, crabs and other types of seafood.  Senia has been a member of her community bank from the beginning.  She is in charge of implementing rules and regulations and she enjoys it because her group is very united and everybody helps each other.  Her dream is to own a car which she can use to buy her products and transport them around the city more easily.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, crabs and other seafood

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 52 years old and married. She has seven children, and five of them are in school. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Rosita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soap, oil, spices and canned goods. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

In the future Rosita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Maximiana

texts.es: La estimada Sra. Maximiana se  dedica  a la  venta de ropa y aparatos eléctricos en su domicilio desde hace ya tres años   la cual a tiende  personalmente  y  recibe ayuda  de su esposo los  fines  de   semana  ya  que   el   tiene  otra   fuente   de  ingresos,  ellos  acudieron con nosotros  ya que  desean  colocar  vitropiso  en  su   vivienda, por  lo que  están agradecido   con la institución por  el  apoyo incondicional  que  les   hemos   brindadado   ya  que  ve  en el crédito la  posibilidad  de  ofrecerle a  su   familia  una  mayor  comodidad  en su   hogar  y  la posibilidad  de  que  ellas   cuenten  con un  patrimonio.
texts.en: Maximiana has had a business selling clothing and electrical appliances from her home for three years.  She attends to this business personally, and receives help from her husband on the weekends, since he has another job.  They approached us because they want to put ceramic tile in their house.  They are grateful to the Institución for the tremendous support that they have been provided, since this loan will give them the opportunity to provide their family with greater comfort in the home, and will allow them to have a more valuable property.

loans.use: to put ceramic tile in her home

loans.name: Sadia's Group

texts.en:
Sadia is married and her husband is involved in selling paper envelopes. He supplies the paper envelopes to different stationery shops and other individuals who retail sell this item. He fulfills their orders to earn profit for the family. 

Sadia herself is a housewife.  She stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 5 children, all of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education except the youngest one, who is only 3 years old and is not of school-going age yet. 

Sadia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy paper envelopes in bulk quantity to increase his sales and profits.  Sadia is very confident that her husband will be able to make more profits from his business after the loan investment.

loans.use: buy envelopes in bulk to resell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 24 years of age and married with three children. Carolina owns & operates a business venture baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business. Carolina needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $125 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Carolina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Carolina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Jhona Liza

texts.en:
Jhona is 28 years old, single, and has one child. Jhona  has a shop that sells a variety of personal products such as body spray, nail polish,  and other cosmetics. She has had this business for more than two years. 

Jhona is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more of these products to sell in her shop.  Jhona has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase products such as perfume, nail polish, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Messak

texts.en:
Messak is a 49-year-old carpenter married to Dorkas, a 43-year-old lady. They are blessed with eight children:  Lexy, 23 and married; Yanre, 21, a farmer; Eleazer, 18,  graduated from Senior High School; Steven, 15, and Mariana, 13, both are attending Junior High School; Neny, 9, and Reza, 6, are attending Primary School and Astin, 3.    

Working as a carpenter brings such satisfaction for Messak. He has been engaged in this business for years. He produces window and door frames based on the customers’ order. The income generated from the business is unstable and often insufficient to fully cover their living as well as the educational fees of his children.  

In order to earn more income, Messak is thinking of initiating other businesses. He plans to rent a plot of land for five years and purchase four sacks of corn seed and fertilizer. He would like to cultivate corn at the farm and to sell it after the harvest. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. He hopes that TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land and purchase four sacks of corn seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tuvshinbaatar

texts.en: Tuvshinbaatar is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. Two sons are college students and they sometimes help with their father's business. He started his joinery business in 2001. Now he makes a lot of wood products and furniture to order. Personally, he is laconic and a strenuous worker who says, "I need to broaden my business and get more income to educate my children well." He needs a 3,800,000 Mongolian tugrik (MNT) loan for buying wood planks and a lathe for his business.

loans.use: To buy wood planks and a lathe

loans.name: Rebecca Cioburu

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 52-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 9 to 25 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a grocery retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in the Kangetha market in Maua town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased cost of vegetables and fruits. She will use this loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to add stock of  vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Stay Alive Shg Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of the Stay Alive group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

John takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, John had a very good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest 3½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, John will educate his children and invest in business as savings for the future.

In 2012, the members of Stay Alive SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, John is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elizabath

texts.en: Elizabath sells ladies' shoes, pomade, bags and ladies' jeans at Besease for the past 5 years now. She is married with 2 children. Elizabath uses her income to assist her husband in paying utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more shoes, pomade and bags for sale. With the new profit Elizabath will acquire a shop for the sale of the goods.

loans.use: purchase more shoes, pomade and bags for sale

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa habite dans région du sud sénégal,marié depuis LE 09 janvier 2011,il a 1 enfant agé de 11 mois.
Moussa avait travaillé dans une usine de poisons pendant 4 ans qui fonctonne actuellement aux relenti.Depuis ces 4 dernières années ,il supportait toujours les charges de sa famille par son salaire dans l'usine.
Moussa avec ce crédit acheter du pain de singe du lait pour faire de la crème du jus et de la glace pour vendre dans une école qui est prés de son domicile pour faire face a ses charges de famille.Moussa a comme projet dans l'avenir construire sa maison en dure.
texts.en:
Moussa lives in South Senegal. He's been married since January 9, 2001, and has one child, age 11 months.

For four years, Moussa used to work in a fish factory whose business is currently running slow. After those four years, he was still supporting his family on his factory worker salary.

With this loan, Moussa will buy monkey-breads (fruits of the baobab tree) and milk to make cream, juice and ice-cream to resell in a school near his home, in order to meet his family's expenses.

In the future, Moussa projects to build a durable house.

loans.use: to buy monkey-breads (fruits of the baobab tree) and milk

loans.name: Nuvia Janeth

texts.es:
Nuvia es una mujer de 43 años, madre soltera de tres hijos pero únicamente vive con uno de ellos que está cursando su educación básica ya que los otros dos ahora son independientes. Reside en "Santo Domingo" que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. La provincia tiene de superficie 3.857 km² y una altitud de 625 msnm. Su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la costa, de la cordillera occidental, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Nuvia vende cosméticos puerta a puerta desde hace tres años; esta actividad le ha permitido mantener a su hija y darle la educación formal que requiere. Debido a que estas fechas son de ventas altas, Nuvia desea invertir en comprar un lote de ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera tener un ingreso extra. Este es su segundo crédito con Fundación Alternativa que es la institución que le brinda además de un crédito, capacitación y asesoramiento. Su primer crédito lo pago de manera puntual y sin ningún inconveniente por lo que Nuvia es calificada como un excelente cliente.

Su sueño es tener su propio local de ropa y cosméticos en un futuro no tan lejano. Espera también que su hija pueda estudiar la universidad y algún día verla siendo una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Nuvia is a 43-year-old woman. She is a single mother with three children. She lives with one of her children, who is finishing her basic education. The other two children live independently. She lives in Santo Domingo. It is the fourth largest city in Ecuador. This city has a rapidly growing population. It has active commerce and the largest cattle market in the country. This province covers 3,857 kilometers and it has an altitude of 635 meters. The usual temperature averages around 25.5 centigrade but at times the temperature can reach 38 centigrade. The province of “Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas” is a mountainous territory near the coast, in the western mountains. It is historically known at the Yumbos Province and the capital of Colibries. It is located in the humid tropics of Latin America. It is a new province. It was established in 2007.
     For the past three years Nuvia has been selling cosmetics door to door. This work allows her to support her daughter and provide her with a good education. This time is known for it’s high sales. Nuvia would like to buy clothes in order to sell them to her customers. In this way she will earn some extra income. This is her second loan with “The Alternative Foundation”, an organization that provides the loans as well as training and advice. Her first loan was paid on time, which is why Nuvia is considered an excellent customer. Nuvia's future dreams include having a location for her clothing and cosmetic sales. She also hopes her daughter will study in the university and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ella, por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Todas ellas son conocidas en el barrio por su unión y por su trabajo en equipo.
La Sra. Nelia, presidenta del grupo, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas, con lo cual puede mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en el hogar. Su sueño es poder tener un local bien surtido donde ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas variadas, con lo cual podrá surtirse y cumplir con unos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo.  The group members set each of their growth through group work as their main goal.  They are all well known in their neighborhood for their unity and teamwork.

Nelia is group President.  She’s married and has three children.  She’s a very enterprising, innovative woman.  She comments that she sells clothes that she can support her children with and cover daily household expenses that arise.  Her dream is to have a well-stocked store where she can offer more comfort to her customers.

She asks for the loan to by assorted clothes to stock up and fill pending orders she has.

loans.use: to buy clothes for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Acacio

texts.pt: Senhor Acácio tem 39 anos de idade, é casado, tem 4 filhos dos quais 3 estudam frequentando o ensino primário e o último sem idade escolar, vive na casa própria, é professor a 14 anos, trabalha 8 horas diárias. Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar cimento, barrotes, varões, para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa. O seu sonho é de continuar a estudar e terminar a contrução da sua casa. Seu maior desafio é de iniciar o negócio e reembolsar bem o empréstimo.
texts.en: Mr. Acácio is 39 years old and married. He has four children, three of whom attend elementary school and the youngest one is below school age. He lives in a house that he owns. He has been a teacher for 14 years and works 8 hours a day. With the money from the loan he'll purchase cement, beams and rods so he can continue building his house. His dream is to keep on studying and to finish building his house. His biggest challenge is starting a business and repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, beams and rods so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.es: Meliza, de 35 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 15, 7 y 3 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Meliza consiste en la venta de productos comestibles, verduras y gaseosas, su negocio está en su hogar y que se encuentra ubicada en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad, todos los días atiende a muchos clientes que acuden a su tienda en busca de todo tipo de productos que ella tiene para ofrecer, siempre atiende al público con mucho cariño, respeto y amabilidad, aún recuerda cuando emprendió este negocio hace aproximadamente 1 año y desde ahí tuvo muchas dificultades pero afortunadamente ha ido superando estos problemas, ahora su tienda es muy visitada pues ofrece gran variedad de productos a buen precio. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1200, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos comestibles que no tiene actualmente como embutidos, condimentos y otros.

loans.use: Compra de productos comestibles tales como  embutidos, condimentos y otros.

loans.name: Normat

texts.ru:
Нормат   мужчина в возрасте 53 лет. Он женат и имеет 3 детей. Нормат  очень трудолюбивый  мужчина. Он уже более 20 лет он занимается земледелием.  Другой семейный доход он получает от животноводства Его сын работает строителем.
   Нормат  обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит для расширения земледелия. Нормат  и его семья обрадовались понимая что Арванд финансирует его бизнес и заранее благодарит за поддержку.  Нормат   хочет купить семена и селитру .
texts.en: Normat is 53 years old, married, and he has three children.  He is a very hardworking man who has been involved in agriculture for more than 20 years.  He brings an additional income home by raising livestock.  His son works in construction.  Normat has turned to MDO Arvand in order to receive a loan to expand his agricultural activity.  Normat and his family are very happy that MDO Arvand is helping them to finance their business, and they thank you in advance for your support.  Normat wants to buy seeds and nitrate.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy seeds and nitrate

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto is 51 years old married with 2 children living in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Modesto has been working as a farmer for many years, earning well for the family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used for the repair of his motorcycle. He also uses this motorcycle for transportation services and it adds a little income. His farm is doing well and he needs to improve the farm to make sure that he harvests more. Recently Modesto took a new loan recently to cover the cost of motorcycle maintenance such as brake, bearing, signal light and buy fertilizer. He hopes to earn more returns from his farm and provide a better living for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia Omollo is a widow with seven children in her family.

Village Enterprise Fund (VEF) donated 100 Dollar grant to her in the year 2001. She started with a small business of selling greens, tomatoes, onions and cooking oil. Her business continued well for a period of eight months as she realized some profits.

Now, she is going to do a used clothing business. She is going to buy clothes in big quantities and then she will sell to the local people in the Mulanda market. She goes to Kampala to buy the clothes, they are less expensive in Kampala. This trip is around 300 KM each way and she takes a bus. The bus ride charges 18,000 shilling for the round trip and 2,000 shillings for each bell. She intends to buy 4 on each trip. This means that the transportation costs her around $30 US in total.

After selling all 4 bells of clothes, the approximate profit is about $200 US dollars, so this is a very good business to be in right now in Uganda.

These clothes are in many varieties. Skirt and blouse, t-shirts from america. Such T-shirts are pure cotton with pictures of American things -- University of Minnesota, Florida, baseball and football teams. They come in many varieties.

She is capable to handle the loan and to pay it back promptly.

loans.use: Buy bells of used cloths

loans.name: Susana Beatriz

texts.en:
Susana used to work for a screenprinting workshop and it was there where she learned the trade. Six years ago, she decided to work independently, starting with a bit of money and tools. The reason for the change was that her salary was not enough when she separated from her husband and become the only provider for her 5 kids, all minors. In spite of the difficulties she faced, she didn’t give up, and struggled to get ahead with her children.

Susana is currently requesting a loan in the amount of US$925, which she will use to buy supplies for screenprinting. Don’t hesitate any longer, remember that your generosity can mean a great help for Susana and her little ones. She sincerely thanks you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Susana trabajaba en un taller de serigrafía y fue allí donde aprendió este oficio, pero hace 6 años decidió independizarse con un poco de capital y herramientas, pues con el sueldo que estaba percibiendo no le alcanzaba, ya que se separó de esposo y ella se quedó sola al frente de la manutención de sus 5 hijos, aun menores de edad. A pesar de las dificultades que enfrentó no se dejó vencer y lucho por salir adelante con sus pequeños.

Ahora Susana requiere de préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS, mismo que destinará en la compra de insumos para serigrafía. No lo dude más, recuerda que tu generosidad puede ser de gran ayuda para Susana y sus pequeños, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Aku

texts.en: Aku sells cracked stones to construction firms through Aku's Quarry. She is a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $850.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
I. Shakir Khanoglan oglu has a small shop in Sabirabad town. The scale of his business is low in comparison with increased family expenses. He has 3 children who are students. 
He needs refrigerators. His food products have specifications that they should be stored in refrigerators. But he has only one small refrigerator and it gets hot in the summer. So Shakir decided to purchase two refrigerators for storage of food products in cool places. He needs 1200 USD to purchase the refrigerators. He applied for credit to Agroinvest.

loans.use: To purchase two refrigerators for storage of food products in cool places

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn K. has been growing and selling flowers since 2003. She also raises pigs at home. Her husband assists her in the farming business.

Mrs. K. was married in 1971, and has 8 children. Five of their children are married and live in different houses. Currently, only 3 of their children are living at home.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA six times already. Now she is requesting a loan of $500 to buy more flowers from local farmers to sell in the market and to buy feed for raising pigs at home.

loans.use: Purchasing more flowers from local farmers to sell in the market and buying feed for raising pigs.

loans.name: Tolusefulutasi

texts.en: Mrs. S. is talented in weaving and creating designs for fine mats. She recently added a plantation to her business activities, and now two days a week she delivers taro and bananas to a market. During the rest of the week, she works as a mat-weaver. She prefers weaving large mats, because they sell for a lot of money - she can make US$160 per week off her plantation, while each fine mat sold earns her US$400. However, S. is not able to sell a mat every single day, and therefore decided to start the plantation as an additional business. Her husband is unemployed, so S.'s work is very important for supporting the family. She is now asking for a loan of US800 to be able to purchase chemicals, a wheel barrow, a crowbar, and other supplies for her plantation and home.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, a wheel barrow, a crowbar, and other supplies for a plantation and for home improvement

loans.name: María Benita

texts.es:
María Benita is a woman who has always fought to keep her children moving forward. She worked for many years taking care of her 6 children, and she always tried to give them the best of herself. Her husband, who was the breadwinner, also worked a lot in order to provide the money for them to survive. However, when her husband died, María had to find the strength to keep going, and in this way she began to make tacos and tamales to sell.

Nonetheless, it takes María a long time to make her food because her stove does not yield much when making multiple types of food at the same time. For this reason, María is requesting a loan of $925, to be repaid over a period of 6 months, and with this money she will be able to buy a stove with more burners in order to be able to make more food in less time. With your help, María can move past this terrible loss.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María Benita es una mujer que ha luchado siempre por sacar sus hijos adelante. Trabajó durante muchos años a atender a sus 6 hijos de quienes trató siempre de darles lo mejor de ella. Y su esposo quien era el que llevaba el dinero a su casa, trabajó también mucho por darles dinero para poder sobrevivir. Sin embargo en el momento en que el señor murió María tuvo que sacar fuerzas para poder salir adelante y fue así que comenzó a hacer tacos y tamales para vender.

Sin embargo actualmente tarda mucho en hacer sus comidas puesto que su estufa no rinde mucho para hacer varias comidas a la vez. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar una estufa con más parrillas para poder tener la oportunidad de hacer más comidas en menos tiempo. Con tu ayuda María podrá salir delante de esta terrible pérdida.

loans.use: Buy a stove

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: N. Maryam is a mother of 4 children. She was born in 1959. Maryam lives with her family in Khachmaz town. She has been selling  nuts, hazelnuts, beechnuts, etc. in the market for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of $850 to increase her goods for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy produce and nuts to sell

loans.name: Comité Ytumí Group

texts.en:
The Ytumí Committee is comprised of 27 working women of the city of Caacupé. They all own and operate small informal businesses which were aided a while back by the program of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. Each woman benefited from a mid-size loan of $858.000 Guaranies, about $180 USD.

The first meetings of the committee were held in the house of Rosa O. and it was there that they established ground rules and the central theme of this newly formed organization for women entrepreneurs. All women were to attend the weekly meetings on time for training and to make their loan payments.

The committee decided to undertake a project of helping to eradicate two things in the community. The first was to eliminate the breeding grounds for mosquitoes infected with Dengue, a sometimes fatal disease. At the Fundación Paraguay Office in Caacupe the women cleaned the patio, sidewalks, and streets around the neighborhood.

The second activity is to combat the other sickness that affects not only their neighborhood, but also the rest of the country; crime. Their efforts along with other organizations, demonstrate that there are united, organized people who are prepared to help one another. Gerómina commented that the only way to combat these two evils is to be united and work in groups.

With this loan Gerómina and the other women will continue to expand their businesses. They are working to become a united force in the community who will influence others in their community to have pride for their neighborhood and their country.

loans.use: To buy the premium materials for the production of Chipas, a favorite Paraguayan bread snack made from starch, cheese, vegetable oil, and flour.  Some women need to buy clothes to sell or food merchandise for the grocery stores.  Sugar, meat, yerba, flour, milk, and different types of refreshments, water, beer, and sodas are in high demand in their stores.

loans.name: Kyerinda West B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty K.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry feed and more chicks. Betty is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 5 children ranging from age 1 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 32000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more in her business. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to buy more poultry feed and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Florence N. and Ruth K.. Florence N. has a business selling used clothes and wants to add more stock. Ruth K. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to increase working capital.

loans.use: To add to poultry business

loans.name: Angelica's Group

texts.es:
Angélica, Blanca and Maria have belonged to the Hormigas community bank for 2, 8 and 3 years respectively.

Angélica is a widow, 51 years old with 6 children, 3 of whom live with her. Angélica sells baskets and chocolate from Ayacucho in the Santa Clara market. She hand makes the chocolates herself at home.

Blanca is married, 45 years old and has 4 children. Blanca sells natural products by catalog and she also sells Renaware cookware, products which she offers to friends and relatives.

Maria is married, 35 years old and has 2 children. Maria sells vegetables at the market on Cuzco Avenue. In addition, Maria travels out to the Ayacucho jungle to sell vegetables.

Angélica, Blanca and Maria need loans to invest in the purchase of baskets, cocoa, natural products, tomatoes, onions and pumpkins.

Angélica, Blanca and Maria´s hopes are to have money for their old age, that their businesses grow, to start new businesses and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Angélica, Blanca y Maria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Hormigas hace 2, 8, 3 años respectivamente.

Angélica es viuda, tiene 51 años y 6 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con ella, Angélica venD. canastas y chocolate ayacuchano en el mercado Santa Clara, los chocolates lo elabora ella misma en su casa D. manera artesanal.

Por otro lado Blanca es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Blanca venD. productos naturales por catálogo y también ollas Renaware, productos que ofrece a amigos familiares.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Maria venD. verduras en el mercadillo D. la Av. Cuzco. Además Maria viaja a la selva ayacuchana donD. venD. verduras.

Angélica, Blanca y Maria necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. canasta, cacao, productos naturales, tomate, cebolla, zapallo.

Los sueños D. Angélica, Blanca y Maria son tener dinero para su vejez, su negocio sea más granD., iniciar un nuevo negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase baskets, cocoa, natural products, tomatoes, onions and pumpkins.

loans.name: Nicolasa Jesus

texts.en:
Nicolasa Jesus Y. R. has a business selling cosmetics in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She’s a representative for Avon and has 3 years of experience. Over the past 3 years, she has acquired around 50 loyal clients and learned how to maximize her profits. For example, whenever Avon offers discounts on certain products, Nicolasa snatches them up so she earns more when she sells them.

Nicolasa is 43 years old, happily married, and has 2 children. She loves the independence she has gained and being able to help her family financially. The possibility of being able to send her children to University is what drives her to succeed.

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Nicolasa is requesting a loan of 2300 PEN ($850) to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her most popular products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her most popular products.

loans.name: Nartul

texts.ru:
Nartul Y. lives in the town of Yavan. He is 43 years old, married and has six children. He does animal husbandry and has a small farm where he breeds calves and then sells them for meat. In order for the calves to grow quickly they need to be fed well and a large stock of fodder is necessary. Nartul decided to get a loan to buy several tons of fodder. This will allow him to feed and grow the cattle faster to have it ready for sale. He plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ярикулов Нартул житель города Яван. Возраст 43 года , он женат и имеет 6 детей.Занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшую ферму , где разводит бычков и затем продает мясникам на мясо.Для того , чтобы бычки быстро росли их необходимо хорошо кормить . Для этого необходим большой запас комбикорма. Для этого он решил получить кредит и закупить несколько тонн комбикорма. Это даст возможность быстрее откормить скот и вывезти на продажу. А погасить кредит он сможет в течении 6 месяце

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura Anita is 37 years old, and a teacher by profession. She now sells groceries in her small shop, but sees the lack of jobs as an obstacle to the growth of her business. With help from her beloved spouse, Laura Anita works hard each day to contribute to her son's wellbeing. She hopes to increase the size of her store to convert it into a minimart, and is asking for a loan to do just that.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora, Laura Anita de 37 años de edad, es maestra de profesión y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su pequeña bodega debido a que el desarrollo de su labor se ve obstaculizada por la falta de empleos. Con ayuda de su amado esposo se esfuerza a diario para contribuir con el cumplimiento de los objetivos de su querido hijo.Desea incrementar e implementar su espacio de labor para convertirlo dentro de poco en un minimarket y a ese anhelo atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: An injection of capital to increase her working space.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla N., 41, and her husband, Mr. Vit Sou, live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have seven children; four sons and three daughters. Five of them are in the local school. One daughter is a garment factory worker and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Phalla has been selling fruits for three years. She buys them from farmers in her village and near-by villagers for resale at Phnom Penh suburban market. Mr. Vit is a mason in the village.

Phalla is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fruits on contract before harvesting for the future season.

loans.use: To purchase fruit in contract for the future season for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Born on March 14, 1976 in Cotonou in the Littoral Department in the south of Benin, Mrs. Mariam A. is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are still in her care. Her three children are enrolled in school. She sells shoes and handbags that she buys in Togo, a country next door to Benin. She is requesting this loan to buy new styles of these products and answer the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 14 mars 1976 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin, dame A. Mariam est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants tous à sa charge. Ses trois enfants sont tous scolarisés. Elle vend des chaussures et des sacs qu'elle achète du TOGO, un pays voisin au Bénin. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter les nouvelles gammes de ces produits et répondre aux exigences de ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 dozen shoes and 10 dozen handbags

Achat de 15 douzaines de chaussures et de 10 douzaines de sacs

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 29 years old and single. She takes care of 2 people, aged 40 and 50. She has been a clothes and shoes seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 8AM to 2PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asha is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Félix Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr. Félix habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega, tiene 26 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 2 y 9 años de edad, su esposa labora en una empresa de la zona Franca desempeñándose como operaria. Don Félix trabaja de taxista y también vende materiales para reciclaje. Como taxista tiene siete años de experiencia y en las ventas de chatarra un año. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la construcción de la cocina de su casa,  ya que hasta el momento la tiene en un pequeño lugar de la sala, y quiere estar mas cómodo el y su familia.
