A largo plazo es comprar una unidad de taxi para trabajar por su cuenta y así poder obtener más ganancias y poder tener recursos económicos para poder terminar de hacer su casa y vivir en una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Félix lives in the neighborhood Camilo Ortega. He is 26 years old, is married, and has two children, one 2 years old and one 9 years old. His wife works in a business in the zone Franca, working as an operator. Don Félix works as a taxi driver, and also sells materials for recycling. He has seven years experience as a taxi driver, and one year experience selling scrap. With the help of this loan, he would build a kitchen in his house, which is currently in a small part of the living room. He wants it to be more convenient for him and his family. In the long term, he wants to buy a taxi in order to work for himself and so be able to obtain a better income and be able to have the financial resources to finish building his home and to live in a decent house with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 27 años, no es casada, pero vive en armonía con su pareja, con el que tiene cuatro hijos. Desde hace 4 años, juntos, tomaron la decisión de trabajar arduamente para adquirir sus cosas, desde esa momento esta pareja se levantan muy temprano a preparar sus desayunos y almuerzos, después se van juntos a la chacra. Habían empezado sembrando frutos cítricos, pero ahora ya están incrementando sus sembríos, tanto con café, como con y cacao. Nancy dice que cuando se trabaja en armonía y apoyándose mutuamente, no hay dificultad alguna y todo se hace con mayor facilidad, la gran ventaja es que a esta pareja les agrada a ambos su trabajo como agricultores. Es la primera vez que Nancy solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero comprará abonos para la chacra de café, y así pueda producir en mayor cantidad y con buenos frutos, lo que le costará será un aproximado de 500 soles.
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old, unmarried, and lives happily with her boyfriend who has four children. For the past 4 years, they have worked hard to buy things; they wake up very early to prepare breakfast and lunch and afterwards they go together to the farm. They had started to grow citrus fruits, but they are still seeds and the dirt is still brown. Nancy says that when they work together and support each other mutually, there is no difficulty and everything can be done easier. The big advantage is that they both like agricultural work. This is the first time that Nancy has requested a loan with MFP. With this money, she will buy fertilizer for the brown dirt and in this way, produce a larger quantity of good fruits, which will cost approximately 500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Kim Im

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Im L. is a villager in Prey Mei Khang Thboung village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Tuch Tom, is a motorbike taxi. Mrs. Kim Im L. is 25 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel S. de 44 años de edad es soltero y vive en casa propia en la ciudad de San Juan del Parana hace mas de 20 años y que esta retirado a 12 km de la ciudad y tiene un hijo varón de 8 años que va al colegio publico.

Cabe mencionar que el señor es vendedor independiente de mercaderías como ser ropas y calzados para Damas, Caballeros y Niños, recorre por toda la zona de Encarnación y las Colonias Unidas con una antigüedad con mas de 8 años en el ramo con una buena clientela formada y a medida que pasa el tiempo su cartera de cliente va creciendo considerablemente.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ropas y calzados que trae del Brasil por que tiene mejor aceptación de sus clientelas y si compra en mayor cantidad le deja mejor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Miguel S. is 44 years old, single, and has lived in his own home in the town of San Juan del Parana for more than 20 years, 12 km outside of the city. He has an 8-year old son who goes to public school. It is worth mentioning that Miguel is an independent seller of merchandise such as clothes and footwear for ladies, men and children. He travels throughout the areas of Encarnación and the Colonias Unidas. With more than 8 years in the industry, he has built up a good clientele and continues to gain new clients. He will use the loan to buy clothings and footwear which he brings from Brazil as these are more popular with his clients and if he buys in greater quantities he will have a greater profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and footwear from Brazil.

loans.name: Kokou Messan

texts.fr: Monsieur KOKOU messan est un revendeur de FAN MILK, il tient un dépôt de Fan  à côté d’une pharmacie qui s’appelle SATIS, il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’il a bien et régulièrement remboursé, il sollicite un 2ème crédit d’un montant de 500000F pour augmenter son stock de FAN dans son dépôt. Il est marié à une dame qui est une revendeuse, ils ont ensemble eu 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Messan KOKOU is a retailer of FAN MILK. He has a FAN outlet next to a pharmacy called SATIS. He already obtained a WAGES loan, which he repaid regularly and is requesting a second loan of 500,000 francs to increase his stock. He is married to a woman who is a retailer, and together they had two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy FAN MILK products

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Mr Kokou A. est un maraîcher très doué dans la préfecture des Lacs au Sud du Togo. Marié et père de famille, la culture maraîchère est son activité principale à travers laquelle il tire l’essentiel de ses revenus. Ses clientes sont les revendeuses des grands marchés de Lomé. Mais il n’arrive plus à couvrir la totalité de leur demande compte tenu des moyens financiers insuffisant dont il dispose pour augmenter sa production. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement pour augmenter sa surface cultivable et acheter les intrants (engrais et semis). Ce crédit lui permettra de faire face aux demandes de ses clientes et d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou A. is a gifted market gardener in the Prefecture of the Lakes, in the south of Togo. Married and the father of a family, he earns his living mostly through market gardening. His customers are retailers from the big markets in Lomé. However, he is not able to fill all of their orders because insufficient financial means keep him from expanding his production. This is why he is requesting a loan to add to his arable land and purchase inputs (fertilizer and seeds). This loan will permit him to satisfy the needs of his customers and increase his income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: market gardening (purchase of inputs)

loans.name: Kira Kukuli

texts.es:
Kira  es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Kira es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Kira vende cosméticos por catálogos, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares. Su esposo compra y vende maní, ajonjolí, cacao, Kira le ayuda en la venta de estos productos.
Kira necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes y joyas.
Kira sueña con tener una tienda de agroquímicos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Kira is a member of the community bank “Sonrisa” (Smile). She is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and 3 children. Kira sells cosmetics through a catalog and offers her products to friends and relatives. Her husband buys and sells peanuts, sesame seeds and cacao. Kira helps him sell these products. She needs a loan for 1000 soles that she will invest in perfume and jewelry. She dreams of having her own agrochemical store and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: perfume and jewelry

loans.name: Chamoliddin

texts.ru: Чамолиддину 56 лет, женат, трое детей. Занимается предпринимательством – куплей продажей зерновых на местном рынке. Имеет большой опыт в этой сфере и имеет много постоянных клиентов. Свой товар Чамолиддин покупает здесь же на рынке у своих постоянных поставщиков. Чамолиддин собирается увеличить капитал своего бизнеса, так как цены на зерновые немного повысились и бизнес требует вложений. Свой займ собирается погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Chamoliddin is 56 years old, he has three children. He is a businessman and he buys and resells cereals on the local market. He has a extensive experience in this field and has many regular customers. Chamoliddin buys the merchandise on the same market from his regular suppliers. Chamoliddin plans to increase his business capital because the prices for cereals became a little bit high and business demands an investment. He plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina E. is 32 years old and married with three children. Her husband is employed as a driver. Sabina has received an education through junior high school. She operates a chop bar (eatery) in Yamoransa, near Cape Coast, which she has been doing since 1989.  She will use her loan to expand her chop bar and improve the quality of the food she prepares. She currently uses her income to help pay for school fees for her children. With new profits from increased business, she plans to build a house for her family.

loans.use: Expand her chop bar and improve the quality of food she prepares

loans.name: Charity Faith

texts.en:
Charity Faith manages a hog raising business which is her only source of income for sustaining her family. According to her, “Life is like a wheel, sometimes we are on top and sometimes we are at the bottom.” She strongly believes in these words, and is committed to hard work and patience in order to get to the top of the wheel. She is a woman of courage and when she encounters difficulties in life, she takes it as a challenge and strives for the best solution. She aims to give her two children the best education possible since she knows that it is the best treasure that she can give them. Charity is the wife of Velmor T.. They live in a rural area in Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.

Charity is requesting a loan from ASKI of 8,000 PHP for the improvement of her hog raising business. She wants to buy additional piglets and feed for her pigs. She intends to make her pigs healthy in order to sell them at a higher price. She hopes that with the profit from her current business, she will be able to save and open a sari-sari store (a small village store). With additional income, she will be able to support her children’s education. She believes that she can improve her business with a loan from ASKI - MFI.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing root crops

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (25500113) is a 38-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has has three school-aged children.

H. owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2000, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 9th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Don  Mario Alemán trabaja como guarda de seguridad, desde hace catorce años, tiene 47 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y le tiene una hija de 17 años. Sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda para mejorar la seguridad de su casa ya que por la noche casi nunca esta ya que su trabajo no se lo permite. Este es su sexto ciclo de préstamo en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo para poder hacer las mejoras. Con este crédito invertirá en la compra de perlines y pagar la soldadura. Su objetivo es poder segur apoyando a su única hija para que sea una profesional y pueda lograr un nivel de vida cómodo
texts.en:
Mario Alemán has worked as a security guard for 14 years. He is 47. His wife is a housewife, and they have a 17 year old daughter. Their plan is to improve the infrastructure of their house. They want to improve the security on the house because, due to his job, he is almost never home at night. This is his sixth loan cycle with Afodenic. He is thankful for the support and being able to make improvements. He will use this loan to buy beams and to pay for soldering. His objective is to be able to continue supporting his only daughter so that she will become a professional. He would also like to achieve a comfortable level of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Maria Domitilia

texts.es:
la sra. MARIA DOMITILIA M. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas de harina, estas tortillas se usan para hacer baleadas. ella las hace y despues sale a venderlas a las pulperias y  tambien en su propia vivienda.
La Sra. M. tiene 1 hijo que esta cursando la secundaria.
Doña Maria con las ventas que ha realizado en estos ultimos meses ha tenido muy buenos ingresos que le han podido generar mas desarrollo para su vida y la de su hijo.- Doña Maria tiene 7 años de estar al frente de este tipo de negocio donde ha sabido sacar provecho para asi poder generar mas utilidades a su negocio como comprar mas mercaderia para mantener siempre una buena clientela que ha sabido poder ganar con el esfuerzo diario que hace elaborando las deliciosas tortillas de harina.
en estos momentos necesita comprar al por mayor los ingredientes para elaborar las tortillas.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Domitilia M. is dedicated to making and selling flour tortillas, which are used for making “baleadas” (the Honduran version of a burrito). She makes and sells her products to groceries stores and also from her own home. Sra. M. has a son who is finishing high school.

In recent months, Doña Maria has earned a good income from her sales which has helped improve the living situation for her and her son. She has been in this line of work for 7 years, so she knows what it takes to get ahead and generate more profits. She needs to buy more products in order to keep good customers who want delicious well-prepared flour tortillas each day.

At the moment, she needs a loan to buy ingredients at wholesale for making tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of flour, lard, soda and plastic bags for packaging

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce R. is a Tanzanian businesswoman entrepreneur. She runs the Beautiful Salon at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. Maximum business sales are from Friday to Sunday when workers are on the weekend and preparing themselves for the coming week. She purchases her business goods from Kariakoo wholesale and retail cosmetics shops. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business materials

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita D. is from the village of Bulao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old. Carmelita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling native medicinal coconut wine products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bulao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 51 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos (solo 2 están a su cargo), estudio educación primaria incompleta (3do grado), vive en el Barrio Tupac Amaru  Av. Alfonso Ugarte 707.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de ovinos y cerdos. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 850.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ovinos y algunos chanchos para engorde, también se dedica a la artesanía en  bordado en bayeta.

Su sueño es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosa de Lima” that is located in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno. She is 51 years old, married, and is the mother of 6 children (only 2 are currently in her care). She completed only 3 years of primary education, and lives in the neighborhood Tupac Amaru Av. Alfonso Ugarte 707. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 3 years, her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase sheep and pigs. She is currently requesting a loan of 850 nuevos soles to purchase more sheep and some pigs to fatten. She also does cloth embroidery. Her dream is to continue working. She enjoys saving, and attending the meetings of her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sheep and pigs

loans.name: Hackman

texts.en: Hackman J. is married and has five children. She has received senior high school education.  Hackman sells used clothing at Elmina near the new market, which she has been doing since the year1998. Her husband is a trader.  Hackman uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.  Hackman will use the loan to purchase more used clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hackman plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: Hackman will use the loan to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Virgen Niña Group

texts.es: El grupo tarijeño “Virgen Niña” esta representada por la señora Martha Rosario y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales radican en el mismo barrió por lo que se conocen desD.  hace muchos años. Los socios cuentan con diferentes actividades económicas entre las que podemos mencionar la venta D. comida, tiendas D. barrio, venta D. cosméticos,  servicio D. transporte público y a la elaboración D. reposterías; sus negocios se encuentran en las diferentes zonas D. la ciudad, por lo que sus negocios son rentables. El financiamiento esta destinado al incremento D. su capital D. operaciones adquiriendo insumos, mercadería y herramientas para agrandar mas sus pequeños negocios generando una mejor rentabilidad que brinD. a sus familias una mejor calidad debida. Los socios indican que invertirán en incrementar el capital  D. sus negocios D. las diferentes actividades que tienen. Las socias del  banco han demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en el pago D. sus cuotas en el  anterior ciclo demostrando responsabilidad en todo momento. Según el reporte D. la  central D. riesgos  se pueD. ver que tienen buenos antecedentes crediticios en otras instituciones financieras.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Niña” group is represented by Martha Rosario and comprised of 12 members who live in the same neighbourhood and have known each other for many years. The group´s members carry out different activities, amongst which are: sale of food and cosmetics, neighbourhood stores, public transport service and baking. Their businesses are located in different areas of the city, which is why they are profitable. The financing they will gain from this loan will be used to increased their operational capital in the purchase of supplies, merchandise and tools. These purchases will enlarge their small businesses and generate a higher profit to offer their families a better quality of life. The members have demonstrated responsibility and punctuality at every moment in the payment of their quotas in their previous loan cycle. According to the report from the Centre for Risk Control, they have good credit ratings in the other financial institutions they have previously banked with.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation Capital

loans.name: Hammed

texts.en:
Hammed is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Oyo state, Nigeria.

Hammed has a provisions store, which she has been operating for over 6 years. She has been with LAPO for over 2 years. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more provisions and further improve her store. Hammed say she is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Elver

texts.es:
El Sr. Elver V. M. tiene 33 años de edad vive con su esposa la Sra. Nataly del Rosario Ramos Ramos de 25 años de edad. Tienen dos hijas Jacqueline de 4 años quien asiste a un colegio de la zona y Natalia de 2 años.
Viven en la casa del padre de Elver que queda en Pariña Chico - Los Aquijes - Ica, esa vivienda fue afectada por el terremoto y aún no mejora su situacion.
Con sus ahorros lograron comprarse su terreno en Caserio el Rosario-Los Aquijes – Ica y han levantado un modulo de material noble por lo que requieren de un financiamiento para poder colocar su techo de caña, palos y barro y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas.
Ambos son bien trabajadores, la sra. Trabaja de 6:00 am a 12 pm y su esposo de 6:00 am a 6 pm, son personas muy responsables, han logrado acumular algunos bienes, tienen muchas ganas de superación, son emprendedores, gozan de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y de los jefes donde trabajan.
texts.en:
Elver V. M. is 33, and he lives with his 25 year old wife, Nataly del Roasario Ramos Ramos. They have two daughters. Jacqueline is 4 and attends school in the area. Natalia is two. They live in Elver’s father’s house, which is in Pariña Chico - Los Aquijes – Ica. The house was affected by the earthquake, and the situation has still not improved. With his savings he was able to buy land in Caserio el Rosario-Los Aquijes – Ica. They have raised a building made from good material. However, they need a loan to be able to put on a roof made from cane, sticks, and mud. That way they can give their daughters a better quality of live. Both of them are hard-workers. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 12 p.m. Her husband works from 6:00 a.m. until 6 p.m. They are very responsible people who have been able to accumulate some assets. They have a great desire to succeed, and they are enterprising. They have good references from their neighbors and the bosses where they work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements on the house

loans.name: Zoila Isabel

texts.es:
ZOILA ISABEL  G. M.  tiene 54 años de edad inicio con su negocio desde que tenia   20 años con la ayuda de  su mama,  quien le había regalado un cerdo pequeño que ella engordò,  para luego destazarlo y vender la carne.  Con las ganancias de la venta de la carne  compró un cerdo grande y así fue como se inicio en el negocio, actualmente vende  chicharrones, carne de cerdo, chorizos y también se dedica a hacer chuchitos, ya sus clientes saben donde buscarla y llegan a su casa para comprar. Ella solicita este crédito ya que quiere aprovechar estos meses para comprar por lo  màs cerdos, ya que tiene bastante pedido de carne y necesita tener suficiente capital para poder adquirirlos ya que cada uno puede costar de Q.1,200.00 a  Q. 1,500.00.    

La señora Zoila tiene 8 hijos, pero ya solo 2 de sus hijas están solteras y viven con ella, ellas dos también están aprendiendo el negocio mientras que le ayudan a su mamá, ella dice que se siente contenta al enseñarles un oficio que les pueda ayudar a sus hijas y quiere invertir bien su capital para poder aprovechar las ganancias que obtenga de sus ventas ya que a ella siempre le ha gustado ahorrar, quiere ahorrar y que después de un tiempo ya tenga un bonito capital propio.
texts.en:
Zoila Isabel G. M. is 54 years old. She started her business twenty years ago when her mother gave her a small pig that she fattened, butchered, and sold for the meat. With her earnings she bought a larger pig and started her business as a result. Now she sells chicharrones, pork, and chorizo sausage. She also makes chuchitos (cornmeal dumplings with a meat filling, similar to tamales). Her customers know her well and come to her house to buy these products.

She is requesting this loan so that she can take advantages of these months for buying more pigs. She has enough orders for meat products and needs sufficient capital to acquire these animals, which can cost between 1200 to 1500 GTQ each.

Sra. Zoila has eight children, but only two of her daughters are single and still live with her. They are learning the business while helping their mother. Zoila says she is happy to teach them a trade that can help them in the future. She wants to invest her capital well so that she can save some of her earnings and build up some nice equity over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more pigs to butcher

loans.name: Tsagaanbandi

texts.en:
Tsagaanbandi T. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Hovd province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His three children are ages 5 to 12. Tsagaanbandi and his wife both have small businesses in their respective fields. His wife sells various vegetables at the local food market and Tsagaanbandi does transporting with his truck and small car. He has worked as a truck driver for the last twenty years. After the collapse of the command economy in late 1990, he purchased the truck he used to drive for a company and since then he has been doing business with his own truck. In the winter, he uses his truck to carry coal from countryside to the town for retail. With his profit, he was able to buy a small old car that he now uses as a cab for additional income.

He requests a loan to purchase more coal and more vegetables for his family businesses. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase more coal and more vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell travelling bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alioune M. est un jeune célibataire de 33 ans très dynamique qui évolue dans la vente d’articles de mercerie depuis 10 ans. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Ouakam depuis 2007. Il a choisi ce commerce par amour du métier. Monsieur M.  sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs. L’objet de son crédit est l’achat de produits de mercerie dans le but de renforcer son stock de marchandise et de mieux diversifier ses articles. Monsieur M. a déjà bénéficié  de 2 crédits antérieurs qui ont participe a l’élargissement de son activité ce qui lui a permis d’acquérir certains biens personnels.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mr Alioune M., aged 33, is a young and highly dynamic single man who has been selling haberdashery items for ten years. He joined the Ouakam branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC in 2007. He chose this activity because of his love for this trade. Mr M. applies for a loan of 500,000 CFA francs. He will use it to buy haberdashery items in order to boost his inventory and diversify his supply. He was already the beneficiary of two loans which helped him to expand his business. As a result of this he was able to buy a few personal items. Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en: To work abroad is one of the dreams of 28-year-old Edlyn C.. After her separation from her husband, she became the sole provider and support for  her four-year-old daughter Stephanie. Because of her bitter experiences in life brought about by poverty, Edlyn wishes that someday she would have enough money to change her life and to make her daughter’s childhood days memorable and enjoyable. Moreover, Edlyn wants her daughter to finish her education through college. Therefore, she wants to have a business to have a source of money to support her dreams. Edlyn, being a newly recognized member of ASHI, is requesting a loan to start up a small business. She plans to raise chickens in her backyard and sell them after 40 days. Some of the eggs her chickens will produce will be for their own consumption, some will be sold, and some will be hatched to be raised again. If Edlyn feels happy and successful running a business, she would prefer not to go abroad and would look after her daughter instead.

loans.use: To purchase chicks

loans.name: Myanzi Tukolerewamu Group 2, Mityana

texts.en: B. Kaloli is a hardworking and determined man. He is married with 30 children from different wives. He also takes care of 3 orphans. Kaloli has had a clothes shop in Myanzi on the Mityana-Mubende highway for 24 years, and he is able to make 150,000 USh in profits each week. Kaloli’s biggest business challenge is the high cost of transport from Kampala, where he buys his stock. His experience in business has taught him good customer care skills, which has brought him more customers. He hopes to expand his business further, and although he has already bought more land for his family, he hopes to buy more land for the same purpose. He needs this loan to be able to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Blanca Milagros

texts.es:
Blanca es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos menores de edad en sector El Gañan del caserío Punto Nueve, una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura que pertenece al distrito de Mochumí, de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso adicional que ayude al sostenimiento de su familia hizo que hace dos años empezara a dedicarse a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora (bebida tipica de la zona norte del país), ella prepara la chicha en su vivienda y la ofrece a sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta bebida es muy consumida por la zona, ya que los trabajadores agrícolas de la zona piensan que esta bebida les da fuerzas para continuar con sus actividades.

La chicha de jora se prepara con un tipo especal de maíz denominado jora, este maíz se muele y se hierve en grandes ollas hasta que esté completamente cocido, luego se le agrega azúcar y se deja fermentar en vasijas de barro. Esta es una tradición que existe desde tiempos remotos y que es continuada por los pobladores de la zona norte de la región Lambayeque.

Adicionalmente Blanca también se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría ovejas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y las vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona esporádicamente. 

Blanca se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a ampliar su negocio de venta de chicha. Ella planea comprar mas insumos (azucar, jora y leña) con el dinero del préstamo.	

Ella es una mujer alegre y que siempre busca modos de sentirse activa y de ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir sacando a su familia adelante y brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de continuar estudios superiores. Blanca ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 25 year-old mother who lives with her husband and their 3 minor children in the El Gañan neighborhood of the rural settlement of Punto Nueve in an agricultural area that is part of the Mochumí district of Lambayeque province, located a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. Due to the need to generate additional income to support her family, 2 years ago Blanca started to make and sell chicha de jora (a beverage that is typical of the northern part of Peru). She makes the chicha in her home and offers it to her neighbors and acquaintances. This drink is commonly consumed in this area, since the agricultural workers here think that the drink gives them strength to continue with their activities. The chicha de jora is made with a special type of corn called "jora" that is ground, and boiled in large pots until it is completely cooked. Later sugar is added and it is left to ferment in terra cotta containers. This is a tradition that dates back to remote times and is continued by the people who live in the northern part of the Lambayeque region. In addition, Blanca raises and sells animals; she raises sheep in the back of her home and sells them to the traders who visit the area every so often. Blanca is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles which will help her to expand her chicha business. She plans to buy more supplies (sugar, corn and firewood) with the money from the loan. She is a cheerful woman who is always looking for ways to keep active and help support her family. Her main desire is to continue to advance her family economically and to provide her children with the opportunity to continue their studies at the college level. Blanca has worked with our institution before, and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to expand her business making and selling chicha de jora  (Peruvian corn beverage)

location.town: El Gañán - Punto Nueve - Mochumi - Lambayeque

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. makes and sells palm oil in Jukwa. Efua has a senior high school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She assists her husband in taking care of the family. 

Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to make palm oil to sell. She hopes to save the new earnings from her business to buy a shop in the market place where she can keep and sell her oil.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits to make palm oil to sell

loans.name: Rosa Magali

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Boca Chica, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, ella cría ovejas y chivos en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando están lo suficientemente desarrollados los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona para comprar animales y revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para apoyar al sostenimiento de la economía familiar, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como agricultor no son suficientes para mantenerlos.

Rosa desea mejorar la calidad de los animales que posee para que estos tengan mejor acogida y pueda obtener mas ganancias, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en alimento para lograr su objetivo.

Rosa es una mujer bastante comprometida con el progreso de su familia, ella se esfuerza todos los dias para salir adelante y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, sus vecinos y amigos la consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 28 year old mother of a family who lives alongside her husband and her children in the hamlet of Boca Chica, a rural area of the Olmos district belonging to the Lambayeque province which is found two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For six years, she has been dedicated to the raising and selling of young animals. She raises sheep and goats behind her house and when they are developed enough she sells them to businesses that visit the area to buy animals and resell them in the city of Chiclayo. The income that she receives from this activity is used to support her family economically since her husband's income as a farmer is not enough to support them. Rosa wishes to improve the quality of the animals that she owns so that they become more popular and can generate more earnings. For this reason she has seen the necessity to request for the first time a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she is thinking of investing in feed to achieve her goal. Rosa is a woman who is committed to the advancement of her family. She works every day to get ahead and provide them a better quality of life. Her neighbors and friends consider her to be trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed to maintain her sheep and goats.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is a 57-year-old married mother of one child, Sharen. She and her husband work together in operating her food-vending business and sari-sari (variety) store. The couple has been engaged in these businesses for more than ten years now. Her husband also works as a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) driver to earn an extra income to support and sustain the needs of their family.
Josephine joined Kiva partner, ASHI, in 1997, with the aim of getting out of the spiral of poverty and consistently acquiring working capital for her business. She will use this new loan of 45,000 PHP to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari (variety) store and supplies for her food-vending venture. Josephine is grateful to ASHI for their good hearts towards the poor, like her family, and for helping her reach her dreams. That is why the couple has grown to love the institution very much and all lenders who are sponsoring this loan.
Josephine hopes that one day she will be able to have her own produce stall in the market for her food-vending business instead of just in her house. She also hopes to make enough money to pay for her family's needs, and dreams of the best of life for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for sari-sari store and supplies for her food-vending ventures

loans.name: Helen Angcap's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Helen A., 40 years of age, is a widow who resides in Bintana, Tangub City. Helen is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group members receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Helen A.’s Group.
	
Helen was blessed with two children who are now school age. For her living, she decided to engage in operating a sari-sari store and a banana buy and sell business. For four years, she has been able to maintain the businesses during ups and downs. Now she earns an average net income of not less than P 3,500 a month, which is very helpful to her family.  She joined the cooperative in 2009. As an active center chief and member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of P5,000 as her second loan t to add capital to her existing sari-sari store and banana buy and sell business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions of her family, to meet their basic needs and save for future use. She is hoping that someday her business will become more progressive. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her existing businesses

loans.name: Vanesa Erika

texts.es: La solicitante es separada, tiene un hijo de 5 años, vive en casa de sus tios los cuales apoyan constantemente, cuentan con un negocio de venta de golosinas, bebidas, maní, habas tostadas y otros desde hace 2 años, enteriormente en la calle La Mar con Av Grau y ahora en Calle Cajamarca con Ayacucho contando con una carreta de metal propia donde exibe sus productos,no cuenta con ningun endeudamiento ni experiencia crediticia. El destino del credito es para realizar el deposito de S/. 720.00 para acceder a la construccion de un modulo basico de 35m2 mediante el programa del estado Techo Propio en el terreno que posee en la Tinguiña
texts.en:
The applicant is separated, has a five year old son, and lives in the house of her aunt and uncle who help her on a regular basis. For two years she's had a business selling sweets, drinks, peanuts, roasted nuts, and other items, first on the corner of La Mar Street and Avenue Grau and now on the corner of Cajamarca Street and Ayacucho. She uses her own metal cart where she exhibits her products. She does not have any debt or credit experience. The purpose of the loan is for a deposit of 720 soles to get started with the construction of a basic housing unit of 35 square meters through the state program Techo Propio (Own Roof) on the plot of land she has in the neighborhood of La Tinguiña.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a basic housing unit under the Techo Propio (Own Roof) program.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel Rúa M. vive tiene  dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 30 años en Palmar de Varela, Municipio  ubicado  sobre la delta del Río Magdalena, al oriente del Departamento del Atlántico ; allí se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir; ella aún recuerda cuando inició su negocio buscando su sueño de ser independiente, asì fuè como ensayó vendiendo productos de belleza y finalmente aprovechando su herencia empírica heredada de su familia, hace varios años montó su negocio de confección, donde fabrica  pantalones para hombres, vestidos para niñas, cubre lechos y otras prendas de vestir de acuerdo a la época y a lo que sus clientes le pidan. 
Este es su Segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  organización  con la que ha obtenido un cambio positivo porque le financiaron su capital de trabajo con intereses cómodos y un buen plan de pagos.  En la actualidad necesita comprar telas, repotenciar  y reparar sus maquinarias, razón por la cual solicita  un crédito por valor de  $ 1.900.000  COP
Su principal desafío es comprar una maquinaria avanzada para hacerse cargo de una producción mayor, pero María  debe esperar porque es un capital importante  el que necesita para éste propósito. Ahora su principal meta es lograr integrarse  a una hija a su mismo negocio y obtener una mayor producción y ella está a la expectativa de que esto pase.
texts.en:
María Isabel Rúa M. has two children in their 20s and 30s. She lives in Palmar de Varela, a town on the Magdalena river delta in the east of Atlantic State. Although she makes clothing now, she first started in business selling beauty products, pursuing her dream of independence. Eventually, by making the most of a little she inherited from her family, María set up her tailoring business. She makes men's trousers, girls' dresses, bed covers - and other garments, whatever is fashionable and whatever her customers request. This is María's secoond loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has develeoped a good relationship with this organisation because they financed her loan at an affordable interest rate and on a fair payment plan. She is seeking the loan of $1025 to buy fabric and have her sewing machines overhauled and repaired. Ultimately María aims to buy a more advanced sewing machine so that she can take on bigger projects, but she will wait as this would be too large an investment at present. For now her goal is to involve her daughter in the business and take on more work. María is optimistic that this will happen.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and repair sewing machines

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta S. is 38 and is married with two children aged 2 and 6. She owns a business venture selling both food and daily-use products in the local community and has one year of experience in this business. Ruta needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or approximately USD 117 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2009, Ruta joined SPBD and this is her 2nd loan with them. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto P. is from the village of Gappal Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 33 years old. Roberto is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Roberto owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Roberto has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roberto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roberto is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Roberto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING SOFT DRINKS, SNACKS, AND BASIC GRAINS TO SELL

loans.name: Karim

texts.es: Karim tiene 24 años, es una futura madre de familia, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de su madre y hermanas. Desde que tenía 22 años empezó con la venta de cosméticos, y lo realiza durante algunas horas del día. La modalidad  de sus ventas, es por medio de catálogos de diferentas líneas de belleza, y que son mostradas a sus amigas y vecinos, de esa manera escogen el producto que desean comprar. Sus clientes le pagan semanalmente, eso le motiva continuar con este negocio, por lo que trabaja tranquilamente. Se siente muy satisfecha por la labor que desempeña; ya que las ofertas y las campañas que ofrecen de estas líneas, le es  beneficioso; por las ganancias que obtienes y las utilidades que recibe. En adelante planea ampliar su negocio y luego comprarse una vitrina para que pueda exhibir sus productos y sus clientes tenga opción de escoger el producto. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas, como hasta ahora, porque sabe que le es de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de belleza, para ofrecer la mejor variedad de mercaderías a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Karim is a 24 year old future mother who lives with her parents and sisters. She began selling cosmetics when she was 22 and spends a few hours a day doing this. She sells her products through various beauty supply catalogs and works with different lines of products that she demonstrates to her friends and neighbors, who can make their selections. Her customers pay her weekly and she works at her leisure, so she is motivated to continue with this business. She is very satisfied with her work and benefits from the offers and campaigns that she gets from the different lines, as well as from the income and help that she receives. In the future she plans to expand her business and eventually buy a display case so that she can show her products, allowing her customers to choose the ones they want. This will be her tenth loan through MFP and she is committed to making all of her payments, as she has always done, because she knows that it is helpful to increase her business working capital. She will use the money from this loan to buy more products so that she can offer a greater variety of choices to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic C. is from the village of Poblacion III. She is 37 years old. Marivic is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling motor parts in the local community. Marivic is just starting this business.

In 2010, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is married. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Nova Kahovka town. Ludmila has been in this business for seven years. She has been able to develop the business well and attract many customers. Her kiosk is in a good location in the market, which helps Ludmila to attract more and more new customers. Ludmila would like to borrow 7,500 Grivnas to purchase new inventories to increase the assortment of clothing she offers. She hopes to earn more profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing for sale

loans.name: Think For We Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Think For We” group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. These small-scale entrepreneurs have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Aminata K. (pictured in the left) is the leader of this group. The 44-year-old is married to a businessman and they have six children who are attending both primary and secondary schools. Aminata has been a businesswoman for fifteen years now; she sells palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil). With her share of this loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where she has been farming for 12 years. Her farm produces milk, which she sells to a local dairy plant. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of tea, which she sells locally, and a shop that she operates in the same region. Her primary challenges in farming have been a poor transport system to the markets and the fluctuating market prices of milk.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income from the sale of milk will enable her provide enough food for her family, pay school fees for her children and meet any other expenses for her family. She hopes that in five years time, she will have a fully established dairy farm.

Angeline is 36 years old. She is married with five children who are now between the ages of 6 and 13. Four of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
These five people form the group loan. They are located in Preaek Hour Kaeut village, Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Pech S., a 58-year-old married woman, as the group leader. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their families' standard of living.

Mrs. Pech S. is widow with two children who are seamstresses in the garment factory. She is a farmer who owns a field where she cultivates rice and corn for a living. However, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support the farm. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to buy corn seed, fertilizer and pesticide. She would use the rest of the loan to cultivate bananas.

loans.use: To buy corn seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Efraín de 39 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Sofía de 8 y Jairo de 6 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El negocio al que se dedica Norma es la venta de productos naturales, aprovechando que tiene ya hace muchos años una tienda de abarrotes muy conocida en la ciudad de San Francisco, ofreciendo a sus clientes productos que son rápidamente comprados, ya que ella sabe muy bien como convencerlos y alentarlos a que se lleven más de un solo producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que mejor efecto tendrá para sus males, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es educar a sus clientes sobre la importancia de sus productos, aun así ella sigue adelante muy firme en sus metas. Con el tiempo, desea abrir una tienda exclusivamente para sus productos naturales. Es el décimo segundo crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos naturales, con lo cual espera implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Norma is 38 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband, 39 year-old Efraín, and her 2 beloved children, 8 year-old Sofia and 6 year-old Jairo.  Her children are her main motivation to continue with her hard work.  Norma's business is selling natural products.  She takes advantage of the fact that she has had a very well-known grocery store in the town of San Francisco for a number of years and she offers her customers products which are always quickly sold out since she knows very well how to convince her customers to buy and how to encourage them to take more than one product.

What Norma most likes about her work is advising her customers on what product will best treat their ailments.  She has been in this activity for 2 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be educating her customers on the importance of her products.  Even so, she continues resolute in her aims.

Over time, Norma would like to open a store where she sells nothing but her natural products.  This is her 12th loan with MFP.  She hopes to be very punctual with her repayments since she would like to be able to obtain more loans in the future.  She is a very active member of her community bank.  She will use her 2,000 nuevos soles to buy more natural products with which she hopes to better stock her store.

loans.use: To buy more natural products with which to stock her store

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa tiene 29 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el caserío San José del distrito D. Mórrope, una zona agrícoL. y comercial que está poblada por gente humilD.  y trabajadora. Se encuentra ubicada a más D. una hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

ElL. cuenta con algunos animales menores, los cuales cría en un ambiente ubicado en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio. Los alimenta en base D. granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos alcanzan un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar L. zona en donD. resiD.. ElL. ya lleva trabajando durante más D. tres años en esta actividad.

 L. crianza y venta D. animales es L. más importante fuente D. ingresos con L. que cuenta, gracias a elL. ayuda a su esposo, quien trabaja como jornalero en los campos D. cultivo cercanos, con el sostenimiento D. L. economía D. su familia. 

Actualmente desea adquirir alimento balanceado y realizar arreglos en sus corrales con L. finalidad D. mejorar L. crianza D. estos animales y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, sobretodo durante esta temporada naviD.ña, que es cuando L. demanda aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Elsa, 29, is married living with her husband and four children in San José, Mórrope district, a rural and commercial zone inhabited by humble, hard working people.  It is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a few small farm animals that she raises in an area of her backyard.  She feeds them basic grains and natural grasses.  When they reach their ideal level of development she sells them to the various merchants that frequent the area where she lives.  She has been working in this occupation now for over three years.

Raising animals for sale is the most important source of income she has.  Thanks to it she’s able to help her husband, who works as a field hand in nearby farms, support the family.

She wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed and make some improvements to the corrals so that the animals will grow better and she will earn higher income from their sales, especially during the Christmas season, which is when demand increases.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that will help her reach this goal.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to make improvements to the animal pens.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Elle a en charge 2 enfants et âgée de 40 ans. Elle est  coiffeuse et tresseuse.  Mais elle a associé la vente  des mèches et tissage pour plus de revenus.  Elle cumule 16 ans dans cette activité et achète au grand marché de Lomé. En plus elle satisfait les clients dans son atelier à Adidogomé. Avec ce prêt, elle espère acheter 4 douzaines de mèches, 4 douzaines de tissages et 3 boites de gels.
texts.en: This lady has two children in her care and is 40 years old. She is a hairdresser and a hair weaver. However, she also sells hair extensions and weaves to get more income. She has gathered 16 years of experience in this business and she buys her products at the large market in Lomé. Furthermore, she looks after her customers in her workshop in Adidogomé. With this loan, she is hoping to buy four dozen hair extensions, four dozen weaves and three boxes of gel.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Hold Tight” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000.00 to invest in their businesses. 

Nancy is the leader of this group. She is thirty and married with two children who attend primary school. Nancy sells margi (a seasoning used to give sauce a sweet taste) wholesale. She has been a business woman for six years and, with her share of this loan, will buy large quantities of margi to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy the seasoning margi in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi E. is married and has four children. Esi sells food items in Elmina, which she has been doing for four years. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in feeding and clothing the children. Demand for other food items is increasing, and she is requesting the loan to purchase these items to expand her business. She plans to build a shop from the new profit.

loans.use: To purchase items to expand her business.

loans.name: Luu

texts.en: Luu T. C. is 44 years old, with 2 children who are in high school. To earn her daily income, she runs a shop at the local market selling fresh fish and meat. Every day, she earns 100,000 VND of profit from this business. By running this business since 2005, one year after receiving a loan and business knowledge from our credit program, Luu T. C. has  provided good living conditions for her family. She would now like to have a  loan of 7,194,000 VND to invest in  her business.

loans.use: to  invest in her business.

loans.name: Simplis Eroman

texts.fr:
Client de 36 ans, célibataire sans enfant. A la fin de ses études universitaires, n’ayant pas trouve d’emploi, vu les difficultés financières rencontres, il se lance dans la vente des habits friperie et habits prêt à porter.
Sa stratégie est de vendre chez lui a domicile et au marche pour multiplier ses revenus, il fait des commandes chez les commerçants qui vont acheter a l’étranger et s’approvisionnent aussi  sur les grandes boutiques de la capitale.A l'octroi de son prêt il compte acheter des habits pour hommes, des cravates, des chemises, jeans et tous les habits a la mode qui attirent les hommes.
Ses ventes sont de 20.000 fr à 40.000 fr par jour.
Son ambition est de faire grandir son activité et faire plus de bénéfices pour qu’a la longue, il ouvre une grande boutique des habits prêts a porter pour hommes et dames.
texts.en:
Simplis Eroman K. M., age 36, is unmarried and without children. He couldn't find a job after finishing university and, because of financial difficulties, he started selling secondhand and ready-to-wear clothes.

To multiply his income, his strategy is to sell at home and at the market. He places orders with merchants who buy abroad and in the large shops in the capital. With his new loan, he intends to buy men's clothing, ties, shirts, jeans, and other fashionable clothes who attracts men. His daily sales amount to XOF 20'000 to 40'000 (ca US$ 40 to 80).

His ambition is to expand his business and increase his profits so that, in the long run, he can open a large boutique to sell ready-to-wear clothes for men and women.

loans.use: To buy jackets, shirts, ties, pullover, pullovers, trousers, jeans

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan, tiene 40 años de edad, tienen su pareja y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad Cusco y  vive en la misma ciudad. Froilan es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia, él se dedica a la venta de frazadas y distribuye a los vendedores de las ciudad de Sicuani y Calca. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Froilan en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más frazadas.

Froilan pertenece al banco comunal “Sol de Oro” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Froilan is 40 years old and he and his partner have two children. He was born in the city of Cusco and lives there as well. Froilan is a father, a hard worker, and an entrepreneur who provides for his family. He sells blankets and distributes to vendors in the cities of Sicuani and Calca. He has been doing this for 10 years and is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. With this opportunity, Froilan is requesting a loan to buy more blankets. Froilan belongs to the Community Bank "Sol de Oro" of the Arariwa Association and he is grateful for this opportunity and thus agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: To buy more blankets.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes D. is currently in a business of charcoal. She is 30 years old, married to a policeman, with 4 children and 3 of them go to school.Agnes borrowed a loan to stock charcoal to sell.She hopes to build a shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 22 años, es una joven muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. La tienda de Elizabeth es una de las más visitadas en Yanango, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 22 years of age, is modest and hard working.  She lives in her own house, and is disposed to work very hard to succeed in life.  Elizabeth’s store is one of the most frequented in Yanango.  She opens very early in the morning, as she expects her neighbors to visit to buy the items they need.  She is a good salesperson, happy and attentive, and always greets her customers with a smile and ready to assist them with their purchases.

What she enjoys most about her work is chatting with her neighbors.  She has been in business for 3 years, and finds the most difficult aspect of her work to be staying all day in her storefront without leaving.  Over time, she hopes to be able to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise to offer her clients a greater variety of products. 

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is committed to making her loan payments on time as she doesn’t want to cause any problems for her cooperative bank, where she is very well liked by the other members.  She will use the eight hundred soles requested to buy more products to better supply her store.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise with which to supply her store.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIREN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Oropesa y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas: es soltera y la socia tiene 51 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos de 29, 24, 17 años de edad; la socia elabora panes, esta zona es conocida como el pueblo del pan artesanal, la mayoría de las socias se dedican a la elaboración de panes y actualmente ellas tiene el premio a la calidad y sus panes son muy conocidos en la región del Cusco, ellas llevan sus panes a vender de preferencia a la carretera esperando a que los carros que van de Cusco  Arequipa se detengan para comprar panes y viceversa, pero también en la ruta hay muchos pueblos que hacen lo mismo, la socia requiere el crédito para comprar insumos como manteca, levadura y formar la maza, también deberá comprar combustible para el horno. La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de panes.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA” communal bank. This bank is located in the province of Oropesa, in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Felicitas: she is single and 51 years old, with 3 children, aged 29, 24, and 17. She works making breads. This area is known for its people who make traditional bread, and most of the members work baking bread. Currently, they hold the prize for quality, and their breads are very well known in the Cusco region. They usually take their breads to the highway to sell, waiting for the cars going from Cusco to Arequipa or vice versa to stop and buy bread. However, there are many other villages along the route that do the same thing. The borrower needs this loan to buy ingredients such as shortening and yeast to prepare her dough. She will also need to buy fuel for the oven. The borrower is requesting the loan to buy supplies for preparing bread. 

The borrower is very grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments for this loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 54 years old, married, has three children and makes a living by running a cafeteria. She started this business three years ago after spending several years working as a tailor. Though she runs her business in a highly competitive environment, she is good at retaining her customers. She hopes to buy a piece of land in the future, and will use this loan for 70, 000 Kes to buy more utensils and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy more utensils and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg is a 50-year-old widow. She lives with her daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children are both university students. They own a plot of land and a family house. Altantsetseg used to work for a state-owned leather processing factory until 1991 when it was privatized and she lost her job due to job cuts. Then, together with her two girlfriends, she established a partnership, rented a work space and started producing leather garments. She still works there as a tailor. She has a sewing machine at home and in her spare time she makes leather jackets with different designs and sells them to customers to earn extra cash. She has to support her two student children and pay their annual fees as well. Altantsetseg is applying for a loan to buy leather materials to make different types of leather jacket to sell.

loans.use: to buy leather materials to make different type of leather jackets to sell.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 49 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Cledy  de 17 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En un parque muy transitado de la ciudad de Pucallpa, Rocío tiene su puesto de golosinas, su negocio es muy concurrido por los niños, ya que siempre tiene cosas muy deliciosas para vender, además que tiene mucha paciencia para atender, motivo por el cual casi siempre termina por vender toda su mercadería. Lleva 2 años trabajando en su negocio, y considera que esta trabajo es flexible en los horarios, así no deja de atender a su hija. Sin embargo el tener que permanecer todo el día parada afecta su salud, pero debe hacerlo para poder ganar más dinero. Espera con el tiempo tener capital para invertir en una tienda de abarrotes, por ello pide de su colaboración para cumplir su anhelo. Este será el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta depuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada, ya que siempre es muy puntual en sus reuniones. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su kiosco y así ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Rocío is 49 years old.  She is a very kind and simple woman who lives in her own home together with her beloved daughter, 17 year-old Cledy.  What she wants more than anything is to improve her quality of life.

Rocío has a candy stall in a very busy park in the city of Pucallpa.  Her business is very popular with children since she always has delicious things to sell.  In addition, she also has a lot of patience when serving her customers.  This means that she nearly always ends up selling all her merchandise.  Rocío has been working in her business for two years and, because her work has flexible hours, she is also able to look after her daughter.  The fact that she has to remain standing all day long affects her health but she must do so, so that she can earn more money.  Over time, Rocío hopes to have capital to invest in a grocery store.  She is requesting your cooperation in helping her to achieve her goal.

This will be Rocío's fifth loan from MFP.  She knows that she has to make all her repayments on time and is prepared to do so.  She is a very well-liked and well-respected member of her community bank as she is always very punctual for meetings.  She will use the 600 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy more candies with which to better stock her kiosk so that she can offer her customers a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy a variety of candies to stock her kiosk

loans.name: Juan Vicente

texts.en:
Juan is 64 years old and lives near the city of San Gabriel, Ecuador. He is married and lives with his wife and two children, ages 20 and 12. He describes himself as a happy and calm person who likes to share his free time with his family. For his business, he grows potatoes and carrots. He began working in agriculture when he was very young. Juan purchased his farmland, where he works with his older children that are married and no longer live with him. He is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate potatoes because he is experiencing difficulty with the few rains that have fallen. 

Juan has been getting loans from FODEMI for three years. He says that his past loans have changed his family for the better and he has been able to grow his farming business. His goals are to eventually buy a larger field, support his children, and enlarge his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Monica Antonia

texts.es:
Mónica es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos.  Su préstamo anterior de  S/. 500.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como ovejas, también nos cuenta que vende picarones (dulce limeño) en la plaza de Mañazo.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco ovejas para su engorde por quince días, luego las venderán a un mejor precio.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos.  Su esposo trabaja en una mina en Arequipa.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son los ahorros y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the communal bank, “Santa Rosa de San Jose,”  which is located in the district of Mañazo in the province and department of Puno.  She is 39, married, and has 3 children.  She completed secondary school.

She has had 3 loans with Manuela Ramos.  Her previous loan was for 500 PEN, which she invested in her business of buying and selling small animals like sheep.  She also tells us that she sells “picarones” (a type of doughnut from Lima) in the plaza of Mañazo.

This is her ninth loan, and it is for 1,200 PEN.  She will use it to buy 5 sheep to fatten for 2 weeks.  She will then sell them at a better price.  Her children help her with this business.
