Her husband works in a mine in Arequipa.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.  What she likes most about her communal bank is saving money and making profits.

loans.use: to buy five sheep

loans.name: Muthiani

texts.en:
Muthiani is 43 years old, married to Jane, and they do not have children yet. He owns a retail shop in Kituluni Tala where he sells things like cooking fat, flour, sugar and so on. He has been doing this for the last eight years and gets an income of about 10,000 KES (~$117) per month. 

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. He has got a good credit history and he is applying for his fourth loan of 30,000 KES. The loan will increase his capital for buying stock like cooking fat, sugar, flour, etc.

Muthiani will use the extra profit to expand his business. He hopes to open extra branches. He is very honest and obedient.

loans.use: To increase his stock of needed items like cooking fat.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 55-year-old widow. She opened her grocery store 11 years ago to ensure her livelihood, and she doesn't ask for help from others. As a widow with no one to take care of her, Najah put a premium on improving her social and financial situation by increasing her store’s inventory so she could increase her income and cover most of her expenses.

Najah is well-liked by most of her neighbors, who really encourage her to improve her situation. Like most grocery-store owners, Najah is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, before the holy month of Ramadan so she can increase her stock of goods with dates, special Ramadan syrups, and nuts.  This is her third loan.

Najah is a borrower in good standing, and her previous loans have had a great impact on her business and social situation.  Najah hopes to stay healthy so she can improve her business and keep on meeting her needs.

loans.use: To increase her store’s  inventory  with dates, special Ramadan syrups, and nuts.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustin, tiene la edad 67 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de una vaca lechera . El cuenta con varios vacas en su poder y lo que pretende es comprar otra para la venta de leche. El quiere tener varias vacas lecheras que sean de buena raza y que produzcan bastante leche para su posterior venta en  la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su esposa y crecer con le proyecto de la lecheria. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Agustin is 67 years old. He is married and he lives with his wife. With this loan he hopes to purchase a dairy cow. He already has several cows and he wants to buy another one so that he can sell milk. He wants to have several dairy cows that are of a good pedigree and that produce enough milk so that he can then sell the milk in his town and in neighboring areas. He wants to generate a greater amount of income for his well-being and for that of his wife and to expand his milk business.

This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Previously he had not received other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR granted him this loan with more ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mayra Mirtala

texts.es: Mayra Mirtala tiene 34 años de edad, es una persona alegre y laboriosa, se dedica al cultivo de cafe, es casada, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son varones, y junto a su familia reside en la Comunidad de Las Vegas en el Municipio de Trojes. Comenzo a cultivar cafe desde el año 93, y lo aprendio de sus padres. La jornada laboral en la finca de cafe inicia desde las 6:00 am y culmina a las 12:00 pm, y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de algunos trabajadores. Mayra tambien tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion y sus hijos se turnan para ayudar a atenderla, ella decidio incursionar en el negocio de venta de abarroteria ya que los ingresos que le dejaba el cultivo de cafe no eran suficientes para cubrir los gastos del hogar y del estudio de sus hijos. Actualmente Mayra no tiene mayor dificultades para el sostenimiento de su familia y se siente muy agradecida con Dios y con el apoyo recibido por medio de los prestamos otorgados por FAMA. El prestamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y asi poder fertilizar las 7 mz de tierra del cultivo de cafe. Con el apoyo del prestamo su produccion sera de mayor calidad y podra venderla a un mejor precio. Su meta es seguir manteniendo sus negocios activos y seguir incursionando en otros, tambien seguirle dando humildemente a su familia una mejor condicion de vida. Este es su tercer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con su compromiso de pagos de forma puntual.
texts.en: Mayra Mirtala is 34 years old.  She is a happy and hard-working person who makes her living growing coffee.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are boys.  Together with her family, she lives in the Las Vegas community in the municipality of Trojes.  Mayra began growing coffee in 1993; she learned the skill from her parents.  The workday on the farm starts at 6:00am and finishes at 12:00pm.  She has the help of her husband and some workers.  Mayra also runs a small grocery from her home.  Her children trade off helping her with the customers.  Mayra decided to get into the grocery business because her earnings from coffee growing weren't enough to cover the household expenses and her children's schooling.  Mayra does not currently have any major difficulties supporting her family.  She feels very grateful to god and thankful for the financial help she has been granted through FAMA.  Mayra needs the requested loan to purchase fertilizers to be able to fertilize the roughly 12 acres of land she has planted with coffee.  With the help of the loan, she will have better quality production and will be able to sell at a better price.  Mayra's goal is to keep her businesses active and to continue getting into other businesses.  She also wants to continue to humbly give her family a better quality of life.  This is Mayra's third cycle with FAMA and she plans to punctually comply with her re-payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Ana Matilde

texts.es: Ana Matilde de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de mariscos que la realiza de forma ambulante, se levanta desde muy temprano con su esposo a vender, ya se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues los mariscos que comercian siempre están frescos, son de muy buena calidad y los vende a muy buen precio, además el servicio que brinda es excelente y lo da hasta la puerta del hogar de sus clientes, Ana Matilde es una mujer emprendedora muy activa y con ganas de sobresalir en la vida para ella lo más importante es alcanzar la felicidad y es por eso que siempre trabaja duro, con ese pensamiento positivo de sacar su negocio adelante se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, pescado, camarones, conchas, entre otros. Ana Matilde tiene la esperanza que así lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana Matilde, 46, lives with her life partner in their own house.  She’s a seafood street vendor.  She rises very early with her husband to go out selling because she’s attained quite a large clientele because the seafood they sell is always fresh, of good quality and she sells it at a very good price.  Besides, the service she provides is excellent and she even goes to her customers’ doorsteps to provide it.

Ana Matilde is a very enterprising, very active woman with a strong drive to stand out in life.  For her, what’s most important is to attain happiness and this is why she works hard always with this positive attitude to make her business succeed.  She decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fish, shrimp and conch, among others.  Ana Matilde hopes this way to bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp and conch.

loans.name: Zarela

texts.es:
La señora Zarela es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas del Distrito calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Son 27 ciclos que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Acondicionó una pequeña parte de su casa para colocar una vitrina y poder mostrar sus bebidas,  golosinas  y demás productos que tiene a la venta.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 cajas de galletas, 2 cajas de caramelos, 3 jabas de gaseosa, 1 jaba de néctar, 2 paquete de gaseosas, descartable, 1 bolsa de chupetines, 2 cajas de chicle, 5 tiras de chizitos, 5 tiras de papas leys, 1 tira de maní, 2 paquetes de agua mineral.
Con todos estos productos surtirá mas su negocio para poder vender más, su esposo trabaja en el sector salud y es el que mantiene el hogar. Gracias a Manuela Ramos tiene un ingreso más y puede ayudar con algunos gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Zarela is a member of the Nuevas Amigas communal bank in the Callería district of the department of Ucayali.  She is 40 years old and married, and she has two children.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 27 loan cycles, and she sells sweets.  She renovated a small part of her house to put in a display case to be able to show the drinks, candy, and other products she sells.

With this new loan of 1,700 PEN she will buy 2 boxes of cookies, 2 boxes of candy, 3 crates of soda, 1 crate of nectar, 2 packages of soda in disposable containers, 1 bag of lollipops, 2 boxes of chewing gum, 5 units of cheese puffs, 5 units of Lay's potato chips, 1 unit of peanuts, and 2 packages of mineral water.

She will supply her business with all these products and be able to sell more.  Her husband works in the health field and he is the one who supports the home.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Zarela has an additional income and is able to help with some of the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy sodas and sweets.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 49 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her two children.

Haifa has been a tailor since 1980. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, including suits, coats, and trousers for women and kids. She has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation, and she is well known in surrounding areas.

She is requesting $2,400 to purchase two industrial sewing machines and a generator, and to stock more materials such as buttons, zippers, and thread. She aims to gain more profits so she can provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two industrial sewing machines, a generator, and to stock more materials such as buttons, zippers, and thread

loans.name: María Delfina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes, la calidez de su gente, la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos que la hacen una ciudad especial y quien la vista se enamora de ella.

Doña María tiene 49 años, está separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 33, 26, 23, 18, 6 de edad, todos son solteros sus cuatro hijos mayores de edad trabajan solventándose sus gastos personales y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de granos secos como: frejol, lenteja, arveja, habas, etc. Esta actividad la realiza hace 25 años, no tiene un puesto fijo por lo que vende recorriendo la ciudad y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su veinteavo crédito, este lo va a invertir en la compra de granos secos como: frejol, habas, lentejas, arvejas, etc. para la venta.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “La Paz”. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful scenery, the warmth of its people, and its culture and traditions. All of these elements make it a special city and people enjoy visiting it.

Doña María is 49 years old, separated from her husband, and has five children (ages 33, 26, 23, 18, and 6). All of them are single, but four of them are adults who work in order to cover their personal expenses. Her youngest child attends a school in the city. She does not own a home, so she lives in a rental property.

Sra. María sells dry goods such as kidney beans, lentils, peas, broad beans, and other products. She has been in this business for 25 years. María does not have a fixed location, so she sells by traveling throughout the city. She works Sunday through Sunday without a set schedule.

In her Communal Bank, María is receiving her 20th loan. The money will be invested in the purchase of dry goods such as kidney beans, broad beans, lentils, peas, and other products to sell. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy kidney beans, broad beans, lentils, peas, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crabs, shrimp, fish, chicken, and pork meat to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica operates a shop in Elmina, Ghana where she sells sanitary pads, tooth paste, Milo, toilet paper and other items.  She is married with six children. She supports her companion to educate her children. 

Monica requests a loan to buy provisions for sale in her shop. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to buy provisions for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Lucy Mbaika

texts.en:
Lucy Mbaika Musymi used her first loan well. She bought clothes which she sold at a good profit. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. 


She has currently applied for a new loan which she intends to use to add more stock of clothes for the festive season and thus maximize on the sales. 

In the future, Lucy hopes to expand her business and generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes

loans.name: Ya Kaday

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Ya Kaday. She is married and has two children aged 23 and 3 years, both of whom are schoolchildren. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to assist in the business. 

In 2005, Ya Kaday established her slippers business. She began her business because she  was brought up by her elder sister who did not think it was worthy for her to go school; instead, her sister let her assist in her business and since then she became a trader and business is a part of her. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 2,215,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Ya Kaday would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.  She requires a loan in order to purchase Rubber Slippers (men), 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL; Sandals 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL; and Rubber Slippers (women) 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 333,000.

In the future, Ya Kaday plans to improve her business and her living condition.  It will help her as she is also planning to build a house. She wants to see her children through school.

The rainy season is her problem as the stall she is trading on is not well protected. Competition is high but she buys more goods and quality stock. She serves people in villages and the city town, about 15 people per day. She goes in for the latest designs and sells them at affordable prices.  She buys her goods in Freetown twice per month. Ya Kaday uses her profit by buying more goods to add to her existing ones. She wants to rent a shop that will protect her goods during the rainy season so she is working forward to that by accessing more loans. She is hardworking and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase Rubber Slippers (men), 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL; Sandals 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL; and Rubber Slippers (women) 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (pictured above) has been selling vegetables and meat in the local market for more than six years. Her husband, Moeun has been selling cows for more than three years. He buys cows from his village and sells them in other districts far away from his house. Sometimes, there is a middleman comes to buy cows at his home. Sophea is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to assist in her husband’s business buying and sale cows. He will use the loan to continue his business by buying additional cows for resale.

The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1999 and have two sons and one daughter-whom are in school.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s business buying and sale cows.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a businesswoman and sells cloth at Besease. She is married to a farmer and has two children. Elizabeth uses her income to assist her husband in paying the utility bills. Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase more items and cloth for sale. With the new profit, Elizabeth will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items and cloth

loans.name: Mahoudjro Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHOUDJRO est formé de treize personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même village et se connaissent de par leurs activités. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Anne-Marie est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Anne-Marie est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Rodrigue. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge, et certains scolarisés. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Anne-Marie fait de la restauration (riz accompagné de sauce) dans une école de sa région ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Anne-Marie achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Anne-Marie et les autres membres du groupement MAHOUDJRO sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The Mahoudjro group consists of thirteen people who all live in the same village and know each other from their businesses. The representative of this group, named Anne-Marie, is the one whose hand is raised on the photo. Anne-Marie is 35-years-old and is married to a farmer named Rodrigue. The couple has four children, all under their care, and some go to school. 

For about ten years, Anne-Marie has been providing catering services (rice accompanied by sauce) in a school in her region, which allows her to take care of the diverse responsibilities of her family together with her husband. Anne-Marie buys her products in Bénin. 

This is the first time that Anne-Marie and the other members of the Mahoudjro group are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their businesses in order to better respond to the demands of their clientèle.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and cans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth, necesita el préstamo porque lo utilizara en la compra de un molino de mixtamal, debido a los incrementos de los clientes y con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos, 
El préstamo anterior le ayudo porque compro varios repuestos para el molino que ya tenia con esto ha permanecido estable y su familia se ha mantenido con los ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en: Ruth needs this loan to buy a 'nixtamal' mill owing to the increase in her number of customers. Her aim is to improve her income. Her previous loan helped her because she bought several spare parts for her existing mill. This enabled her to remain stable and she was able to support her family with the income from her business.

loans.use: to buy a nixtamal mill

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en:
Mutua is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be quiet. He operates a retail stall where he sells shoes. He has been in this business for 19 years. His business is located near a busy road and his primary customers are both repeat and new. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather problems, as the place he operates from is open-air. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy sport shoes. 

Mutua's business goal is to venture into transportation by buying a motorbike within five years.

loans.use: To buy sport shoes for selling.

loans.name: Balal Pakour 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bala  est né depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois et a fait 7 cycles CAURIE-MF. Composé de 12 femmes, le groupe est très solidaire et elles ont comme activité principale  la transformation et la vente de pâte d’arachide.
 
Madame Mondé (en médaillon à l’extrême droite)  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée  et mère de trois enfants, elle a en charge aussi cinq de ses proche parents.  

Elle achète des graines d’arachides elle transforme en pâte d'arachide pour ensuite vendre dans les marchés  hebdomadaires de sa localité. Cette activité, elle la pratique depuis plus de trois ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’avoir une quantité importante de graines d’arachide et acheter quels que intrants pour la transformation de patte d’arachide.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer les besoins familiaux et dans le futur améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Balal solidarity group was created at the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois and has completed 7 loan cycles with CAURIE-MF. It consists of twelve women whose main activity is making and selling groundnut paste.

Mrs. Mondé (inset at the far right) is the head of the group. She is 26 years old and married with three children. She also takes care of five close relatives. 

She buys groundnut seeds, which she processes into a paste to sell at the local weekly markets. She has been doing this for over three years.

Her new loan will allow her to stock up on groundnut seeds and to purchase some inputs to make the paste.

The profits earned will help her to provide for the needs of the family and to improve the family’s long term living conditions.

loans.use: to stock up on groundnut seeds and buy inputs to make groundnut paste.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a thirty-three-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the university since he never had a chance to study due to financial constraints.  He has been in the transport business for the last eight years and with the  income earned he was able to build a semi-permanent house for residence.  He is faced with challenges of high fuel costs and taxes levied on him.  He has a goal of buying land to grow crops and buying another taxi.  Moses intends to use this loan facility to buy tires for his taxi, which have now worn out.

loans.use: buy tires for his taxi

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a lively and resilient woman. She is from the Kitale area, an area that is very affected by poverty, inequality and social conflict. She intends for her family to get ahead through her hard work and effort without complaint.

Josephine has spent the past 3 years of her life farming. She sells milk, poultry and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Josephine is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Josephine has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is a lack of funds.

She is therefore requesting a loan to buy seedlings and start horticultural farming. Through the Talapanda self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, Josephine joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers.

With your loan, Josephine intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence enabling her to make more money. This loan will improve Josephine's living conditions and secure the future of her 9 children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and start horticultural farming

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in the remote village of Nyakeore, in Nyamira, an area known to have high demand for poultry products. Simon practices mixed farming, growing bananas, maize, keeping cows, and growing a variety of food crops.

Of all the activities in which he is involved, poultry farming is closest to his heart. Waking up every morning to collect eggs makes him very proud. Feeding his poultry is his hobby.

Simon has always wanted to increase his poultry farming operation because the demand is overwhelming, but the biggest challenge has been lack of capital. Simon has traits of a mobilizer, and he decided to mobilize other small-scale farmers who share this common problem. Together, they joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that uses a co-guarantee mechanism to provide agricultural-based loans.

Simon is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. With the loan, he will be able to buy more poultry and satisfy the overwhelming demand. Through the loan, he will significantly increase his sales and this will translate to more profits.

Demand for chicken is high in Nyamira. It is a popular meal for many people and fast food joints are always full. Increased profits will allow Simon to improve his living conditions and get out of the poverty-stricken situation he is currently in.

Other than profits, he will also benefit from poultry manure, which has higher nitrogen than other livestock manure. Through the loan, Simon sees a brighter future. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Christinile

texts.en:
Christinile is 49 years old and has three children.  Christinile is married and has one child still in school.

Christinile is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Christinile requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Christinile has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Christinile would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cows, sheep and goats for slaughter

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.en:
My name is Carmen E. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 5 years and I have my son's help to attend to my customers. I have a good clientel because I am located near a bus terminal in the center of the city. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory to have higher sales. With the additional earnings, I will be able to remodel my home, support my family and to give a private education to my son who is ready to enroll in University.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Carmen E. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años y tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion de mis clientes, mi clientela es muy buena porque estoy ubicada a la par de una central de buses en el centro de nuestra ciudad, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion, mantener a mi familia y darle un estudio privado a mi hijo que esta ingresando a la universidad.

loans.use: To purchase churros, drinks, bateries, candles, matches, juices, butter, cheese, tortillas, shampoos, cookies, white and sweet bread, soup, tomatoe sauce, toothpaste, thread, needles, notebooks, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, beans, rice, sugar,butter,oil,and margarine.

loans.name: Constância José

texts.en:
Constância José C., 27 years old, native of Bilene, Province of Gaza. She grow up with her parents, and had few opportunities to study due to the family's lack of financial resources. This made her enter the world early, having to interrupt her studies for an early marriage.

The family has a micro-business building furniture. The raw material used is wood, which is acquired in the large lumber companies in the city of Maputo, about 30 km from the town of Boane, where her carpentry shop is located.

At the end of 2006, through neighbors, she found out about Hluvuku-Adsema and, since she needed to increase her stock of wood, and didn't have a place to turn to for the loan, this was a great opportunity. With a loan of US$600, she plans to purchase wood for building various types of furniture ordered by her customers and to increase the family income to apply to her carpentry business.

Her activity has a larger impact on the community because, in addition to providing a job for three people, she makes high quality furniture available at accessible prices near to where her customers are located.

Translated from Portuguese by Naomi Baer, Kiva volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 1– Boane

Cliente: Constância José C.

Sector de actividade: Transformação

Valor de empréstimo: 15.000,00MT (600.00US$)

Aplicação de montante: Compra de madeira para fabrico de mobília

Inicio: 10/04/07

Fim: 31/03/2008

Constância José C. de 27 anos de idade, natural de Bilene, Província de Gaza. Cresceu sob responsabilidade dos Pais, teve poucas oportunidades de estudar for falta de recursos financeiros na família que lhe fez vir ao mundo, teve de interromper os estudos para casamento prematuro.

A família possui uma micro empresa de fabrico de mobília anexo a residência, a sua principal matéria prima é madeira que é adquirida nas grandes serrações da cidade de Maputo que dista 30 Kms da vila de Boane, onde localiza-se a sua carpintaria.

Nos finais do ano de 2006 por indicações dos vizinhos teve conhecimento de existência da Hluvuku-Adsema e como necessitava de aumentar o stock de madeira e não tinha onde recorrer para obter empréstimo, esta foi a grande oportunidade. Com empréstimo de 600.00US$ pretende aplicar na compra de madeira para fabrico de vários tipos de mobília encomendada pelos clientes e aumentar a renda familiar. para aplicação do seu negócio na carpintaria.

A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para três pessoas, coloca a mobília de qualidade e apreços acessíveis mais perto do cliente.

loans.use: TO buy wood for produce furniture

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Adam is married with three children. He lives in the Kimbangulile area in Dar es Salaam.  He sells  vegetables  and fruits near his residence. He buys  fresh produce of fruits and vegetables from nearby villages for resale at a small profit. The business has been his main source of livelihood for the past ten years. The business has not grown because he has to make a balance between business and family needs. The proposed loan will assist Adam to expand his business through adding new products. The amount needed to expand his business is USD 550. If his business is expanded, he will be able to meet the challenge of paying school fees for his child who is expected to start secondary education.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Chhoeum

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeum S. is 48 years old and has 4 children. One is a constuction worker (pictured), earning $4 a day, another is a student, whilst the other two live with their husbands elsewhere in the country. She has applied for this loan so that the family can repair their house. Chhoeum would like to do this as quickly as possible rather than wait a year for the family to save enough money.

loans.use: To repair their house

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem R., age 50, works with her husband to farm a plot of land growing rice crops and other vegetables. They sell their produce at the market, earning about $2 per day. They have five children, four of whom are married and living with their own families and one of whom is a student who lives at home. In order to purchase more rice seeds and fertilizer to increase the output of her farmland, she would like to borrow $800. She is pictured with her husband in their home.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds, fertilizer to expand her crops.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
From the time he was very young, Oscar was raised by his dear old grandmother, Bety, who has a small grocery store. Thanks to the role she so efficiently played, she was able to offer her loving grandson an education and economic means. Now, unfortunately, Bety finds herself in delicate health, and Oscar, her exemplary grandson, has decided to leave his studies for a time so that he can responsibly dedicate himself to running the expanding store and to making sure that it is the best-stocked store in the area. His wish is to acquire a sales counter and to increase the variety of merchandise so that when his grandmother gets better, she will feel comfortable, proud, and pleased with the results that Oscar got during his time as manager. To make his hopes a reality, he is requesting a loan that he promises to repay within six months. This responsible grandson turns to your support to help keep his little grocery store growing.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Oscar, desde muy pequeño creció junto a su anciana y querida abuelita Bety, quien tiene una bodeguita de abarrotes; gracias a este oficio que desempeñaba eficientemente pudo ofrecerle a su amoroso nieto educación y solvencia económica, pero ahora, desafortunadamente, Bety, se encuentra delicada de salud y desde entonces, Oscar, su ejemplar nieto decidió dejar por un tiempo sus estudios superiores, para dedicarse responsablemente a la administración de este negocio que muy impetuosamente está sacando adelante, y haciendo de este lugar el más concurrido de su zona.Su deseo es adquirir un mostrador y aumentar aún más la variedad de su mercadería, para cuando su abuelita mejore pueda sentirse cómoda, orgullosa y muy satisfecha por los resultados que pueda obtener durante este tiempo y para concretar sus deseos solicita un préstamo y así mismo promete reembolsarlos en un lapso de seis meses. Este responsable nieto recurre a tu apoyo para seguir desarrollándose día a día con su pequeña despensa.

loans.use: Purchase a shop counter as well as a greater variety and quantity of highly needed goods

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is forty-two years old and a single mother of three girls ages twenty, seventeen, and fourteen.  Each of Dominga’s daughters attend school, with the eldest studying at the local university.  Dominga purchases new and used shoes in bulk and resells these at a profit to passers-by on the local roads of her community.

Dominga plans on using her loan to increase the selection of used clothing and new and used shoes in her inventory.  She hopes that soon her business will become established enough that she can serve customers exclusively from her home.  As she works to support her children’s educations, Dominga explains that she hopes her three daughters will all receive their university degrees and live the lives of their dreams.

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing and shoes for resale locally.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan lives in his parent's house with his wife and his two children on Alberto Ostria street in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz. He has an automobile that he uses as a taxi, but he also does contractual work for a laundry company. He asks for a loan to improve the appearance and working condition of his automobile since it is his only form of income to sustain his family. This is the second loan that Juan has solicited through Kiva. He maintains an exemplary payment history. His previous history certifies his exceptional standing and allows him a new loan. He is a client of IMPRO since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan vive en casa de los padres en la calle Alberto Ostria de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus dos hijos; tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como taxista, pero también atiende contratos con una limpieza de ropa. El crédito que solicita es para mejorar la apariencia de su auto y ponerlo en mejores condiciones ya que es su único medio para generar ingresos y mantener a su familia. Esta es la segunda vez que Juan solicita un crédito a través de la línea Kiva. Su historial de pago ha sido impecable. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2004.

loans.use: The maintenance of his taxi

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es:
Farming is an activity that requires a lot of effort and skills to work with the animals as they require care and attention to grow healthy.

Since Maria Benita started her business in the city of Chinandega, municipality of Villanueva, she has been able to sustain her two little children as she is a single mother and needs to fulfill both the roles of father and mother in her household.

Ceprodel has been a big support to Mara Benita M. as she has gotten loans to improve her economic situation and give an education to her sons. Her biggest and most urgent need now is to buy more cows for their commercialization.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

El trabajo de agropecuaria requiere de mucho esfuerzo y habilidades para trabajar con los animales ya que requieren un cuido y atención muy especial para que puedan crecer muy eficientemente para los fines propuestos.

Desde que inició este negocio en su sector de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega en el municipio de Villanueva se ha preocupado por mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos ya que ella es madre soltera y por tal razón realiza el papel de padre y madre en el núcleo de su hogar.

CEPRODEL ha sido un gran a poyo para la señora Maria M. ya que le ha beneficiado con Créditos que le han permitido mejorar su situación financiera pero sobre todo brindarle el estudio a sus hijos. Su gran necesidad hoy en día es la urgencia de adquisición de los animales para su respectiva comercialización.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: J. Aba is a trader who buys goods in large quantity and then sells them. She is a divorcee with 3 children. Demand for her goods, such as beans and groundnut paste, has increased, but she does not have enough capital to enable her to increase sales. She is asking for $625 to increase her stock to meet the increase in demand for her goods.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Nonvignon Ahouanligodo Group

texts.fr:
This micro project focuses on converting palm nuts into red palm oil. It is the work of the all-woman association Nonvignon. This group of women came together in 2004 following government social measures aimed at helping impoverished members of the population through revenue-generating activities. It currently has three members and is located in the township of Akpro-Misserete in Ahouanligodo. On the border of the political capital Benin, this township abounds in natural resources. The funding of this micro project will enable the group to increase its production capacity, record a profit and improve the living conditions of its members.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Le présent micro projet porte sur la transformation de noix de palme en huile rouge. Il est l’œuvre de l’association féminine NONVIGNON. Ce groupement féminin a été crée en 2004 suite aux mesures sociales du gouvernement en vue d’aider les couches de la population démunies à travers des activités génératrices de revenu. ll compte actuellement 3 membres et est situé dans la commune D’AKPRO – MISSERETE à AHOUANLIGODO. Frontalière avec la capitale politique du BENIN, cette commune regorge d’énormes richesses. Le financement de ce micro projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production du groupement, de dégager des bénéfices et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres.

loans.use: To buy 3.6 metric tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru:
Ahmad B. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a professional degree as a cook. For the last 10 years Ahmad has been managing his own restaurant where he cooks national Tajik dishes. Ahmad wants to take out this loan to purchase new equipment for his kitchen: a refrigerator, a stove and dishes. This investment will help him attract new customers and increase the restaurant's revenue. The increased quality of the Tajik cuisine that Ahmad will be able to serve using new equipment will entice the locals to visit his restaurant more frequently. Ahmad is planning to repay the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Бакиев Ахмад житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 44 года. Женат и имеет 4 детей. Имеет средне-специальное образование . По профессии повар. Так и работает. Имеет свою частную столовую, где готовит национальную кухню. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит , чтобы закупить новое оборудование: холодильник , печь , и посуду. Это поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов и получить больший доход. Кроме того улучшив качество предлагаемой продукции поможет населению пользоваться услугами нашего клиента.Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa, a 36-year-old mother of one child, owns a small clothes shop in Saida South, Lebanon, and this is her first loan request from Al Majmoua. She needs $500 to purchase summer clothes and swimsuits to meet the demand of her clients. Randa prefers to borrow the money from Al Majmoua rather than ask her husband, for she considers that her financial independence is at stake. We believe Randa is a hard worker who will make sure to fully repay her loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothes and swimsuits for her shop.

loans.name: Judith Olga

texts.fr:
Mrs. Judith Olga D. was born on April 23, 1983 in Cotonou in Littoral County. She retails construction hardware and spare parts. She is married and the mother of a two-year-old son named Hector. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business inventory and respond to the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame D. Judith Olga est née le 23 Avril 1983 à Cotonou dans le Département du Littoral. Elle est revendeuse de petits matériaux de construction et des pièces de rechange. Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon nommé Hector âgé de 2 ans. Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer sa capacité d'approvisionnement et faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 boxes of glue and masonry accessories

Achat de 15 boites de colle, et des accessoires de maçonnerie.

loans.name: Genaro Carlos

texts.es:
Genaro’s entire family works in the clothing business, generally making different types of garments depending on the season. His wife sells these clothes at the markets that are held in the cities of La Paz, Oruro, Potosi and Chuquisaca. Most of his clients have been working with him for a long time (since 2004) and he has never had a problem making his loan payments on time, although recently he has had to deal with the loss of a family member.

Translated by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Staff

Toda la familia de Don Genaro trabaja en la confeccion de ropa de temporada, la esposa se dedica a la venta de ésta en las diferentes ferias que se realizan en las ciudades de La Paz, Oruro, Potosi y Chuquisaca. Son clientes antiguos, desde el año 2.004 y nunca tuvieron ningun tropiezo en cancelar sus cuotas, pese a que ultimamente tuvieron la perdida de un familiar.

loans.use: Increase the amount of working capital / Incremento de capital

loans.name: Mrs. En Theng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. En T. is a group leader of four who all live in Peak Bang'aong village in Takeo province.  Each will use the loan for a different purpose.  For instance, Mrs. En T. is a farmer who is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers in order to produce a better crop while she faces infertile soil on her field.  Her husband, Mr. Seng Vuth, is laborer who makes $3 per day.  Mrs. En T. is 44 years old and she does not have any children.  She hopes to make a better crop with this loan. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These three members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to produce a better crop while she faces infertile soil on her field.

loans.name: Trich's Group

texts.en:
There are four members of this group loan. Mrs. Trich S., 47 years old and the group leader, is a fish seller. She has operated her business for over twenty years. She sells her fish from village to village, earning approximately US$3.00 a day. Mrs. Trich married to Mr. Set Sei, 47, a fisherman. Set always leaves the house early in the morning to fish. They have three children, one of whom lives with them and their two daughters work for a garment factory. Set is facing difficulty with his fishing tools often being broken. Therefore, he had a discussion with his wife and decided to seek a loan of US$400 to purchase more nets and bait for fish. The other members of their group are:

Mrs. Thoeun V., 33, is a fish seller. Her husband fishes and she sells them in addition to fish she buys from suppliers. Thoeun requests a loan US$250 to buy more fish to sell.

Mr. Sarat Y., 23, is a fisherman in Tonle Sap Lake, and he has been fishing for long time. Sarat is asking for a loan of US$200 to buy a net for fishing.

Mrs. Vany C., 47, is a farmer. She has a lot of experience in faming. Vany seeks a loan of US$150 to purchase a net to help her husband's fishing business.

They all live in Sarikakao Commune, Kandal Province.

loans.use: These people would each like to improve their fishing businesses by buying nets and bait for fish.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Jehova es mi Pastor, todas somos mujeres y nos conocemos desde hace mucho tiempo atras, somos muy amigas y nos ayududamos una con las otras, nuestro grupo se integra de esta manera:
Maria Luisa Maradiada: soy la coordinadora del grupo, soy madre y estoy casada, me dedico a vender comida y golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, baleadas, vendo refrescos de cola, tambien hago desayunos y almuerzos. esta actividad la realizo hace varios años.
Ana A.: ella se dedica a vender golosinas en el mismo lugar donde vive, asi no descuida su hogar, ella es madre de una niña y esta casada.
Maria de la Paz H.: ella es una señora casada y tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, la cual vende en eu casa desde hace varios años, con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo a salir adelante.
Etelvina M.: ella vive en la aldea de Lajero Blanco, es madre de un niño y es casada, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, ella tambien le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
todas nosotras necesitamos el credito ya que viene la temporada de navidad y es muy buena para la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Hi, we are the group called Jehova is my Pastor. We're all women and we've known each other for a very long time. We're friends and we help each other. Our group is made up of the following: Maria Luisa Maradiada who is the group coordinator. "I'm a mother and I'm married. I sell snacks and fast-food such as tacos, enchiladas, dessert and Coca-Cola soft drinks. I also sell breakfast and lunch. I've been doing this for many years." Ana A. sells snacks out of her home. This way she can take care of her children. She has a daughter and she's married. Maria de la Paz H.: She's married and has children. She sells brand new clothes out of her home for many years. She helps her husband with the bills. Etelvina Mardiaga: she lives in Lajero Blanco. She's a mother to a little boy and she's married. She sells brand new clothes. She also helps her husband pay the family expenses. We all need this loan since Christmas is aproaching and it's a good time to sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials and merchandise

loans.name: Mr.than Thol's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of 32 people is located in Sambuor Village in Kandal Province. Mr.Than T. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. He and his wife, Mrs. Thoch Vanna, are farmers who own a half-hectare section to cultivate rice to earn for living. In their plantation, they face a small problem because their field is infertile, so Mr.Than T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make the crops more productive.

Mr.Than T. is 54 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is working in a printing shop while the youngest one is attending the local school. All the members in this village bank are shown in the picture but some are not easy to see because they are blocked. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twenty-three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to make the crops more productive.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique Javier A. es un muchacho joven ,tiene apenas 20 años, emprendedor con la ayuda de sus padres tiene su propia micro empresa,y 12 personas trabajando en la misma, su sueño mas grande es comprarse el local donde tiene su negocio, que queda cerca de un mercado municipal mas grande de Asuncion.
Esta estudiando en la universidad,y se hizo una promesa a si mismo de que llegaría muy alto, para  lo cual debe ser organizado, disciplinado y responsable.
texts.en:
Enrique Javier A. is a young man barely 20 years old. With his parents' help, this entrepreneur has his own small business employing 12 people. His greatest dream is to buy the building where he has his business as it is near the largest municipal market in Asuncion. He is studying at university and has promised himself that he will go far in life, for which he needs to be organized, disciplined, and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy graphic equipment, 1 machine.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 40 años, está separada de su pareja, tiene dos hijos José Luis de 17 años y Edson de 10 con los cuales vive en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a brindar servicio de limpieza en el hospital de la ciudad de Juliaca, “Essalud”, el cual debe mantener muy limpio, ya que lo requiere siendo una institución dedicada a la salud, ella sabe de la importancia de ello y pone mucho empeño en hacer bien su trabajo, lo bueno es que gracias a él puede mantener a sus hijos, ya que tiene que enfrentarse sola a la vida y sacarlos adelante. Aún así Yolanda quiere progresar y poner un negocio alterno para generarse mayores ingresos es por eso que recurre a nuestra ayuda y solicita este crédito, que es el primero que tiene con MFP.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 40 years, separated from her partner, has two sons: Jose Luis -17 years old and Edson-10 years old. She lives with them at her parents' home. She provides cleaning services at the hospital in the city of Juliaca,"Essalud". She has to keep it very clean because it is a requirement being a health institution. She knows about its importance and puts a lot of effort on doing her job very well. Thanks to her job, she can provide to her sons since she has to face life on her own and help them to become good citizens. Yolanda wants to progress by establishing an alternate business to increase her income that is why she is asking for our help. She is asking for this loan which is her first with MFP.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Starting capital for a new business

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Agée de trente-cinq (35) ans, Mme Yvette K. est mariée avec trois (03) personnes à charge. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires et de produits de premières nécessités. Son dynamisme, son dévouement et la qualité de ses produits ont instauré une confiance énorme entre elle et ses clients qui ne cessent d’augmenter. Pour développer son commerce et faire face aux besoins de ses clients, elle sollicite un financement. Ce crédit lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie, rentabiliser son activité et accroître ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Yvette K., age 35, is married and has three people to support. She is the owner of a shop selling food items and essential goods. Her dynamism, devotion, and the quality of her products have instilled enormous trust between her and her customers, who are ever-growing in number. To develop her commerce and to address the needs of her customers, she is requesting financing. This loan will enable her to improve her living conditions, to make her business profitable, and to grow her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell food items

loans.name: Kodjovi Jocellin

texts.fr: Marié et père de 02 enfants, monsieur A. habite avec sa famille le quartier d’agoè qui est un quartier au nord de la ville de Lomé, pour pouvoir subvenir convenablement aux charges de sa famille, il a ouvert une boutique qu’il a appelé « ETS JOS LATINOS » dans la quelle il vend des appareils portables et accessoires. Il fait ce commerce depuis 2007, ce commerce marche bien pour lui et il s’approvisionne au marché de dekon à lomé. il souhaite rehausser son stock de portables et accessoires et il demande donc à wages un crédit pour acheter 20 portables et accessoires.
texts.en:
Mr. A. is married and the father of two children. He lives with his family in the Agoè quarter, a neighborhood located in the north of the city of Lomé. In order to provide for his family, he opened a store called "Ets Jos Lationos" where he sells mobile phones and accessories. He's been running this business since 2007, and it works well for him. He gets his supplies at the Dekon market in Lomé. To bolster his stock of mobile phones and accessories, he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to buy 20 phones and accessories.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tu buy 20 mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en:
Daphine A. is a 24 year old mother of one child, a boy, named Toni Braxton (after the singer). Her husband is a driver and though she is not from Rongo, she loves the weather.

She makes her own ice cream and sells it in the open market in Rongo. She mixes water, sugar and flavors, puts them in polythene and freezes them. Her number one flavor is orange. Daphine hopes she can grow her business with this loan of 20,000 KSH.

loans.use: Buy icream suppllies.

loans.name: Fatima De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Fátima
texts.en: Mrs. Fátima

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies to improve and diversify her crops

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga J. is 43, married and the father of three children. All his children attend elementary school. Together with his wife Nosolmoo, he has been running a retail business since 1999. He goes to the countryside to sell food products to herders and buys whole animals for meat to resell to residents of the central provinces capital. When he started his business he had one million tugrugs. As a result of ten years of hard work, his working capital has increased to five million tugrugs. With the profit, he bought a vehicle for his business and family needs. Gantulga is a very open and loyal person. His hope is to provide his children with a high level education. He requests a loan to buy more food products to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy fmore ood products

loans.name: Socorro Paz

texts.es: Socorro Paz López tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Socorro no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Socorro es la venta de comida. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Socorro es una mujer muy emprendedora, y con este negocio ha hecho muchas cosas, porque con el mismo negocio ha logrado  realizarles mejoras a su vivienda. Los propósitos de Socorro son de salir adelante con su negocio. El financiamiento es destinando para capital de trabajo y así realizar compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, refrescos naturales, queso, repollo y otros. El sueño de Socorro mejorar el servicio brindado a sus clientes para que estos queden satisfechos con su comida.
texts.en:
Socorro Paz López is 57 years old and single with no children. She has been selling food for more than ten years. She is a very enterprising woman, and has been able to do many things thanks to her business, including make home improvements. Soccoro wants to get ahead in life with her business. She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy rice, beans, oil, natural drinks, cheese, cabbage and other ingredients. Socorro's dream is to improve her customer service in order to leave her customers satisfied with their meals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, cheese, oil, beans, cabbage and natural drinks

loans.name: Hoàng Diệu

texts.en:
H. Hoàng Diệu (621070724) is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has two infants.

H. owns and operates a business selling home products, primarily selling furniture to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business. The loan will be her 2nd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa D. Jesús tiene 59 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios D. primaria completa, tiene 6 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Teresa se dedica  a apoyar a  sus hijos y esposo en la pesca colaborando con la compra D. materiales D. pescar, mantenimiento y reparación del barco.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Las Emprendedoras II”, lo invirtió en la compra D. materiales para tejer las redes D. pescar junto con el apoyo D. sus hijos y esposo.
Con este crédito D. S/ 1,200 lo invertirá en la compra D. mas redes D. pescar ya que las que tiene actualmente se encuentran deterioradas y su familia depenD. D. la pesca para vender y obtener dinero para sus gastos.
Teresa  tiene como sueño, tejer mas redes D. pescar, comprar pinturas y darle mantenimiento  a su barco para que este listo dentro D. 3 meses que empezara la pesca.
texts.en:
Teresa D. Jesús is 59 years old and lives in Salaverry district, in Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a businesswoman who completed her primary school education and has 6 children, none of whom are financially dependent on her. Teresa works supporting her children and her husband in their fishing business - she contributes to the purchase of fishing equipment along with the maintenance and repair of their boat. She used the first loan of 300 soles she received from “Las Emprendedoras II” Communal Bank to invest in the purchase of materials for making fishing nets, together with the support of her children and her husband. She will use the current loan of 1,200 soles to invest in the purchase of more fishing nets, because the nets she currently has have deteriorated, and her family depends on fishing as their livelihood so they can earn money to make ends meet. Teresa’s goal is to make more fishing nets, purchase paint, and do maintenance on their boat so that it will be ready for her family to begin fishing again within 3 months.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of material for making fishing nets

loans.name: Antonia Amanda

texts.es: Antonia Amanda G. Q. tiene 40 años. Es una mujer casada, con 2 hijos. Desde muy joven estuvo involucrada en muchos negocios de comercios. Lo cual fue de mucha ayuda pues logro perfeccionar sus habilidades para las ventas. Pues para ella ha sido lo más importante tener su propio negocio. Antonia se dedica a una pulpería. Por lo que debido a sus problemas económicos de una enfermedad que sufrió su esposo. Por lo que Antonia se levanta muy temprano desde las 6 de la mañana hasta a las 9 de la noche. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas en general, galletas y jugos. Su mayor sueño es establecer otro negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia Amanda G. Q. is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children. From an early age she has been involved in many business ventures. These have helped her to perfect her skills in sales. For Antonia, it has been so important that she has her own business, a neighborhood store. Her financial difficulties are due to an illness her husband suffered from. Thus Antonia gets up very early and works from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. The use of her loan will be for working capital to buy staple grains, candy, cookies and juice. Her biggest dream is to establish another business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sijali

texts.en: Sijali R. is a married woman who runs a clothing shop in the Tandika ward of Dar es Salaam.  She purchases the clothing she sells from wholesale and retail shops in the Kariakoo city shopping center and from the Karume microbusiness city market.  Sijali has been in business for three years, and the income from her shop has enabled her to meet her family's daily financial demands and to pay school fees.  She is requesting a loan for TZS 1,000,000 to buy more clothing to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Nuve Victoria

texts.es:
Nuve Victoria vive en las calles General Torres y Gaspar Sangurima en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 38 años, tiene 4 hijos de 18, 17, 14, 10 años de edad, todos sus hijos están estudiando en el colegio Manuel J. Calle y el menor en la escuela Ezequiel Crespo, lleva varios años separada por que su esposo emigro dejándole con sus hijos aun pequeños y aún viven arrendando.

Desarrolla muchas labores los cuales le han permitido salir adelante, trabaja en la EMAC (Empresa Muncipal de Aseo de Cuenca)de lunes a viernes y su horario es de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. y los fines de semana trabaja como comerciante vendiendo ropa muy surtida, también se dedica a la venta productos para la belleza de la mujer como son los productos de Yanbal.

Lleva en su negocio unos 6 años y dice que la ventaja de trabajar así es que de sus ventas obtiene para pagar del arriendo y unos gastos más de su casa.

Es su tercer ciclo trabajando con la fundación y le da mucha emoción porque va logrando superarse poco a poco, el préstamo que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería  como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, y mas productos de belleza Yambal, de esta manera  prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientas.

Su sueño es llegar a comprar un carro para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nuve Victoria lives on the streets General Torres and Gaspar Sangurima in the center of the city of Cuenca. She is 38 years old, and has four children, aged 18, 17, 14, and 10 years old. All of her children are studying in the high school Manuel J. Calle, and the youngest is in the school Ezequiel Crespo. She has been separated for several years because her husband migrated, leaving her with their young children, living in a rented house.

She has many jobs which have allowed her to get ahead. She works in the EMAC (Empresa Municipal de Aseo de Cuenca) (Municipal Waste Services of Cuenca) from Monday to Friday from 8am to 6pm. On the weekends, she works as a shopkeeper selling a wide variety of clothing. She also sells women's beauty products, such as Yanbal products.

She has had her business 6 years or so, and says that the advantage of working like that is that from her sales she is able to pay her rent and some more expenses of the home. It is her third time working with the foundation, and it gives her a lot of excitement, because she will continue getting ahead little by little. She will invest the loan in the purchase of additional merchandise, such as clothing for women, men, and children, and more Yanbal beauty products. This way she will offer a better service to her customers.

Her dream is to purchase a car in order to give better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of merchandise such as clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children, and Yanbal products

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria es soltera, de 42 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, la mayor de 19 años y el menor de 13, ambos estudiando, vive en el Municipio de Cuapa, labora para el MINED desempeñandose como maestra de primaria con 22 años de servicio, con sus creditos ha logrado dar mejores condiciones a su casa y fue beneficiada con el fondo kiva, esta solicitando su 12vo credito y espera que AFODENIC y KIVA la siga apoyando para lograr la construccion de un cuarto en su casa y contar con mayor comodidad para sus hijos, pues ambos necesitan tener privacidad, y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is single, 42 years old and has 2 children. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest 13, both of whom study. She lives in the municipality of Cuapa and works for the institute MINED, where she holds a position as a primary school teacher with 22 years of service. With her previous loans she has benefited from Kiva funds by improving the conditions of her house. She is applying for her twelfth loan and hopes that both AFODENIC and Kiva continue supporting her so that she can construct a bedroom in her house and provide the best of comfort for her children, as both of them need their privacy. In this way she can improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en: N. Safina is the leader of her lending group in Kayunga. She is a hard working, devoted and friendly lady with a restaurant as her business in Kitimbwa. She has been operating for over 8 years and is happy that she is able to make 60,000/= as profits a week; which in turn help her in taking care of her family as well as saving for her children’s education. She has been able to buy herself a plot of land and she hopes to build rental houses once she gets money to build. In her restaurant, she prepares local dishes for breakfast, lunch and supper and over the years and because of her good cooking, she has many customers. Safina is in need of a loan to help buy more food stuffs for her restaurant and partly pay school fees for her 4 children.

loans.use: Buying more food stuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Luz De Los Cachorros Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Luz D. Los Cachorros inicia su primer ciclo con 20 socias.
Las socias son integrantes D. una asociación D. ayuda a menores con problemas familiares, todos ellos realizan tejidos, bordados, sandalias, productos que venden en ferias regionales.
Las socias además realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes en general, comidas, ropa, frutas, libros, condimentos, regalos, brindan servicios D. electricista, sastrería y también elaboran tejidos, bordados.
Sus ventas los realizan en sus casas, en locales alquilados, en mercados D. L. ciudad y D. manera ambulatoria.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 7800 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. frutas, ropa, lanas, materiales para sus trabajos.
Los sueños D. las socias son brindar un buen hogar a sus hijos, tener casa propia, sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Para la compra de frutas, ropa, lanas, materiales para sus trabajos.

loans.name: Pastora Del C.

texts.en:
Pastora runs a small store, a “pulpería”, in the city of Chinandega. She is requesting a loan to buy products in bulk for her store. This will be much cheaper for her and will allow her to sell her products for less. 

Pastora’s pulpería has been open for 4 years and is located inside her house. "The loans help me a lot," she said. "They allow my business to keep growing." Pastora is single with several adult children.  Support from her children helped her open her store 4 years ago.

loans.use: To buy products in bulk for her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is married and has four children. She has received junior high education.  Mary sells dried peppers and powdered spices at Elmina market, which she has been doing since 2001. Her husband is a trader.  Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Mary will use the loan to purchase bags of dried pepper and other spices. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase bags of dried pepper and other spices.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
This committee Barrio San Pedro was formed through the initiative of one of the members, Mrs Analia Del Valley who came to the foundation in order to learn about the program.
This committee was formed from women who run businesses such as selling clothing and lingerie, cupboards, selling edible goods, rotisserie, phone accessories, etc.
Depending on availability and creativity, each member decides how to use the Fundacion's support structure for their businesses, such as budgeting or training workshops.
Ms Silvana L. is a perfect example of a successful female entrepreneur, who sells clothing across Encarnacion, the city where she lives. She does not own a car, so she has to move around her products to her customers, which takes a lot of time and hard work. Sometimes her husband and children help her, as it is very labor-intensive. 
 Mrs. Juana A., another hard working female entrepreneur, owns a pantry, with which she can help family expenses. Her husband has been working in woodworking for over 10 years and has a large number of customers, however, his profits are insufficient to cover household expenses. Juana's business is essential to the livelihood of their family. 
The loans given to these women by the Fundacion Paraguaya are essential in improving the living conditions of families and helping them grow. The 

The amount received by each woman varies from 300,000 to 2,000,000, which the women use to invest in their independent businesses.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Chreob

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreob P. lives in Tralach village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She is a 42-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a company while the others are attending the local school.

Now Mrs. Chreob P. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her first child to drive to work.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her first child to drive to work

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is forty one years old. She is widowed and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in printed fabrics. Rosemary hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over eighteen years and desires to give her business a facelift. Rosemary therefore wants the loan to procure many kinds of printed fabrics in bulk to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics

loans.name: Guljan's Group

texts.en:
N. Guljan is the leader of this group. She comes from Karabalta, a small city to the west of Bishkek. Guljan and her husband achieved all their possessions through hard work and perseverance. They know that everything in life comes gradually. Guljan is forty-seven years old. Her husband works as a procurement manager in a local high school.

Guljan is a housewife but she is also engaged in raising livestock and sells milk. Twenty-five years ago, she inherited some cattle from her parents. She had a choice to sell everything and have a regular job, but instead she decided to increase what had been left to her. During these years she has accomplished that. Moreover, through raising cattle she has been able to raise five beautiful children and build a house, and furnish it.

The children have grown. The eldest daughter is married and lives separately. One of the sons works in Russia. One of the daughters goes to college, and the rest of the children go to school. Guljan has applied for this loan to purchase coal for the rest of the winter season. She is going to complete the building of the house, buy a car, and increase the total population of her livestock.

Guljan’s partners:

Baktiyar, 28, is single. He raises and trades in cattle. He needs a loan to buy some cattle for feeding and resale.

Nurzada, 24, is single. She is engaged in raising cattle. She hopes to obtain a loan and buy some items of furniture.

Janatkul, 40, has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She stays at home and looks after cattle. Janatkul hopes to get this loan and buy coal.

Dilbar, 57, is the mother of three children. Her husband is an inspector at the market. She is a housewife. Dilbar keeps some cows and sells milk. She needs a loan to buy furniture.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase coal for the rest of the winter season

loans.name: Ildefonsa

texts.es:
Ildefonsa, de 57 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos; Víctor de 24 y Candy de 13, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La gran sazón que posee ha hecho que su restaurante sea uno de los más concurridos del barrio “Las Flores” de la ciudad de Juliaca. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, quienes conocedores del delicioso sabor de sus comidas no dudan en asistir para disfrutar de un apetecible menú familiar. Le está yendo tan bien que ha decidido vender por la noche comida rápida en una carretilla, la cual le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y ver como sus comensales disfrutan de su comida, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes ella sola, ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para contratar a una persona que le ayude. 
Con el tiempo, espera mejorar su restaurante y brindarles un servicio más completo a sus clientes.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Ildefonsa con MFP y se siente en la obligación de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina, para mejorar la atención en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Ildefonsa, 57 years old, is the mother of a loving family. She lives in her home with her two children, Victor (24) and Candy (13) – the motivation for all that she does. Her great seasoning is the reason her restaurant is one the most frequented in the Las Flores neighborhood of Juliaca. Her customers are mostly her neighbors, who are familiar with the delicious taste of her food, and come to enjoy a familiar meal. It’s going so well because she has decided to sell fast food from a cart at night. This has helped her improve her earnings. On the other hand, what she likes most about her job is cooking and seeing how her customers enjoy her food. She has been doing this for 35 years and finds that attending to all of her customers by herself is the most difficult part. She doesn’t have the money right now to hire someone to help her. In time, she would like to improve her restaurant and provide more complete service to her customers. This is Ildefonsa’s sixth loan with MFP and she feels obliged to pay on time since she doesn’t want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she is much loved. With the three thousand soles she is asking for, she will buy new tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils to improve the environment of her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Josephine
