texts.en: Josephine A. owns and manages a small sari-sari store business. She has nine children and desires to have a very stable business for her entire family. She has been a client of Community Economic Ventures Inc three times and she wants to take out more loans from CEVI because at 2% per month it has the lowest interest rate. She would like to request a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Paula Genoveva

texts.es:
Paula tiene 65 años D. edad, es casada, todos sus hijos ya están independizados y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Mochumí, un distrito agrícola ubicado media hora al norte D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Tiene instalada una bodega en su domicilio desD. hace diez años. El negocio nació debido a la necesidad por obtener un ingreso económico estable con el cual sostener a su familia, ya que su esposo es agricultor y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para mantenerlos.

En su bodega ella ofrece todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, abarrotes y verduras a sus clientes que siempre acuden a su establecimiento debido a la calidad D. servicio que brinda. Paula desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería con la cual poder seguir satisfaciendo la demanda D. sus cientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Paula es una mujer emprendedora y que dia a dia lucha por salir adelante. Sus vecinos y clientes la consideran una mujer honrada y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Paula is 65 years old, married, and has two adult children. She lives with her husband in the Mochumí district, which is an agricultural district located 30 minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. She’s been running a small shop from her home for the past 10 years. The business was born from the need to establish a steady income with which to support her family. Her husband is a farmer and his income is not enough. She sells basic household items, groceries and vegetables to her customers who frequent her shop because of the good service she provides. Paula would like to expand her business by investing in more items so she can continue to satisfy her customers’ needs, so she is requesting this first loan of 2,000 PEN ($700) to help her meet her objective. Paula is an enterprising woman who works daily to get ahead. Her neighbors and customers consider her to be an honest woman who is always available whenever they need her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercadería para ampliación de negocio.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen  soltera  de 35 años de edad, es comerciante y  tiene una hija de 14 años  llamada Patricia quien se encuentra cursando   el octavo grado de la  Educación Básica.
 La Sra. Carmen comenta que empezó trabajando como empleada en un salón comercial y que hace más de 3 años pudo conseguir el capital de trabajo para poner su propio negocio. 
Actualmente cuenta con un surtido salón comercial en el que trabaja  día a día  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.  En dicho lugar vende prendas usadas de todo tipo, afirma que tiene clientela bien formada y que le compran en forma periódica. 
Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya y solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías, ya que actualmente sus ventas han aumentado.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen is single, 35 years old, a store keeper and has a 14 year old daughter, Patricia. Patricia is currently in the 8th grade of her primary education. Sra. Carmen tells us that she started working as an employee in a retail space, and that more than 3 years ago she was able to put together the capital to open her own business. Currently she has a stocked retail space in which she works day after day to give her whole family a better life. In this retail space, she sells all types of second-hand garments. She states that she has a steady clientele who buy from her periodically. She has decided to put her trust in Fundación Paraguaya and is requesting the loan in order to purchase merchandise, since sales have recently gone up.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, (pants, t-shirts, skirts, jeans and shoes, among other items)

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Fátima C. se destaca como excelente comerciante porque vende perecederos como lo son frutas y verduras todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana en el mercado.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras como mandarinas, naranjas, naranja agria, y limones para proceder a su venta y de esta manera obtener el ingreso para invertir en el negocio y por ende beneficiar a su familia compuesta por sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Fátima C. stands out as an excellent merchant because she sells perishables like fruites and vegetables every day, starting very early in the morning, in Managua's Mayoreo market. She is asking for funds to buy fruits and vegetables like: mandarin oranges, oranges, sour oranges and lemons to continue with her sales thus earning income to invest in her business and benefit her family, which consists of three children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rega¤On

texts.en:
Rega¤on L. is from the village of Baniga, Liloy, Zamboanga del norte. She is 56 years old. Rega¤on is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Rega¤on owns & operates a businessraising livestock (pigs) for sale. Rega¤on has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rega¤on joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rega¤on has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Rega¤on is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rega¤on from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: 10.1.2 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Quế N. Thị (8) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa. She is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 10.1.2 Nam Ngạn Group.

Quế is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Quế owns and operates a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling herbs and spices in the local community. Quế has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Quế joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 1.963.500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women which was successfully repaid, her new loan of 4.248.000 VND will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan that Quế has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Đỗ Thị Lửa (6) is a 65-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

2.  B. Thị Đắc (7) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
49-year-old Arcelita R. has proven her reproductive role as a woman. She gave birth to five loving children from her husband Ricardo. All throughout her 25 years of motherhood and 26 years of married life, she has had no other intention but to help her husband support the needs of their children and provide them with a life that is enjoyable and worth living. Therefore, in 2004 she took the opportunity to enhance her capability to becoming productive. She joined ASHI and the loan she has able to avail was her means to establishing her own livelihood, which is hog/pig fattening and/or breeding. The piglets are fattened and some will be sold. Her fattened hogs are sold to market and to people in their village either slaughtered or alive after four months. 

Arcelita and her family enjoy the profit her business is gaining. It is a huge help to augment her husband’s small amount of honorarium for being the village councilor. Through her membership in ASHI, by maintaining a very good performance in terms of repayment, and attendance at ASHI weekly center meeting, Arcelita wishes to take more loans to be able to have the opportunity to grow her business and earn more profit. This will be her means to support the needs of her four children who have stopped studying, though she still hopes that they will decide to go back to school and finish their studies until college just like her eldest child.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, feed and vaccine

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha vive en casa alquilada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, con su madre y sus dos hijos.

Martha es empleada de la Alcaldía Municipal  de esta ciudad, con sus ingresos ella mantiene a su familia.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de víveres al por mayor y venderlos al por menor y a si aumentar sus ingresos. Esta es una segunda actividad que ella realiza para poder tener mejores ingresos.

Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Martha lives in a rented home in the Alto San Pedro section of the city of La Paz. She lives with her mother and her two children. Martha is an employee at the city’s Town Hall and supports her family with the income from this job. The loan is being requested to buy goods at wholesale, to later sell at retail so she can augment her income. This is a second activity she carries out in order to improve her earnings. This is the first time she requests a loan, and the financial analysis conducted favorably qualifies her to access credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods at wholesale, to then sell at retail.

loans.name: Elbia Regina

texts.es:
Regina tiene 35 años es divorciada y tiene un hijo de 8 años ella se dedica a la elaboración de queques  y venta de productos de RENAWARE , la elaboración de queques lo realiza en su casa y vende repartiendo local por local; ella elabora semanalmente 6 queques y gana 4 soles por cada queque lo prepara de manera ínter diaria (lunes ,Miércoles, viernes).su meta de ella es llegar a tener una pastelería y preparar diferentes tipos de bocaditos y que su hijo sea profesional ella dice que le gusta mucho su negocio por que le queda tiempo para poder compartirlo con su hijo.

Ella también vende al crédito los productos de RENAWARE y los cobra de cuota en cuota. ella menciona que desde que esta en FINCA PERÜ cambio su vida ya que ella aprendió la importancia del ahorro.
Ella invertirá el dinero en la compra de quequeras, cocina, harina, mantequilla, huevo, azúcar.
texts.en:
Regina, 35, is divorced and has an 8-year-old son. She works baking cakes and selling Renaware products. She bakes the cakes at home and delivers them to various shops. She makes six cakes a week and earns 4 soles for each cake. She bakes on alternate days (Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays). Her goal is to one day have a bakery and make different kinds of pastries, and that her son would become a professional. She says she enjoys her business very much because she still has time to spend with her son. She also sells Renaware products on credit, accepting regular payments for them. She mentions that since she joined up with Finca Peru her life has changed since she has learned the importance of saving. She will invest the money in the purchase of cake pans, a stove/cooker, flour, butter, eggs and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cake pans, a stove/cooker, flour, butter, eggs and sugar

loans.name: Ngurn

texts.en: Mrs. Ngurn Ngurng is 51 years old and is a villager who lives in Romiet village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who works very hard to support her two children. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. With the farm, she still earns to little income to support her family's costs of living. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets and pig food for breeding. With the loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's standard of living. Mrs. Ngurn Ngurng is a widow with two children who are construction workers.

loans.use: To buy five piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Be Marie

texts.en:
Be Marie M. is from the village of Mitazan, Aloran Mis. Occ.  She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children.  To make a living, Be Marie makes and sells food, mostly snacks and other delicacies in the local community.  She has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2002, Be Marie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900.00 PHP from PMPC.  Be Marie is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.  This loan will be her 12th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to support her family. 

----------------------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Jesús Vásquez A. es una persona que fue abandonada por su esposa y es padre de 3 hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación el primero tiene 9 años el estudia por las mañanas y por las tardes ayuda en la alimentación de ganado porcino, el segundo tiene 5 años también está en kínder el cual aun es muy joven para ayudar en las labores y quehaceres de la familiares y por ultimo tiene una niña de 3 años de edad a la cual cuida su madre que vive junto a ellos y ayuda en la educación de sus nietos.

El Señor Jesús se levanta a muy tempranas horas por las mañanas para ir a la parada de minibuses para agarrar el turno que le corresponde y así poder  empezar su labor semanal,  el viaja dos veces al día y tres veces a la semana, los demás días el se dedica al cultivo de pequeños cultivos y la cría de ganado porcino,  para así poder llevar el sustento de su hogar y darles lo mejor a su familia.

El cliente se entero de este crédito por la radio ya que constantemente pasan una propaganda,  que se dan créditos en CIDRE, el se aproximo a las oficinas para solicitar un crédito para incrementar sus cabezas de ganado porcino. Su mayor sueño es en un futuro tener una pequeña granja de Ganado Porcino.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús Vásquez A.’s wife left him with three children to support. He sees to the education of his three children. The oldest is 9 years old and goes to school in the morning and helps out in the afternoons feeding the pigs. The second child is five years old and is in Kindergarten and still too young to help with chores. The youngest is a 3-year-old daughter who is cared for by their grandmother who lives with them and helps raise the grandchildren. Jesús rises very early in the morning to go to the minibus stop to take on his shift and start his weekly work. His run is twice daily and three times a week. The rest of the days he spends tending to his small crops and to raise pigs in order to provide for his home and give the best to his family. He found out about these loans through the radio because there are ads constantly about CIDRE loans. He called upon the offices to request funds to increase his pig herd size. His greatest wish is to have a small pig farm.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia Danelia

texts.es: Cecilia Danelia de 51 años, ella se dedica a vender mercadería en general, anteriormente ella solo vendía ropa y perfumes, Comenzó hace 4 años con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y decidió comenzar a vender otras cosas, ella siempre ha sido una persona muy triunfadora y que no  se deja  abatir por las malas situaciones. Trabaja desde las 7de la mañana hasta las 6 de tarde, por lo que siempre tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos. Con este financiamiento comprara más mercadería como sabanas, perfumes, pinturas de labios, tratamientos para la piel y el cabello.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 51, works in retail. Prior she sold only clothing and perfume. She began four years ago and as time passed, she gained experience and started to sell other things. Cecilia has always been a very tenacious person and doesn’t let bad circumstances get in her way. She works from 7 in the morning until 6 at night which is why she has a wide variety of customer who request different products. With this loan, she will buy merchandise such as linens, perfumes, lipstick, and hair and skin treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona B. is from the village of Siare. She is 53 years old, married and has 6 children. To make a living, Melitona owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melitona has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Melitona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Melitona’s 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Enn

texts.en: Mrs. Enn M. was born in 1952 and lives in Samna Khmau village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokha Chea, are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family; her husband is also a palm juice collector. Mrs. Enn M. has some problems because her field's soil is infertile. To improve production, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and to rent a plowing machine to plow her field. She is the mother of three children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and one is a student.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to rent a plowing machine

loans.name: Roza's Group

texts.en:
Roza J., 44 and divorced, is the leader of this group. Both of her sons make their livelihood by working in Russia. Roza's main source of income is cattle breeding, a business she started five years ago with two sheep and a calf. From the proceeds she has managed to organize her son’s wedding. Roza is now requesting a loan to purchase sheep for fattening and breeding, and in the future she is planning to arrange her second son’s wedding, build a new house, and acquire grazing land for cattle.

Anarhon S. is the treasurer of the group. She is a 45-year-old married mother of three children, the eldest of whom works in Russia, while the other two are students. The family's business is cattle breeding, and they currently have two milk cows and two calves. Their business earnings have enabled them to provide an education for their children and build a house. The loan will allow for the purchase of a cow for fattening, and in future Anarhon wants to increase their cattle stock and build a house for her sons.

Bakytbek A. is a 44-year-old married father of three sons, all students, and a daughter who works with her mother in Russia. The main family business is cattle breeding, a business they started three years ago with only one calf. From subsequent profits the family has managed to build a temporary house. The loan's purpose is to purchase feed for cattle, and in the future Bakytbek is planning to increase his cattle stock, obtain a car, and give a proper education to his children.

Asilbek A., 37 and married to a farmer, is the father of three children, two of whom are students, while the youngest is a toddler. The family is engaged in cattle breeding and they currently have a cow, a calf, and ten sheep. Earnings have enabled them to purchase a tractor for ploughing. The loan's purpose is to buy spare parts for the tractor, and in the future Asilbek is planning to increase his cattle stock and build a house for his son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is a very supportive lady. She always remains ready to support her family in every way possible. She operates her sewing business at her home to support her family in fulfilling their basic needs. She also sells goats as her second business. She buys them from the animal market, raises them up and sells for a good profit. Besides her businesses, she is also a very good housewife and a very caring mother. She is rearing her five children very well. Her husband is a daily-wage laborer.
   
Shamshad has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her business of selling goats. With the loan she will buy goats to expand her business.  She is hopeful that this investment will help her to make a good profit, which she will use for the education of her children.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a responsible client and fulfills her duties responsibly.  
 
She lives with her family in a two-room brick house in a small city named Khanewal in Pakistan. Khanewal is famous for its agriculture industry.  

Note: In the photo, Shamshad is the lady who is holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) in her hands.

loans.use: To buy goats for reselling

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Mayla, who is 38 years old and happily married, has four dependent children. She operates a store and retails rice in a nearby village and is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her store and to support her rice business.

With her loan and profits, Mayla hopes to be able to afford to send her children to school until they achieve college degrees. Mayla, who had a previous loan with ASHI, was on time in making all of her repayments and so is able to request more for this loan. She is very glad to be a Kiva borrower and expresses her gratitude to lenders for helping fund her two ventures.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her store and to support rice retail business

loans.name: Melissa Jacqueline

texts.es:
Melissa tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola conformada por varios caseríos considerados como zonas rurales. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales desde hace dos años. Ella cuenta con un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio en donde cría animales menores, los suele comercializar con los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente posee una pequeña bodega en su vivienda donde ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes.

Melissa desea ampliar su negocio de crianza de animales adquiriendo mas ejemplares y alimento balanceado, asimismo desea adquirir mas productos para su bodega, con esta inversión espera aumentar su nivel de ingresos y ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y hogareña.
texts.en:
Melissa is 25 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and son in Mórrope district, an agricultural area which is made up of a number of villages which are considered rural areas.  It is in Lambayeque province, forty-five minutes from Chiclayo.

Melissa raises and sells animals.  She has been doing this for two years.  She has a pen behind her house where she raises young animals.  She usually sells them to traders who visit her area.  She also owns a small grocery store in her home where she offers her neighbors a number of basic household products and groceries.

Melissa would like to expand her animal raising business by acquiring more animals and balanced feed.  She would also like to acquire more products for her grocery store.  With this investment she would like to increase her income and help her husband to get the family ahead in life.  She is quite a responsible and home-loving woman.

loans.use: To buy young animals and balanced feed.  To expand her business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a thirty-one-year-old single mother, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with an aspiration of educating her child up to university. She operates a salon, with ten years of experience.  She has a business dream of having a popular beauty parlor in the future.  Christine needs the loan to buy more cosmetics for the salon.

loans.use: Buying cosmetics for the salon

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva T.  is currently in the business of selling sugar, rice, and charging phones.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and sugar to sell.  Eva is 20 years old and is married.  Her husband is a driver. She has 1 child.  Her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM est crée le 14/05/2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues du même quartier. le groupe a été composé par voisinage et par affinité entre ses membres. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de FONK SA BOPP GRAND LOUGA 

NDEYE PENDA K. debout à l'extrême droit de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge de se 07 petits fils et neveu.

Elle fait de la couture et la broderie depuis plusieurs années, elle fait aussi de la coiffure 

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et de mobiliser beaucoup d'épargnes tout en appui la famille en nourriture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOKK JOM was created on 5/14/10. It is made up of 12 women from the same neighborhood, who came together as neighbors and friends. 

The group is part  of the Banc Villageois  of Fonk Sa Bopp Grand Louga.  Ndeye Penda K., standing at the far right of the photo, is the group's leader. She is married and the mother of 2 dependent children. She also cares for her 7 grandchildren and nephew. For several years, she has been involved in sewing and embroidery, she also does hair styling. Her goal is to strengthen her activities and  put a large amount of money into savings, as well as supporting the family's expenses for food.

loans.use: To buy embroidery and sewing supplies

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. is married and has ten dependents. She makes and sells "Aboodo" in Elmina. "Aboodo" is the local name for a baked dish made from corn flour and sugar.  It is wrapped in a green leaf before baking. 

Maame has been in this business for ten years. Her husband is a fisherman. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase extra bags of maize to use in preparing Aboodo for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to educate her dependents.

The picture shows Maame removing the baked Aboodo.

loans.use: To purchase maize to make Aboodo

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha S. is from the village of Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 21 years old. Editha is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Editha from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a 66-year-old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a livestock business. She lives in Calatrava, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1991 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.  Modesto is borrowing PHP 30,000 to purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 30,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Modesto aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
Cosme, tiene 34 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella vive en la comunidad de Tambo Real distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Cosme es hombre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia, él es taxista y brinda servicio de Cusco – Anta y viceversa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Cosme en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento del carro. 

Cosme pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cosme is 34 years old and has a son.  He lives in the Tambo Real community in the Anta District, department of Cusco.  Cosme is a very hard-working, enterprising man who provides for his family.  He is a taxi driver and offers service between Cusco and Anta and viceversa.  He has been in this business for several years and has been successful at it because of his hard work.  Cosme needs a loan to pay for automobile maintenance.

Cosme is a member of the "San Bartolomé de Tambo Real" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  He is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To pay for automobile maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents. She has owned a small grocery store since 2009. She has done statistics of her town and was able to have a deep understanding of local consumer needs. She is thankful for her decision to start her business, because with her income she was able to help her father with the family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve her business. She will purchase additional merchandise in order to better satisfy her customer’s demands.  She is very optimistic and has lots of future plans.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 59 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant y también lleva productos secos a la ciudad de Arequipa, el socio trabaja en el restaurant desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar la atención de su restaurant.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y fideos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan belongs to the Siempre Unidos (Always United) village bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district of Cusco province in the state of Cusco.

Juan is 59 years old and lives with his partner with whom he has 2 children.  He alternates between two primary activities: running a restaurant and transporting dry goods to the city of Arequipa.  He works in the restaurant from 8 am to 7 pm.  Through these small businesses, he is able to provide for his children.  He would like to improve the service in his restaurant.  He is seeking a loan to buy ingredients like rice, beef, and noodles.

He is happy to receive the loan and commits to repay it punctually.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients like rice, beef, and noodles.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: La señora Maty como es conocida en su localidad tiene 45 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Laurentino el cual es albañil ellos tienen 11 hijos pero nada mas 7 viven con ellos de nombres Juan Carlos, Laura ambos estudiantes de secundaria, Jorge, Salvador, Roberto, Marco Antonio estudiantes de primaria y el pequeño Laurentino de 5 meses de edad. Doña Matilde se dedica al cultivo de aguacate, ella tiene un huerta de aproximadamente 200 árboles y tiene con ella 10 años dice que empezaron este proyecto porque su esposo empezó comprándole las plantas de tres cada quincena y ella las cultivaba y así poco a poco se hicieron de su huerta, en tiempo de cosecha sale a vender sus aguacates a la central de abastos de Zitacuaro por cubetas y abecés le rentan los árboles a los clientes que ya tienen. Ella esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para la compra de fertilizantes y de manguera para el riego de estas ya que les queda un poco retirado la toma de agua y para que todas alcancen a regarse y no se le seque en esta temporada de calor ira a comprar la manguera ya que ahorita tienen un poco de fruto pequeño y las esta cuidando mucho para que no se le sequen. La meta que tiene la señora Matilde con su huerta es seguir sembrando mas árboles de este fruto ya que si le dejan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Maty, as she is known in her town, is 45 years old. She is married to Laurentino, who is a mason. They have 11 children, but only 7 live with them: by name, Juan Carlos, Laura (both secondary school students), Jorge, Salvador, Roberto, Marco Antonio (elementary school students) and little Laurentino, who is 5 months old. Matilde works growing avocados. She has a farm that has approximately  200 trees, and she has worked it for 10 years. She says that she began this project because her husband started to buy the plants by threes every two weeks, and she cultivated them. Thus, little by little they established their farm. During harvest time, she goes out to sell her avocados by the bucketful at the central warehouse of Zitacuaro, and sometimes they rent trees that already have fruit to customers. She is requesting a loan from the financial institution to buy fertilizers and hoses for irrigation, since the water source is a little bit far away, and this will help her reach all the trees to water them, so they don't dry out during this hot season. She will go to buy the hose because she will soon have some small fruit on the trees, and she is taking good care of them so that they don't dry out. Matilde's goal with her farm is to keep planting more avocado trees since they are giving her good earnings.

loans.use: buy supplies for her avocado farm.

loans.name: John Njogu

texts.en:
John Njogu, 44 years old, is married to Ann Njeri. They are both farmers, and John has been operating his farm for a period of about ten years with an income of 8,000 KES a month.

John is receiving his first loan from Kadet in order to buy seedlings and animal feed. He hopes to own a bigger dairy so as to deliver more milk to the surrounding community.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chuluunsuh

texts.en: Chuluunsuh is 53 years old and lives with his wife in a house in Dornod province, Mongolia. All his adult children work and live separately. Chuluunsuh manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2006 after working as a driver in a public organization for 29 years. Taxi service is not an easy business to conduct. However, Chuluunsuh has worked hard to stabilize his business. In 2010, he managed to change his car in order to provide safe and comfortable service for his customers. The taxi service business is the only source of income for his family, so he is planning to expand and continue his business in the future. Chuluunsuh is a friendly man who says, "I would like to renew my car again." He is requesting a 750,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Latif

texts.ru: Latif 41 let. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Latif jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Latif uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey pishevix produktov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo druqa kotoriy i pomog yemu otkrit etot magazin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya preprodaji i razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Latif is 41 years old.  He lives in Baku with his family.  Latif is married and has three children.  Latif has been a grocer for seven years.  He started this business with his friend who helped him open the shop.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy groceries to sell and to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for sale

loans.name: Alba Patricia

texts.es:
La dura situación económica por la que atravesó Alba Patricia hace algunos años cuando su esposo se quedó desempleado y ella se quebró en la papelería que era el apoyo para cubrir los gastos, así como el derrame cerebral derivado del estrés de dicha situación, son hoy las motivaciones que hacen que esta luchadora incansable desee iniciar nuevamente con la esperanza de sacar su negocio adelante, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo y prepararse por si otra situación similar se presenta en sus vidas. 
 
Hoy Alba desea iniciar con una papelería y venta de helados en su casa y para ello necesita de un préstamo, pues será este el punto de partida para empezar de nuevo.
texts.en:
Alba Patricia experienced a difficult financial situation some years ago when her husband lost his job and she went bankrupt in her stationery store business which was the source of support she had for covering their expenses.  In addition to this, she suffered a brain hemorrhage as a result of the stress of the situation.  This is the motivation which now leads this tireless fighter to want to start again with the hope of getting ahead in her business and improving her own quality of life and that of her husband.  She would like to prepare herself for if another similar situation should happen again in their lives.

Alba would like to start a stationery store and ice cream business in her home and, for this reason, she needs a loan.  This will be her starting point for starting over.

loans.use: to use as capital to open a stationery store and ice cream business

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a 34-year-old married female with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Enid has worked in the clothing business selling dresses, skirts, shirts and shoes for the last seven years. She started with 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings and now has 2,800,000 Shillings. Her vision is to expand her business up to 5,000,000 Shillings, construct property in town, and educate her children. Enid needs the loan facility to restock items of dresses, skirts, trousers and shirts to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy dresses, skirts, trousers, shirts and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has three children.

Mohamad has owned a workshop since 2000. He sells and repairs car electrical parts. He has more than 10 years experience in this field. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Marlene Esperanza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marlene, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 4 hijos ya todos son  mayores de edad, pero uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.

Nuestra amiga tiene una mini farmacia en su casa, nos cuenta que vende toda clase de medicamentos. Además de esto ella también se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, para lo cual tiene un lugar adecuado para la cría de sus animalitos, nos cuenta que los cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses  y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para luego llevarlos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad, lleva cinco meses con su farmacia y le está yendo muy bien y con la cría de animales más de 8 años.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar medicinas para surtir su farmacia y alimento de animales. Lleva más de 15 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gustan los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son que su farmacia crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora community bank meets twice a month in Montecristi, an Ecuadorean town famous for being the birthpplace of El Viejo Luchador (The Old Fighter), Eloy Alfaro, and for the straw hats that are made here and so admired inside the country and out.  

We met Marlene, 47, at the bank.  She and her husband have 4 grown children, only one of whom still lives at home.  Her husband is a construction worker.  

Our friend, Marlene, operates a small pharmacy in her house where she sells all kinds of medications.  She also raises chickens and pigs and has a yard for keeping them.  She tells us that she keeps them for three or four months and then sells them to passing wholesalers who, in turn, sell them at different markets in the city.  She has operated the pharmacy for 5 months and is happy with her progress.  She has been raising animals for 8 years.  

Marlene will use this loan to buy medicines for her pharmacy and feed for her animal-sales business.  She has been a member of the community bank for more than 15 years and likes the advantages that being a member bring.

Her dream is to grow the pharmacy business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her pharmacy business and feed for her animal-sales business.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир женат. Его супругу зовут Яна. У них две маленькие дочки.

Владимир работает в нескольких направлениях - торгует бытовой техникой, а также устанавливает спутниковые антенны. Владимир трудолюбивый и хозяйственный. Он хочет развивать дальше бизнес в сфере бытовой техники. Мечта Владимира – открыть свой магазин бытовой техники. При этом он объективно оценивает свои силы, понимая, что нужно еще много работать.

Владимир просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15,000 гривен для закупки партии товара: спутниковые антенны и бытовая техника. Летом идет большой спрос и он, получив дополнительные средства, сможет получить  хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Vladimir is married. His wife's name is Yana. They have two little daughters. 

Vladimir works several jobs: selling home appliances and setting up satellite dishes. Vladimir is industrious and economic. He wants to further develop his household appliance business. Vladimir's dream is to open a hardware store. In this case, he has objectively assessed his own strength and realized that he still has a lot of work to do. 

Vladimir requested a loan for 15,000 hryvnia to buy a shipment of satellite dishes and home appliances. In the summer there is a big demand for these things, and if he receives additional funds, he will make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy a shipment of satellite dishes and home appliances

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 37 years old and married with 4 children.  With 3 children in school, Theresa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a sari-sari store (variety store) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Theresa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, and other miscellaneous products. 

In the future Theresa would like to build and expand her business in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina is a resident of Tup, a small village in the eastern part of Kyrgyzstan. She is 43 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up three sons and a daughter. The oldest son entered the university and the two other sons study at school.  The daughter is preschool age (under seven). Zina works as a teacher of Russian language at school. In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs, she sells dairy products. The family also cultivates agricultural products. This year they grow wheat and barley.  

Zina applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase 200 liters of fuel, which is needed for collecting the harvest. Part of the loan will be used to pay for tractor services. In the near future, with the profits gained from selling the harvest, Zina wants to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and to pay for tractor services

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves nació en la provincia de Urubamba en la comunidad de Racchi y tiene 44 años de edad,  ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. 

Actualmente, Nieves vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería. Nieves requiere el micro crédito para comprar granos secos como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Qorihuayrachina” se reúne cada treinta en la comunidad de Racchi de la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Nieves was born in Urubamba province, in Racchi community.  She is 44 years old, lives with her partner, and has four children.

Nieves currently lives in the community in which she was born and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Nieves farms and raises livestock.  She needs this micro loan to buy basic grains such as potatoes, barley, wheat, etc.

The 'Qorihuayrachina' community bank meets once a month in Racchi community, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as potato, barley, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Ismenia Marisol

texts.es: Ismenia Marisol de 19 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañero de vida y su pequeño sobrino el cual se encuentra estudiando. Ismenia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas y variadas pupusas, de queso, frijol, chicharron, revueltas (variada de todo lo anterior). Ella tiene muchas ideas de negocio las cuales poco a poco va poniendo en marcha. A pesar de su corta edad Ismenia tiene muchos metas y objetivos en su vida es una mujer luchadora y perseverante ya que todo lo que se propone lo logra. Es muy conocida en la zona y muchas personas la prefieren por ser una mujer carismática y muy comprometida en su trabajo. Ha decidido ampliar su negocio con el fin de atraer a más  clientes que le demanden sus ricas pupusas y le permitan mejorar sus ventas de tal modo que sus ingresos mejoren así como su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar la materia prima necesaria (maíz, arroz, chicharon, frijoles, queso, tomates,etc.) para elaborar las deliciosas pupusas que con mucho amor prepara día con día. Espera poder lograr su objetivo para así dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ismenia Marisol is 19 and lives in her own house with her common-law husband and young nephew who is in school.  Ismenia makes and sells delicious and varied "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) with cheese, beans, pork cracklings, or mixed (combining everything).  She has a lot of business ideas which she wants to put into motion.  Although she is quite young, Ismenia has many goals for her life.  She works hard and perseveres until she reaches her goals.  She is very well known in the area and many people prefer her business because she is charismatic and very committed to her work.

She has decided to expand in order to attract more customers.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL which she will use to buy the ingredients she needs (corn, rice, pork cracklings, beans, cheese, tomatoes, etc.) to make the delicious pupusas she prepares with love every day.  She hopes to meet her goals so she can give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients (corn, rice, pork cracklings, beans, cheese, salt and tomatoes).

loans.name: Junerick

texts.en:
Junerick is single. He is 30 years old and lives in Pulang Yuta, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte. Junerick owns and manages a motorcycle shop to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month he earns 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase motorcycle repair equipment like compressor. Behind, is his shop.

Junerick has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Junerick hope to improve and expand his small shop to help his family to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and for repair equipment

location.town: Pulang yuta, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 35-year-old married woman with three school-going children. Her husband Mkare is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. They have a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Pauline's greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Pauline has operated a coconut wine selling business for the past 11 years; her potential clients are her neighbors, friends and passersby. She faces a major challenge with transporting her products from point of purchase to point of sale. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business.

With the requested 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more wine for resale and buy more storage equipment. She decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu, because it helps people by providing loans.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut wine for resale and buy more storage equipment.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hardworking business man aged 49. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last seven years, he has been practicing dairy farming to support his family. He also runs a cafeteria for more income. Joseph has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loan to boost his business. With KES 25,000, he wants to buy ingredients such as sugar, cooking fat and wheat flour to make doughnuts.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 31-year-old businessman. He is married with two children, ages eight and six years old. He has been a tailor for the past two years with a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Francis will use the loan to buy materials to add to his stock. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to be the main distributor of cloth materials around his area.

loans.use: to buy materials to add to his stock

loans.name: Diloromkhon

texts.ru: Дилоромхон проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Она у себя дома открыла пекарню, где печет и продает лепешки. В этой области она семь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения несколько мешков муки и угля.
texts.en: Diloromkhon lives in the city of Khujand.  She is 57 years old, married and has one child.  She opened a bakery at her home, where she bakes and sells flatbread.  Diloromkhon has been in this business for seven years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of several bags of flour and coal.

loans.use: to purchase several bags of flour and coal

loans.name: Ulamnemeh

texts.en:
Ulamnemeh is 58 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His wife helps with income from her business, their eldest three children are employed, and the youngest one is a college student. 

Ulamnemeh started his food-cart business in 2009. Now that he has run his business for several years, he has many regular customers. During the winter, the meat prices will increase as usual. To avoid the increased prices, he wants to buy meat worth 2,500,000 MNT. 

He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "If I don't buy meat now, I could lose a lot of customers and I couldn't pay my daughter's college fee.”

loans.use: to buy more meat.

loans.name: Delma

texts.es: Dilma con su credikiva le fue muy bien comprò cervezas por cajas y nunca le faltaron inventarios, asi mismo logrò venderle a otras tiendas que se quedaron sin bebidas y tocaron su puerta para abastecerse. En la actualidad està aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprarà nuevamente cervezas por cajas y calzado a solicituid de sus clientes, pues se acerca la temporada de mayor fiestas familiares y estos productos resltan muy rentables, por el gran movimiento de dinero que circula en las èpocas de primas, aguinaldos y bonificaciones laborales. Delma envia el siguienter mensaje a sus financiadores: " Mis agradecimientos a Kiva por su confianza en mi negocio y que me sigan apoyado. "
texts.en: Delma did very well with her Kiva loan.  She bought cases of beer so always had inventory in stock.  She was able to sell to other stores that ran out of beverages and knocked on her door to stock up.  She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan that she will once again use to buy beer by the case and shoes to fill customer orders because the season of the greatest family festivities is approaching and these products become very profitable because of the large amounts of circulating cash during the season of bonuses and allowances at work.  Delma sends the following message to her lenders: “My thanks to Kiva for its trust in my business; please continue to support me.”

loans.use: to buy cases of beer and shoes.

loans.name: Jomaira Karina

texts.es:
Jomaira es una mujer de 26 años, madre soltera de tres hijos viven en "Santo Domingo" que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. La provincia tiene de superficie 3.857 km² a una altitud de 625 msnm. Su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la costa, de la cordillera occidental de los Andes, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Jomaira tiene una tienda de víveres ubicada en la zona urbana del Cantón donde reside. Desea invertir en mercadería ya que sus proveedores le han ofrecido mejores precios por comprar por lotes. Ha optado por realizar un crédito de tal manera que pueda invertir en su tienda y ofrecer mayor surtido y mejores precios. "Fundación Alternativa" que es la institución que intermediará el crédito no le entregará únicamente dinero sino que además ella podrá acceder a capacitación y asesoramiento para que su inversión sea sustentable.

Esta mujer trabajadora no solo mantiene a sus hijos sino que además le da trabajo a otra mujer. Jomaira está muy optimista con su primer crédito y esperamos siga creciendo y cumpliendo sus sueños y anhelos.
texts.en:
Jomaira is a 26-year-old woman, a single mother of three children, living in Santo Domingo which is Ecuador’s fourth largest city.  Its population is rapidly growing because it has much commerce and the country’s largest cattle market.  The province has an area of 3.857 km² and is 625 meters above sea level.  Its usual temperature is about 25.5°C and can reach up to 38 °C sometimes.  All of Santo Domingo de los Tsátchilas Province encompasses part of the mountain area of the coast, the western arm of the Andes, historically known as Yumbos Province and Capital of the Hummingbirds.  It’s located in Latin America’s humid tropics.  It is considered to be a new province since it was just created in 2007.

Jomaira has a grocery store located in the urban zone of the canton where she lives.  She wants to invest in merchandise since her suppliers have offered her better prices if she buys complete lots.  She’s decided to take out a loan to be able to invest in her store and offer a wider selection at better prices.  Fundación Alternativa is the intermediary credit institution that won’t only hand over the loan but will also allow her to have access to training and counseling so that her investment will be sustainable.

This hardworking woman not only supports her children but also provides employment for another woman.  Jomaira is very optimistic with her first loan and we hope she’ll consider growing and reaching her dreams and hopes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Doris Gabriela

texts.es:
Doris Gabriela tiene 20 años vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la compañera y los hijos de 4 y dos años de edad en  ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Doris se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para maleza.  Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá trabajar y comprar los abonos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas como la langosta y la cogollera. El sueño es comprar tierra. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con los hijos.
texts.en:
Doris Gabriela is 20 years old. She is in a relationship and lives with her partner and two children, ages 4 and 2, in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. 

She is a member of "La Unión" [Unity] Communal Bank, located in Aguas Frías which belongs to Ventanas Canton. The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers. Doris is a corn and pigeon pea farmer. She buys and sells in Ventanas. 

She is asking for the loan to purchase manure and other fertilizers, and weedkiller. With the help of this loan she will be able to buy the fertilizers and continue working. The challenges she faces are plagues of locusts and corn-eating caterpillars. Her dream is to buy land. 

In her free time she enjoys going for walks with her children.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, and weed killer

loans.name: Tout Est Grace Group

texts.fr: TOUT EST GRACE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Solange (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 44 ans, a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Solange est mariée à un certain Jean Paul. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Solange et son mari. Pour cette raison, Solange vend des conserves et des produits cosmétiques depuis dix ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Solange s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Solange sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe TOUT EST GRACE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des conserves et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a thirty three year old married man with children living in Masindi-Uganda. He is a secondary school teacher, a very hard working and ambitious man who loves his job. He hopes to start a mini super market business in future to supplement on his daily income. Henry also wants his wife to study and get a job in future hence looking for top up funds to pay school fees for his wife. He faces a hardship of low salary payment yet he dedicates all his time to teach.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his wife

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy land and plant berries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Kuresoi wants to buy different varieties of beads for beadwork.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.en:
Blanca Estela is 35 years old and is originally from the city of Monterrey. She is married and has two small children. She sells cosmetics. She started this two years ago to help her husband support the family. Little by little the business has grown and is now a leader of sales for a product line she represents. Right now, she is working on developing a team of sales people. Her goal is to become the number one seller in her area. She is working very hard to create an excellent sales team to excel with its results.

She currently needs a loan of $925 to increase her inventory and cover distribution costs and continue growing her business. Your help will contribute to the growth of this business and help Blanca make her dream a reality.

La señora Blanca Estela tiene 35 años, es originaria de la ciudad de Monterrey, es casada y tiene de dos pequeños hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos para el hogar por catálogo. Inició hace dos años con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo con el ingreso familiar, pero poco a poco ha ido haciendo crecer sus ventas, hasta convertirse en líder de la Compañía para la que labora, actualmente está creando su propia red de vendedoras. Su meta es pronto convertirse en la número uno de la zona y por eso esta trabajando fuertemente para crear un equipo de ventas excelente y sobresalir por sus resultados.

En este momento necesita un crédito por 925 dólares que empleará en incrementar su inventario de mercancía que le permita cubrir las necesidades de sus distribuidoras, y continuar creciendo. Con tu ayuda puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, y a lograr que Blanca cumpa su sueño, no lo dudes más.

loans.use:
Purchase merchandise

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary J. N. is 33 years old and married with four children. Two of them are in school while the rest have completed high school and are now waiting to join college. Her husband is a hawker in another town while she deals tomatoes in the open-air market.. They do not earn enough to expand the business.

Mary has an opportunity to buy tomatoes from the farmers in rural areas. They sell cheaper from these areas and the margin is good. She has not enough money to take advantage of this opportunity. She is therefore requesting a loan of US $300. US$250 will be used to buy the stock and US$ 50 to cater for transport and other expenses. They are doing this as a group due to high transport costs. They have a viable plan that can change their lives.

loans.use: Expand her tomato business

loans.name: Angelino

texts.en:
Angelino and his family are small dairy and subsistence farmers; he also works as a bricklayer to generate enough income to support his wife and four children. They live in the village of Tahari - Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use this loan to purchase an additional dairy cow to increase milk production and in that way increase his family's income. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Angelino y su familia, son productores de leche y se dedican a la agricultura solo para su alimentación y él también trabaja como albañil. Asi completan sus ingresos principales con los que mantiene a la familia (4 hijos y esposa). Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him S., age 44, works with her husband on their farm, earning about $3 per day from selling their produce in the market. They have six children. Two children are students, one works at a garment factory earning about $3 per day, and three are married and live with their families. In order to more efficiently transport their produce to the market, she would like to request a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike. This will ensure they arrive earlier at the market with fresher produce to meet customer demand and increase sales.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport produce to the market

loans.name: Seleue

texts.en: Seleue and her husband are hard-working people who do not want to rely on family members overseas to help them financially. Her husband fishes and tends to their plantation while Seleue runs a small business making elei (or traditional Samoan) prints. They sell their crops, catches and artwork at the market, where they can make 500 Tala (or $200) a week. They are happy because their lives are improving thanks to their hard work and assistance from SBPD. They hope that their lives will continue to improve, and have applied for a loan of $375 to buy materials and supplies they need for their two business to make that possible.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies to make prints and for her plantation

loans.name: Felicita Maria

texts.es:
Felicita Maria is 49 years old. She lives in the Sector Alto Moche del District Moche, Province of Trujillo, Department of La Libertad. She has 3 children who still depend on her for support. Felicita Maria has a beauty salon where she offers services of haircuts, makeup application, hair coloring, skin and hand care. Before starting her business Felicita worked in an office but there was reduction of staff and she was one of the people dismissed. When she was let go, she didn't know what to do, but then decided to take up a course in cosmetology. She was also sewing and designing clothes during the evenings for some customers. Later, with a friend's suggestion, she decided to join the group "Los Jazmines" and her first loan was for S /. 300.00 soles. This money helped her purchase products for her salon, like: a dozen dyes, perm solution, creams, treatments for the scalp and hair, etc. She plans on repaying this loan in 4 months. Her greatest dream is to expand her business and build a Center for Occupational Education where she will be able to pass on her knowledge.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Felicita María tiene 49 años, vive en el Sector Alto Moche del Distrito de Moche, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. Tiene 3 hijos que aun dependen de ella. La señora Felicita tiene su peluquería en donde ofrece servicio de corte de pelo, maquillaje, tintes, limpieza de cutis y cuidado de manos. Antes de poner este negocio la señora Felicita trabajaba en una oficina pero hubo reducción de personal y fue una de las despedidas, en ese momento no sabia que hacer y tuvo la idea de estudiar un curso de cosmetología asimismo por las noches confeccionaba ropa que le pedían algunos clientes. Se integra al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Los Jazmines” por medio de una amiga, su primer crédito fue de S/. 300.00 soles este dinero le sirvió para comprar material para su peluquería e implementarla. Con este préstamo de S/.300.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará una docena de tintes, liquido para ondulación, cremas, ampollas para el cabello, etc. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio y construir un Centro de Educación Ocupacional en el que pueda transmitir sus conocimientos.

loans.use: To purchase products for her beauty salon, such as:  dyes, creams, products for the hair and scalp, perm solution, etc.  (Compra de insumos.)

loans.name: Daysi Yesenia

texts.es:
Daysi Yessenia is a member of the communal bank "The Jasmines" and has operated her candy business for five years located in the central market in Moyobamba, San Martín. She sells traditional sweet breads and sweets, and carries a strong clientele, being well known for making her own delicious products.

Daysi is 26 years old and works day after day with hopes to give her two young children a better future. She likes her work but longs to to have a larger bakery one day.

With her six month US $1,025 loan she will stock up on flour, sugar, eggs, oil, butter, salt, and all the other necessary ingredients for her daily preparation of bread and sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Daysi Yessenia es socia del banco comunal “Los Jazmines”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyobamba. El negocio está ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de dulces de la región como panes, biscochos, además es muy conocida por elaborar productos sabrosos y de muy buena calidad por lo que tiene una buena clientela. Con el préstamo de S/.3,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses comprará harina y azúcar en sacos, huevos en jabas, aceite en litros, mantequilla en paquetes, sal en bolsas y otros ingredientes más para la preparación diaria de variados panes y dulces. La señora Daysi tiene 26 años, dos pequeños hijos por quienes día a día trabaja con entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante y darles un futuro mejor. Ella gusta del trabajo que hace pero anhela tener una panadería bien implementada.

loans.use: To buy inputs for bread and sweets production

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 43 years old he has 4 children, all studying in schools. One of them was injured in a car explosion seven months ago and it was a very bad injury. The entrepreneur has a small general store in his house and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new ice box and more goods, expand and paint his shop, and make new shelves. He wants to improve his business and increase his family's income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new ice box and more goods

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah S. runs a popular general store in Elmina.  She is married to an electrician and has 5 children.  She has been running a successful business for the past 4 years.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more provisions for her shop. Sarah is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her shop.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is married with four children. She began selling onions and other vegetables in 1988. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Agness now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables and onions for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food inventory.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr:
Mrs. N. lives in the poor neighborhood of Médina Fall, in Thiès.
