Taking into account the distance that separates the traditional village from the city markets, she offers her customers a convenient service with her small business of selling foodstuffs and staple goods. The loan she is requesting will allow her to diversify the products she sells and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame N. est une dame qui habite le quartier pauvre de Médina FALL de Thiès. Compte tenu de la distance qui sépare le village traditionnelle et les marchés de la ville, Elle propose aux populations des services de proximité en mettant à leurs côtés un petit commerce de produits alimentaires et de première nécessité. Le pret sollicité lui permettra de diversifier sa gamme de produits pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Increase and diversify her supply of foodstuffs

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.en:
Julia, Haydee, and Lidia are all members of the Village Bank Muruina. Julia is 42 years old, married and has 2 children. Haydee is 27 years old, lives with her boyfriend, and has 1 child, and Lidia is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. The three women have different businesses for which they use their loans from FINCA. Julia sells typical Ayacuchan dishes in the market and has been doing this for about 1 year. Haydee sells cattle at the different fairs in the region, which she has been doing for about 1 year as well. Lidia sells typical Peruvian dishes that she cooks herself on Sundays at the market – she as also been doing this for 1 year. 
The women are asking for loans of 300 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles, respectively, to buy things to help grow their businesses. Julia will invest the money from the new loan in things for her kitchen such as utensils and plates and pots; Haydee will use the money to buy cattle; and Lidia will use the money from her new loan to buy more food with which she can prepare the traditional Ayacuchan dishes she sells on Sundays – she will buy things such as rice and chicken. 
The biggest dreams of these three women are that their children receive good educations and that they succeed in their studies.

loans.use: The women are asking for loans of 300 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles, respectively, to buy things to help grow their businesses. Julia will invest the money from the new loan in things for her kitchen such as utensils and plates and pots; Haydee will use the money to buy cattle; and Lidia will use the money from her new loan to buy more food with which she can prepare the traditional Ayacuchan dishes she sells on Sundays – she will buy things such as rice and chicken.

loans.name: Hosiana

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Hosiana B..

In 2008, Hosiana established her poultry business. She is assisted by her husband. Hosiana requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of chicks and feed. In the future, Hosiana plans to to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

loans.name: Anastacio De Jesus

texts.es:
Anastacio makes a living working arduously in the Israel Lewites market in Managua selling milk products and derivatives. He is known for being a hard-working person who has been able to provide for his family and put food on the table. His efforts are supported by loans from Kiva partner Ceprodel, which he has invested directly into the milk products he offers. Currently his biggest need is to acquire capital for his business, which is why he is turning again to Ceprodel for support in purchasing the products he most needs.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein

En el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua el señor Anastacio M. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de venta de productos lacteos o derivados de la leche. Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabnajadora que ha logrado mantener su familia y llevado el sustento a su mesa.

Para ello el se ha respaldado de los creditos otorgados por Ceprodel el cual los ha invertido directamente en la compra de sus productos lacteos para ofrecerlos. Hoy en dia su mayor necesidad es adquirir lo mas pronto posible el recurso economico para continuar con su negocio y esta es la razon por la que ha buscado una vez mas el aopyo en Ceprodel para adquirir sus productos que le son de suma necesidad.

loans.use: Purchase milk products to sell / Compra de los productos lacteos

loans.name: Hafizillo

texts.ru: Исматов Хафизилло житель города Яван. Живет в одном из отдаленных кишлаков. Основная сфера деятельности их местности это животноводство. Уже 11 лет разводит крупно рогатый скот. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить породистого бычка. Постепенно он сможет давать качественное потомство. Это даст толчок к развитию данного сектора. Кроме того , сможет обеспечить рынок качественным мясом и молочными продуктами. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hafizillo I. resides in the town of Yavan, one of the most remote villages. He is married and has four children. Livestock is the main business in that locale, and Hafizillo has raised large-horned cattle for the past 11 years. He wishes to take out a loan to purchase a purebred bull that will gradually beget high-quality calves, providing a stimulus to development of the livestock sector. Additionally, Hafizillo will be able to supply the market with high-quality meat and milk products. He intends to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Ketut Ranten

texts.id: Keseharian yang hanya tinggal di pedesaan yang berada di kaki bukit membuat Gusti Ayu Ketut Ranten mengandalkan hasil dari mengolah ladang bersama suaminya. Itupun hasilnya tidak seberapa besar dibandingkan dengan kebutuhan yang harus ditanggung setiap hari di keluarganya. Termasuk juga menanggung kedua anaknya yang masih sekolah di SMA dan SD. Dengan modal awal Rp.1000.000,- Gusti Ayu membuka warung di rumahnya yang menjual beberapa kebutuhan pokok serta makanan dan minuman. Gusti Ayu berharap bisa mendapatkan penghasilan tambahan dari usaha yang sudah ditekuninya hampir 2 tahun itu. Tetapi karena keterbatasan modal membuat usaha warungnya tidak berkembang dengan baik. Setelah mendapatkan penjelasan dari Staf DINARI tentang program yang mengembangkan usaha untuk masyarakat kecil, akhirnya Gusti Ayu memutuskan untuk meminjam modal ke DINARI melalui program Tempek. Pinjaman ini merupakan yang pertama bagi Gusti Ayu dan jangka waktunya adalah selama 12 bulan. Pembayaran dilakukan dengan cara mencicil setiap bulannya. Dengan modal yang dipunyai sekarang Gusti Ayu mampu menambah omset barang dagangannya menjadi lebih lengkap. Para pelanggannya yang berasal dari sekitar rumah Gusti Ayu pun semakin ramai karena barang-barang kebutuhan yang dijual sudah tersedia lengkap dan tidak perlu harus mencari jauh ke tempat lainnya. Hasil yang didapat dari usaha warungnya ini lumayan besar, setelah dipotong pembayaran ke DINARI setiap bulannya Gusti Ayu bisa meraup keuntungan mencapai Rp.200.000,-. Tentunya hasil ini sangat membantu perekonomian keluarga Gusti Ayu serta mampu memenuhi biaya sekolah kedua anaknya.
texts.en:
As villagers who live in a village on a downhill, Gusti Ayu Ketut Ranten and her husband count on their garden products to fulfill their daily need but the income earned from gardening has never been enough, including to fund their 2 children in studying in elementary and high school level. With Rp 1,000,000 as initial capital, Gusti Ayu started to open a small grocery store in their house. Gusti Ayu hopes that she will be able to earn additional income from her business that has been running for about 2 years. Gusti Ayu realizes that the limited capital prohibit her from expanding the business. After attending a short presentation on small enterprise development from DINARI, Gusti Ayu decided to propose loan from them through Tempek Program. The loan will be the first for her, that will be paid 12 months with monthly installment. With this additional capital, Gusti Ayu will be able to add the number and the varieties of goods she sell that she is sure her customer will be increase because they do not have to look for goods that they need to other store. The income from her grocery store is quite good. After deduction of monthly installment, Gusti Ayu will earn Rp 200,000 that will be used to help fulfilling their family daily needs and supporting their children to study.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number and varieties of goods sold

loans.name: Mayra  Eunice

texts.es:
MAYRA ES UNA GRAN MUJER RESPONSABLE, CON UN GRAN CORAZON Y UNAS INMENSAS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE 
ELLA LABORA PARA UNA COMPAÑÍA IMPORTANTE COMO SECRETARIA, SOLICITA ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE UNIFORMES DE SU HIJO YA QUE SE LOS ESTAN PIDIENDO EN LA ESCUELA; MAYRA ESTA BUSCANDO UN MEJOR FUTURO PARA SU HIJO Y ES POR ELLO QUE DIA TRAS DIA LO ESTA LOGRANDO.
texts.en:
Mayra is a very responsible woman with a big heart and immense desire to succeed. She works as a secretary for an important company. She requests this loan to buy school uniforms for her son. Mayra wants a better future for her son, and for this reason she works hard day after day.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Ifeanyi

texts.en: Ifeanyi A. is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs like tomatoes, eggs, beans, rice, garri, pepper, yams, salt, and plantain. She hopes to expand her foodstuffs business. She is requesting this loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor tiene 42 años, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar y vive junto a su esposo quien la ayuda mucho. Ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y otros accesorios desde hace un año atrás en forma ambulatoria, su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente la apoya mucho en su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es levantarse muy temprano a preparar toda su mercadería para luego llevarla a vender por  los diferentes lugares de su zona, además, le es rentable porque ya cuenta con una clientela selecta que  le compran sus prendas constantemente. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete nuevamente a ser responsable con sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más prendas, posteriormente le gustaría acondicionar en su propia casa su tienda de ropa y pasamanería, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona adecuada para el comercio.
texts.en:
Leonor is a 42-year-old mother of three school aged children and lives with her husband who helps her out quite a bit. For the past year her business has been selling clothing, shoes, and accessories door-to-door. Her husband, who works independently, helps her in her business. She enjoys getting up early to prepare her merchandise to take to various points in her area, which is profitable because she now has a dedicated client base who consistently purchase her wares. This is her third loan with MFP and she has committed to make the payments. With the requested funds she will buy more items and later she would like to build her clothing and lace-work shop in her own home, since she is well-situated for a business locale.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of items for sale

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey K. is a villager in Pen Sam Ath village in Kampong Speu province. She and her husband, Mr. Horn Heng, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even though they try to work hard, they still can not provide a better life for their family. 

Thus, Mrs. Srey K. decided to request a loan to add to her savings to buy equipment to build a house for her family. She is 43 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy equipment to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
La señora Armandina y su esposo trabajan en una maquiladora, ella es operadora y él mecánico; tienen 2 hijos de nivel escolar.
El problema que se presenta en su vivienda es que la instalación hidraulica del cuarto de baño, está muy deteriorada y como consecuencia existe una fuga y la humedad es común en la mayor parte del día, resultando desagradable y poco higienico.
Ellos solicitan su colaboración para sustituir toda la tubería y no tener más este problema, su deseo tambien es remodelar el baño, sin embargo solo empezaran y mas adelante pretenden continuar con su proyecto.
texts.en:
Armandina and her husband work in a border assembly plant, Armandina as an operator and her husband as a mechanic. They have 2 children who study, one in elementary school and the other in high school. They have a problem in their home, the pipes in the bathroom are presently extremely deteriorated and rotting which is causing the bathroom to always be damp, this without tanking into account that the shower pipe has also already rotted. They are requesting this loan because they have to change all the pipes to no longer have this problem, and they also want to fix the bathroom properly so that it can look presentable when they offer it to their guests.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix bathroom pipes.

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.es: Leopoldina es madre soltera, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa, en donde vende productos basicos para el consumo familiar, pero su ingreso principal lo obtiene de sus ventas de ropa ambulante, con esto cubre gastos del hogar y les paga los gastos escolares asus 2 hijos que son de 13 y 16 años, pues no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, estos cuando salen del colegio le apoyan en su pequeño negocio, la hija atiende la pulperia y el hijo la acompaña en la venta de ropa. El mayor sueño de doña Leopoldina es poder fortalecer mas su negocio para obtener ganancias que le permitan brindarle mejores comodidades y estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leopoldina is a single mother, and she has a small convenience store in her home where she sells basic products for daily use, but her primary source of income is from her sales of used clothing as a street vendor. With this income she covers her household expenses and pays for the education expenses for her 2 children ages 13 and 16, as she doesn’t have any support from the father of her children. When the children leave school at the end of the day they support her in the small business – the daughter takes care of the store and the son accompanies her to sell clothing. Leopoldina’s biggest dream is to be able to strengthen her business in order to obtain earnings that will permit her to provide greater comforts and education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: A. est une femme mariée qui  a  02 enfants. Elle habite avec sa famille le quartier  d’agoè démakpoè . Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2007.pour pouvoir gagner plus de bénefice sur son commerce, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Sokodé où le sac de charbons de bois est moins coûteux.Voulant actuellement rehausser son stock de charbons de bois elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 32 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
A. is a woman who is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Aagoè Démakpoè district and generates revenues through commerce in charcoal. She started this business in 2007. To be able to earn more from her business, she gets her supplies from the country's interior in the city of Sokodé, where sacks of charcoal are less expensive. Now wanting to replenish her stock, she's requesting her first WAGES loan to buy 32 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a 26 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Amin has owned a car spare parts shop since 2008. Amin requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase car spare parts for his garage. This is the first time that Amin has requested a loan.

Amin is special because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region. Amin decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts for his garage.

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es: Ángela del Socorro M. tiene la edad de 51 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Ángela tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Ángela inicio este negocio en su vivienda con muy pocos productos, a ella siempre le ha gustado este tipo de negocio, ya que se relaciona con sus vecinos. Sus propósitos son que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos con su servicio. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar golosinas, refrescos naturales y un poco de granos básicos. El sueño de Ángela es obtener un restaurante que sea propio.
texts.en:
Ángela del Socorro M. is a single, 51-year-old woman. She is the mother of two children who are both in school. For six years she has been making a living from a small store she has in her house. Ms. Ángela started this business with very little stock and says she has always liked this type of job because she can socialize with her neighbors. Her goals are to keep her clients satisfied. The loan is for working capital to buy sweets, natural drinks, and some basic grains. Angela dreams of having her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Wédayamana 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wédayamana 5  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 45 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles  font uniquement la culture de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Wédayamana  5 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au grand marché de Koutiala ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Wédayamana 5 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Wédayamana 5 is a group of married women in the Sirakélé neighborhood, in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large extended traditional families, average 45 years of age, and have at least 6 children. Their only business consists in growing peanuts. Eager to make their farming activities profitable, they decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago. After having repaid the previous four loans without problems, they are now seeking their fifth farming loan.

The loan will be used to buy, at the grand market in Koutiala, peanut seeds, small material, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, crops are stocked for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Koutiala and in the surrounding villages, retail (often wholesale), to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their production, the members of the Wédayamana 5 group count on turning a profit of XOF 45000 (ca US$ 100), to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seed, small material, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn S. owns and operates a sari-sari or general store selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. She is 40 years old, married and has three school-age children. She is from the village of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Roselyn has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2001, Roselyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP. This will be the first loan taken out by Roselyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a sari-sari store

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario Sagrada Familia compuesto por dos personas, tienen 20 créditos y es uno de los más antiguos de la institución, son excelentes clientes.

Amparo Nicoloza S. Guzmán tiene una pulpería desde hace mas de 20 años con la cual ha apoyado el sustento familiar, vive con su familia, goza de buena reputación entre su vecindario y tiene los servicios básicos  como todo ciudadano. Su cónyuge es obrero y  da su aporte para el  bienestar familiar.

La otra señora Aurora Ercilia S. Guzmán, su actividad es la de comercializar carne de cerdo, elaborar comida y  dulces. Vive con su familia, cónyuge y tres hijos donde tienen  uno de los servicios básicos primarios como es la energía, el agua la obtienen a través de otra fuente que no es la red pública.
Su cónyuge labora como obrero en el campo y con su salario ayuda al sustento también de la familia.

Ambas son hermanas y tienen buena coordinación en el pago de sus deudas.
texts.en:
The Sagrada Familia Solidarity Group is composed of two members who have participated in 20 loans. They are long-standing members of the institution and have been excellent clients.

Amparo Nicoloza S. Guzmán has operated a grocery store for more than 20 years with the support of her family, with whom she lives. She has earned a good reputation within the community. Her family receives basic services as like any other citizen. Her husband also works to contribute toward the family’s welfare.

The other member is Aurora Ercilia S. Guzmán. She sells pork, prepared meals and candy. She lives with her husband and 3 children. In her neighborhood, her family receives basic services such as electricity. However, they obtain their water from another source that is not part of the public network. Her husband is a farm laborer and his salary helps with the family expenses.

Both members are sisters, and they work well together to pay off their debts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas lives in Lagos and sells clothes. Dorcas is a single lady of 26. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years and the loan has boosted her business. Dorcas hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more ready-made clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando tiene 47 años, es un padre de familia dedicado, vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Hace 5 años decidió crear su propia fuente de ingresos, para ello, abrió una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, la cual con el tiempo ha crecido y hoy es un minimarket que abastece a sus clientes con todo tipo de comestibles de primera de necesidad y otros diversos artículos. Debido a la gran variedad de los productos que ofrece se ha ganado la preferencia de sus clientes, quienes reciben una buena atención, que es el valor agregado que les brida Armando y su esposa. Para el futuro, esta pareja de esposos quieren seguir creciendo en su negocio y tener un local más amplio y con mayor variedad de productos. Esta es la primera vez que Armando tiene un crédito con MFP, es un nuevo integrante de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será utilizado en la compra de mercadería en menestras y detergentes.
texts.en:
Armando is a 47-year-old father and husband devoted to his two children and wife. Five years ago he decided to go into business for himself and opened a small grocery store in his home. His business has grown and over time become a mini-market that provides his customers with a tremendous variety of high quality goods. Armando and his wife are very attentive and offer such a wide range of goods; they have won over their customers. They would like to continue to grow their business, having a bigger space and an even wider array of products. This is the fist time Armando is applying for a loan with MFP as he is a new member of his communal bank. He promises to pay his loan back responsibly. He plans to buy vegetables and detergents with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase merchandise

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Five years ago, 49-year-old Helen E. started making sweet peanut delicacy called “bandi”. Her mother in-law taught her how to prepare this delicacy. This business pursuit is an addition to her pig-raising business, which she began with her first loan from ASHI in 2004. The pig-raising business realizes income every four months, while her banid business generates daily income.

After years of promoting her product to her acquaintances, Helen’s “bandi“ is now in demand by people visiting the province who wish to purchase a “pasalubong” (present) to bring home to friends and colleagues. Helen is requesting a loan for supplies to make more bandi so she can supply more clients.  She dreams of using her income to rent her own stall in the market and to send her four children to the highest level of education- college.

loans.use: To produce a "bandi" (sweet peanut  delicacy) production/ sales business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 22 años, vive en la casa propia de sus padres. Desde hace un año y medio se dedica a la venta de ropa, sus principales clientes son sus amistades y vecinos, pero también continuamente está en búsqueda de nueva clientela. Ángela adquiere su mercadería en su mismo centro de trabajo, que es una tienda de ropa y en otras ocasiones, viaja a otra ciudad donde compra novedosos diseños. Este negocio le permite generar los ingresos que necesita para pagar sus gastos estudiantiles, razón por la cual planifica su futuro adquiriendo cada vez mejores prendas para sus clientes. 
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es muy puntual  con sus cuotas, es parte de un banco comunal y es un buen ejemplo para los demás. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ángela is 22 years old, lives at home with her parents, and has been selling clothes for the past 1½ years. She sells mainly to friends and neighbors, but she is always looking for new customers. Ángela acquires her merchandise at the clothing store where she works. In addition, she buys new designs whenever she travels to other cities. Her business allows her to pay for her educational expenses and make plans for her future of buying high quality clothing for her customers.

This is Ángela’s second loan with MFP. She is very punctual with her payments and sets a good example for the other members of her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of clothes so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Bancomunal  Mar del Plata, a sus 50 años, es conviviente.
Angélica vende golosinas, también ha empezado a vender ropa interior, medias, fustanes, truzas,  le está yendo bien  porque su competencia se ha ido, ella está sola y cada día vende mas, por eso necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de ropa interior y de golosinas. Angélica esta enferma por  tantas preocupaciones tiene una hija que se ha ido de su casa y esto le causa mucha tristeza, tanto que está enferma con una gastritis fuerte, pero ella sigue adelante, recibe mucho apoyo de su bancomunal para poder surgir.

loans.use: ropa interior y golosinas

loans.name: Ener Eliu

texts.es: El Joven  Ener Eliu Sánchez, tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en Veracruz, junto a sus padres, el es soltero, desde hace cinco años trabaja como guarda de seguridad, en una casa privada del mismo sector donde habita, los planes hacia su familia es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, agradece a Afodenic , por el apoyo que le ha brindado ya que con este segundo préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y poder hacer parte de la vivienda , a la vez esta contento ya que son muchas las familias que logran mejorar las condiciones de vida con estos programas internacionales  así como kiva. En un futuro espera tener su propia familia y seguir mejorando su casa ya que va parte por parte para poder cubrir la cuota y otras necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Ener Eliu Sánchez is a young man who is 24 years old and single. He lives with his parents and works as a security guard at a private home located in the same district. Thanks to the loans AFODENIC has provided, he can finish the construction of his house. This will be the second loan he receives and will use it to purchase building materials.

Ener is very happy that there are families who are able to improve their living conditions through international programs like Kiva. In the future, he expects to have his own family and continue improving his home since they go hand in hand. His is able to cover his loan payments and his other personal necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials such as stone, cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Mario Ezequiel

texts.es: Mario Ezequiel tiene 53 años, por lo que el dedica a la venta de granos básicos, hace mas de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera muy independiente. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda por lo que anteriormente no tenía un medio de ingresos para sobrevivir, pero decidió establecer su propio negocio y es con mucho esfuerzo lo ha logrado. Los propósitos de Mario para su negocio son de brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes y además ofrecer lo que más demandan sus clientes. El financiamiento que está solicitando  es destinado solamente par capital de trabajo y comprar productos. Por lo que siempre sueña tener su propia camioneta para movilizarse.
texts.en:
Mario Ezequiel is 53 years old and has three children who work independently. For more than 9 years he has been operating a home business selling basic grains. Previously Mario had no means of income to survive, so he decided to start this business and has been able to succeed through hard work.

Mario’s reasons for being in business are to provide the best service to his customers and offer the products they request the most. This loan will be used as operating capital to buy more grain. He has always dreamed of having his own vehicle so that he can travel.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more grain

loans.name: Renovacion Group

texts.es:
ALEJANDRINA H. B., TIENE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA, TIENE UNA HIJA DE 10 AÑOS, QUIEN ES LA RAZON DE SU ESFUERZO Y SACRIFICIO. ALEJANDRINA INTEGRA EL GRUPO “RENOVACIÓN”, FORMADO POR OTRAS 11 SOCIAS DEDICADAS A TRABAJAR PARA APOYAR A SUS FAMILIA.
ALEJANDRINA SE DEDICA HACE 7 AÑOS  A LA VENTA DE GOLOSINAS, PARA LO CUAL SE AYUDA DE UN COCHESITO Y SE UBICA EN LA PUERTA DE UN LOCUTORIO, EN LA AV.PANAMERICANA NORTE.
ANTES DE QUEDAR EMBARAZADA, TRABAJABA EN UNA CASA COMO EMPLEADA, PERO AL ENTERARSE LOS DUEÑOS DE SU ESTADO NO PÙDIERON MANTENERLA EN EL TRABAJO. FUE ASÍ QUE CON MUY POCO DINERO INVIRTIÓ EN LA COMPRA DE GOLOSINAS Y LOS IVA OFRECIENDO MIENTRAS CAMINABA POR DIFERENTES CALLES.
ACTUALMENTE APOYA EN UN RESTAURANTE QUE ESTA UBICADO EN EL MERCADO, LO CUAL LE GENERA OTRO INGRESO.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO DAR EDUCACIÓN A SU HIJA QUIEN ESTUDIA EN UN COLEGIO PARTICULAR, LE GUSTARÍA MAS ADELANTE ALQUILAR UN PUESTO PARA INICIAR UN RESTAURANTE QUE ES EL TRABAJO QUE LE AGRADA MAS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO,LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE GOLOSINAS.
texts.en:
Alejandrina H. B. is 36 years old, is single and has a 10 year old daughter who is the reason for her effort and sacrifice. Alejandrina is part of the “RENOVACIÓN” group, formed by 11 other members dedicated to working in order to support their families. For 7 years Alejandrina has made her living selling sweets, for which she uses a little car located outside a call center on North Panamerican Ave. Before she became pregnant, she worked as a maid in a house. However, when the owners found out about her condition, they couldn't keep her in the job. And so with very little money, she invested in the purchase of sweets and sold them while walking up and down various streets. Currently she helps in a restaurant that is located in the market, which generates another income for her. With her work she has been able to give her daughter an education; she studies in a private school. She would like, in the future, to rent a stand to start a restaurant, which is the work that she likes best. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of sweets

loans.name: Kampala One Group

texts.en:
Paulo K. is 45, married, and has six children between the ages of 3 and 19. He has a business making maize flour that he has run successfully for the past 3 years, and which earns him a monthly profit of around $115.

This will be Paulo’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his stock of maize, and has paid them back successfully. Paulo hopes for a loan to buy additional maize for his milling business.  
	
Paulo will share this loan with his loan group, Kampala One, which has 19 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for the loan. In the picture Paulo, in the blue shirt, is center front.

loans.use: To increase his stock of maize for flour production

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 23 years old and has been selling secondhand clothing for three years. With the KES 20,000 loan, he will increase his stock of secondhand clothes.

Thanks to Faulu, Fred has learned about saving. He hopes to improve his standard of living through expanding his business. He describes himself as an optimistic and visionary person.

loans.use: To increase his stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en:
Endurance is 29 years old and is married with one child. Her husband is a musician and he also supports the home.

Endurance owns a beauty salon where she makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She also sells drinks, rechargeable phone cards and salon materials like hair extensions, shampoo, hair cream and cosmetics. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members.

Endurance is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more salon materials and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more salon materials, drinks and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 31 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Miguel, de 33 años, y su hija Tiffany de 6 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La actividad a la que se dedica es muy poco común, ella comparte su actividad de artesana de tejidos con la de esotérica, todos los días arma su carpa en una de las calles más concurridas de la ciudad para leerles las cartas a las personas que lo deseen.
Por otro lado, ella desea incrementar su producción de tejidos por lo que desea comprar en el futuro una máquina con la que pueda tejer con mayor calidad y en mayor cantidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de María con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida y admirada. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
María, 31, is a loving and hard-working mother, who lives in her own house with her husband, Miguel, 33, and her daughter Tiffany, 6; they are the motivating force behind all her efforts. She has a somewhat unusual occupation: she combines her weaving with esotericism. Every day she sets up her tent in one of the city's busiest streets to interpret cards for those who wish. On the other hand,for the future, she would like to increase her production of woven articles and wants to buy a weaving machine to produce larger amounts of better quality items. This is María's first loan with MFP. She is aware that she must repay on time and is willing to do so because she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she is a well-liked and admired member. She will use the 1000 new soles to buy wool for her new crafts works.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S., 33, is making sure that her family has enough to meet their daily needs. Married to Levi S., a driver, they are blessed with four children. She works so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for 12 years. 

Emma has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than 2 years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow eight times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her clothing business.     

Now with your help, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to expand her business by buying additional products that she can sell.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family and provide a good education for her children. She also dreams of having her own stall or outlet where she can sell her products.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying additional clothing that she can sell

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
Julia C. Martínez  vive en el Barrio Crespo de Cartagena de Indias, donde tiene un negocio con el nombre de   “Peluquería Julia”; su ubicación al norte de la ciudad, en un barrio turístico, muy cercano al mar, hace de su negocio un espacio especial lo que favorece un mayor número de clientes. Inició hace 15 años cuando aprendió su oficio en una academia de belleza Francesa y se instaló en un local muy pequeño, al que gradualmente mejoró su infraestructura  y finalmente empleó a dos peluqueras, con las que ofrece tratamientos para embellecer el cabello de mujeres y de hombres cortes, tinturas aliser y cepillados.
Este es Segundo crédito  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando por un monto de $2.300.000, el cual será invertido en adecuaciones de su nuevo local y en la compra de insumos para peluquería como shampoo, tinturas y masajes para el cabello. Para ella el financiamiento recibido ha sido efectivo, pues ha logrado cambiar los muebles de su peluquería y ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes, así como también ha  aumentado sus ingresos familiares, pues ellos han dependido de la peluquería y del trabajo de su esposo que igualmente es una microempresas de comidas, producto del ahorro logrado con la peluquería y  es otro ingreso familiar.  
 Ella sueña con poder dar empleo a más personas que lo necesiten mediante una sucursal de su peluquería.  Su principal  desafío ocurre  en la primera época del año, cuando disminuyen los clientes, pero ella sale adelante con promociones y descuentos  especiales a clientes especiales
texts.en:
Julia C. Martínez lives in the the Crespo neighborhood in Cartagena de Indias where she has a business called "Julia Hair Salon; it's location in the north of the city, in a tourist area, very close to the ocean, makes her business a special place, frequented by a large number of customers. Julia started 15 years ago, when she learned her trade in a French beauty school and opened in a very small location, gradually improving her infrastructure and finally employing two hairdressers. They offer beauty treatments for men's and women's hair, including cuts, coloring, straightening and styling. This is the second loan Julia has requested through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she is applying for $2.300.000, which she will invest in improvements to her new location and the purchase of supplies for her salon like shampoo, dyes and hair treatments. The financing she has received previously has been effective because she has been able to change the furniture in her salon and make her clients more comfortable, as well as increasing her family's income. Her family depends on her salon and her husband's work which is a food micro-enterprise that was created with the savings from the hair salon and also adds to their family's income. Julia dreams of giving jobs to more people who need them by opening another branch of her salon. Her greatest challenge happens in the beginning of the year, when she has fewer customers, but she overcomes it through promotions and special discounts for her regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her hair salon and to purchase of supplies like shampoo, dyes and hair treatments

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es: Maritza Elizabeth M. M. de 31 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután. Lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como contador de una finca, y junto a sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar en la escuela del lugar. Maritza es una mujer muy trabajadora, quien al observar que muchas cosas hacían falta en su hogar pero sobre todo para sus  hijos, decidió elaborar tamales para comercializar, estos son una comida muy típica del país, los cuales son elaborados de maíz y se rellenan de pollo y algunas verduras, este tipo de comida se vende sobre todo para las cenas del fin de semana y es un negocio muy rentable. Maritza solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, verduras y pollo, de manera que pueda elaborar más cantidad de productos, lo cual le permita obtener mayores ganancias, lo que la incentiva en gran manera a Maritza para seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza Elizabeth M. M. is 31 years old. She lives in Jiquilisco, department of Usulután. She lives there with her husband, who works as an accountant on a farm, and their three children, ages 15, 13 and 8. The children attend the local school. Maritza is a very hardworking woman. She began to make tamales to sell when she saw the many things lacking in her home, but especially for her children's education. Tamales are made from corn and filled with chicken and vegetables. This food is sold for weekend dinners and it is a very profitable business. Maritza is asking for a loan with which she can buy a greater quantity of corn, vegetables and chicken so she can make a greater quantity of product. This will allow her to earn more, which greatly incentivizes Maritza to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia M. is 59 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  Sesilia has 1 year of experience in this business.  Sesilia needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 800 talas or US $333 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Sesilia joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sesilia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aytolkun Malikova`s Group

texts.ru:
Маликовой Айтолкун 33 года. Она замужем, и мать 2 детей. Ее супруг работает таксистом в Ноокате, сама же занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов на центральном рынке города Ноокат. Бизнес был начат 5 лет назад с торговли картофеля. Данный кредит будет использован для увеличения товарного запаса овощей и фруктов. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 150 долларов. 

Назгул, 23, замужем. Ее супруг работает в электрической компании. Она проживает вместе с семьей супруга. Назгул работает в паспортном столе. Кредит будет использован для закупа МРС для дальнейшего откорма.

Мурату 26 лет. Он женат, его супруга работает учительницей в сельской школе. Семья клиента занимается животноводством и кредит будет использован для закупа КРС. В будущем клиент планирует существенно увеличить поголовье домашнего скота.

Рысгул 68 лет. Она вдова и мать 7 детей. В основном ее дети работают в РФ, ежемесячно отправляют деньги своей матери. Кроме этого она вместе с младшим сыном занимется сельским хозяйством, а именно выращиванием картофеля. кредит нужен для закупа минеральных удобрений.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aytolkun M. is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband is a taxi driver in Nookat, and she sells fruits and vegetables at the Noogat central market. Her business was launched five years ago when she started selling potatoes. The loan will be used to increase her fruits and vegetables stock. Her monthly income is about 150 US dollars. Nazgul, 23 years old, is married. Her husband works for an electric company. She lives together with her husband’s relatives. She works in the registry office. The loan will be used to purchase small cattle for fattening and resale. Murat is 26 years old. He is married, and his wife is a teacher in a village school. The family also raises animals and the loan will be used to purchase more cattle. In the future he plans a substantial increase of livestock. Rysgul is 68 years old. She is a widow and the mother of seven children. Her children mostly work in the Russian Federation, sending her some money every month. In addition, together wither youngest son, she does farming, more specifically growing potatoes. The credit is needed to purchase mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Wassa, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Missiritou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de gâteaux, de macaroni, de céréales  et de pâte d’arachide.
Ces femmes du groupe Wassa sont à leur premier prêt solidaire  et Sadio C. du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter quelques sacs d’arachide afin de les transformation en pâte d’arachide.
Elle s’approvisionne généralement à Dioïla et environnants auprès des paysans  producteurs et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Dioïla et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée surtout de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Wassa group, all married, are on average 32 years old, have 3 children and all live in traditional extended families in Missiritou, in the subprefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative district in the Republic of Mali). They met through family connections and sell cakes, macaroni, grains and peanut butter. This is the first group loan for the women of the Wassa group and Sadio C., of the group, plans to use her loan to buy several sacks of peanuts in order to make peanut butter. Sadio usually gets her supplies in Dioïla and the surrounding area, from small country farmers, and conducts her sales there as well, wholesale, retail and credit, in the Dioïla market and in nearby markets, to a customer base made up mostly of women. Sadio believes she will see an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which will be used for the daily expenses of her family and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying peanuts

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
I. Haidar is 55 years old, married, and has three children. He has been running his business selling combustive-lubricating materials, such as benzene, diesel and others, for more than 14 years. Haidar's elder son helps him in the business. His current business is profitable and has allowed him to support his family for all these years. Now Haidar is planning to expand his business and increase his stock of combustive-lubricating materials for resale. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $2000 USD. Haidar promises to repay his loan promptly and thanks everyone for supporting him.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase combustive-lubricating materials wholesale

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
El señor Eusebio vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como carpintero independiente en su propio domicilio.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar madera y poder entregar los muebles que le piden ya que solo le dan el 50% de adelanto por cada obra y no le alcanza para terminar la obra completa, y lo que Eusebio quiere es no perder su trabajo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

No es cliente de Impro, esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, pero por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Eusebio owns a house in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz city. He works as a carpenter and runs his own workshop. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wood. He is working on an order of furniture but his customers only pay a deposit of 50% of the price, and it is not enough to allow him to finish the job. Eusebio wants to finish his work so that he doesn't lose business, as it is his only source of income. Eusebio isn't an Impro client - this is his first loan request. However, his character and reputation qualify him to obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood to finish an order of furniture that is in progress.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 31 años de edad es conviviente su esposo esta realizando internado  como Medico, tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad, ella actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de sus padres, cuenta con terreno propio el cual esta en proyecto construir. La Sra. Rosa tiene un vehiculo el cual lo alquila, lo adquirio con ahorro propio anteriormente estaba desempeñando su carrera como contadora. Ella tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder contruir su casa de material noble. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en areglar su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is 31 years old and in a common law marriage. Her husband is doing an internship as a doctor. They have a three year old son and currently live at her parents’ house, but they have their own land on which they plan to build. Sra. Rosa has a vehicle for rent that she acquired using the savings that she had accumulated earlier from her job as an accountant. She has many dreams and goals, one of them being to build a house made of solid materials. The money she requested will be used to repair her vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Dios Nos Ama Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal “Dios nos Ama”, está conformado por 12 socios emprendedores quienes viven en L. zona alta D. El Agustino, departamento D. Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad recientemente.

José Luis tiene 38 años, es padre soltero, tiene 2 hijos D. 8 y 14 años, asume el cargo D. presidente y es una persona luchadora que saca adelante a su familia. DesD. hace 10 años se dedica al transporte como taxista, anteriormente trabajo como cobrador D. ómnibus, logro comprarse un auto pero por necesidad lo vendió, actualmente alquiL. un auto y es así como trabaja. El gran sueño D. José Luis es comprarse nuevamente un carro y tener una empresa D. taxis.

El préstamo otorgado será  destinado para L. impresión D. tarjetas para que el permita una L. mayor captación D. clientes, nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The “Dios Nos Ama” communal bank is maD. up of 12 entrepreneurial members who live in the upper region of El Agustino, Lima, department of Lima. They work with the recently formed Prosperidad branch of EDAPROSPO. José Luis is 38 years old. He is a single father with two children, ages 8 and 14. He is president of the communal bank and he is a fighter who puts his family first. He has been working as a taxi driver for 10 years and previously worked as a bus conductor. He bought a car but had to sell it out of necessity. Right now, he is renting a car and this is how he is able to work. José Luis’s greatest dream is to buy another car and have his own taxi company. The loan will be used to print business cards so that he can attract more customers. Our members are grateful for the support and promise to make the payments according to the agreed upon terms.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To print business cards in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M. is from the village of Sipaloc, Sibutad. She is 38 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Maria raises and sells piglets in the local community.  She has been in business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC, used for personal purposes.  Maria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP for additional working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. 

------------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional working capital for the business

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married with two grown-up children. She owns a small bakery located in a village close to Ivano-Frankovsk city. Ten years ago she lost her job of  pastry-cook because the company she worked for closed. Vera decided to start working on her own. 

Vera was able to purchase an old building and make it a bakery. Absence of competitors enabled Vera's business to grow fast. Still she owns the only bakery in this village. This is a family business that brings a stable income.

Vera would like to borrow 6,500 Ukrainian hryvnias (UAH) to purchase 650 kg of sugar. He will use it in her bakery for several months.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for baking

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 5 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Fuerza Divina 5 (Divine Force). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children as the head of the family. She says that her most difficult challenge is to give what her family needs in every sense of the word. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at home, cleaning and cooking.

Maria is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for more than five years, starting with the first loan Esperanza gave her. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying cosmetics and beauty products and also, bags of used bed linens. She will use the profits to provide what her family needs and she will be saving because she wants to finish building her house and implement another business to rent clothes for ceremonial occasions like quinceañeras and first communion. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because "this was the opportunity to start my business, and I have seen the results" and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products and also, bags of used bed linen

loans.name: Rwabashenyi Fal, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
A determined and hard-working K. Peace, married with five children, is enthusiastic in terms of her agriculture businesses in Rwabashenyi, Ntungamo. She belongs to Rwabashenyi FAL, Ntungamo Group. Peace owns a banana plantation and other agricultural farms growing beans, millet and onions, all generating income for her family. This has seen her earn 300,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.

Her main drawback has been the lack of funds to purchase mulch for her plantations. This has reduced the yields and she also now needs to buy more seedlings like onions for the coming season. This loan will therefore help her improve her banana produce yields thus enabling her to meet the customers’ high demand. It will also increase her sales revenue, hence making her more able to meet the family's requirements in terms of tuition fees for her children and to live a more self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase mulch and seedlings

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda G. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 27 years old. Brenda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Brenda owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Brenda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Brenda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Brenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Brenda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.en:
Karimjon is married with two children. He lives in Khujand and works as a taxi driver. He has been in this business for 7 years. One of the most outstanding characteristics of his venture has been its stability and consistent growth. Karimjon is requesting a loan of $1,500 USD to cover expenses connected with repairing his car. Then he will be able to provide good and qualitative service, and with this increase his profit. We believe his drive for success and increased profits will be the best motivation for prompt loan repayment and further development of his business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his car.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a businessman based in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is aged 37 years, married to a peasant wife and together they have four children. He looks after a family of six people who all live in his own house. He wants to see his children attain quality education for a better future. 

Andrew operates a retail shop in which he sells domestic items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, and other foodstuffs and it has been in operation for the last seven years. He says that bad debtors affect his cash flow projections so he would like to transform the business into a wholesale shop. Andrew intends to use the loan proceeds to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for the children

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia D.  C. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Amelia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Amelia owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Amelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Amelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Amelia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & thread. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Amelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & thread

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto A. is from the town of Surallah. He is 41 years old, married and has 2 children aged 16 and 8. Roberto owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Roberto works hard to keep up with the increasing needs in his household.

Roberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roberto has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his family's house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a 30-year-old ambitious, married man with a child. He owns his house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a motorcyclist and has been in the transport business for five years now. Over time, he has been able to own a motorcycle in spite of financial constraints. Nonetheless, he longs to own at least four motorcycles for business. Solomon will use the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 60 years old and is a widow with eight children. Currently, eight of her children attend school.  Jennifer sells fruits such as yellow bananas and avocados.  Besides this business, she also sells charcoal and firewood.  She has been doing this business for 12 years.  Jennifer will use the loan to purchase more charcoal and firewood.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Jennifer plans to build her savings.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, tiene 32 años, tiene un niño de 1 año y medio de edad. Gladys tiene un negocio de internet, el cual esta bajo en esta epoca porque ya acabo la epoca escolar.
Gladys es socia de FINCA Perú y gracias a los prestamos que ha recibido su negocio se ha expandido significativamente. A ella le gusta trabajar con FINCA Perú por el trato personal que dan a sus socias y las tasas de interés bajas en los préstamos. Gladys invertirá su préstamo en más productos para su negocio y dice que su sueño es algún día abrir otro café Internet o una imprenta.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Llapanchik community bank.  She is 32 years old and has a one and a half year-old child.  Gladys has an Internet café business.  Business is quiet at the moment because the school year has ended.

Gladys is a member of FINCA Perú and, thanks to the loans that she has received, her business has expanded significantly.  She likes working with FINCA Perú because of the personal service that they provide to their members and the low interest rates on the loans.  Gladys will invest her loan in buying more products for her business.  She says that her dream is to some day open another Internet café or a printer's.

loans.use: To buy paper and ink

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 39 años, vive al lado de su esposo Walter de 44 años que es chofer y de sus 3 jóvenes hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la elaboración de trenzas, echas a base de material reciclable, con las cuales fabrican carteras que son exportadas a otros países. Ella manifiesta que labora para una intermediaria que les trae el material, por el  trenzado le pagan mensual, según el volumen de la producción, y esta bastante satisfecha pues le genera regulares ganancias en lo que se ha convertido una labor familiar, pues en el trenzado del plástico le ayuda su esposo, durante sus ratos libres, además de sus hijos cuando están de vacaciones del colegio. Como es un trabajo bastante tranquilo, pues mientras mayor tiempo le dediquen mejores serán las ganancias. Siente que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, y tiene planeado para el futuro instalar una librería en su vivienda, pues por la zona donde vive no hay competencia. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mercedes tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de material, pues quiere empezar a producir por su cuenta sin necesidad de intermediarios.
texts.en: Mercedes, age 39, lives together with her husband Walter, age 44, who is a driver, and their 3 young children. Together they work hard every day to get ahead. This enterprising woman works creating braided panels from recyclable material. The panels are then used to make handbags, which are exported to other countries. She reports that she works for an intermediary who delivers the material. She is paid monthly for the braids, according to her production volume. She is quite satisfied because this work generates regular earnings. She has made this work into a family effort, since her husband helps her weave the plastic during his free time, and her children also help when they are on vacation from school. It is not difficult work, and the more time they dedicate to it, the more they earn. She feels that it has helped her family get ahead, and in the future she plans to set up a bookstore in her home, because there is no competition in the area where she lives. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually, since she does not want to disappoint the people who made possible this funding which will permit her to continue working in search of progress. Mercedes plans to invest the loan she is requesting in buying materials, because she wants to start producing on her own, without the need for intermediaries.

loans.use: Buying materials to make braided panels from recycled plastic

loans.name: Chrech

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrech C. (pictured with her husband) sells fruit and vegetable in Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Mr. Keov Um used to be a solder, but he was retired and assists his wife in the business. They have five children (three sons and two daughters). Two of their children are married and the others attend school.  

Chrech is asking for a loan of $300 to repair the house in which she lives.

loans.use: To repair the house in which  she lives

loans.name: Dourng

texts.en:
Dourng C. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. sells groceries, earning an income of about $14 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Her husband rents speakers for any ceremony, earning an income of about $7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $55 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more speakers to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her 2nd loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy speakers to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Richar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Richar; El socio tiene 32 años de edad, el socio  es soltero; el socio tiene 2 hijos; (12,7) años de edad, el socio tiene como principal actividad la artesanía pero también él  se dedica  a la compra y venta de vehículos,  en cuanto a la artesanía el socio produce, mantas, tejidos con motivos andinos, en sus diseños plasman las vivencias del ande , recreando paisajes con, animales típicos, flores nativas, cerros, aves y el bello sol azul que caracteriza el ande peruano. El socio desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mantas y tejidos, el socio compra a los típicos artesanos y él los vende en la feria artesanal en el pueblo de Chinchero.  

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Richar is a member of the "Nueva Victoria - Chincero" community bank which is located in Chinchero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco Department.

Richar is 32 years old, single, and has 2 children aged 12 and 7.  His main business activity is handicrafts but he also buys and sells vehicles.  As regards his handicrafts, he produces blankets and embroideries with Andean motifs.  Experiences of the Andes are captured in his designs, recreating landscapes with typical animals, native flowers, hills, birds and the beautiful blue sun that characterizes the Peruvian Andes.

Richar requires this loan to invest in buying blankets and embroideries.  He buys from traditional craftsmen and sells at a craft fair in the town of Chinchero.

Richar is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.
