loans.use: to invest in buying blankets and embroideries

loans.name: Sabali Kagni Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABALI KAGNI est constitué de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à SIEKOURANI un des villages de la commune de Loulouni préfecture de Kadiolo (Sikasso) 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les trois prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués.
ADAM S. fait le commerce d’articles de boutique dans ce groupe de femmes SABALI KAGNI. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  10 cartouches de cigarettes, 50,kg de sucre, 1 carton de lait concentré,  2 cartons de thé,  1 bidon de 10 litres d’huile végétale, 1 paquet d’autres articles. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso. Elle  revend dans sa boutique à Siékourani village, en face du goudron (la Route.Nationale) qui va jusqu’à ZEGOUA, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The SABALI KAGNI group is composed of married women who are, on average, 32 years old with 2 children.   Most of them live in polygamous families in SIEKOURANI, one of the villages of the Loulouni commune, prefecture of Kadiolo (Sikasso), third administrative region of Mali.  This is their fourth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. They are requesting the loan to satisfy the needs of their customers; all three previous loans have been fully repaid.  In this group of Sabali Kagni women, ADAM S. sells shop items.  With her loan, she plans to buy 10 cartons of cigarettes, 50 kg of sugar, 1 carton of condensed milk, 2 cartons of tea, 1 drum of vegetable oil, and one packet of other items.  She gets her supplies at the Sikasso Grand Market and sells them to a clientele composed of men and women for cash in her shop in Siékourani village, in front of the goudron [a tarmac road, the National Route] that goes to Zegoua.  She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 37,500 CFA, part of which will be used to pay down the principal and interest of her loan and the remainder for her savings.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in a shop

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old and married with 11 children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food stall in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spices, tobacco and grocery items.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the food stall for 30 years.

Erlinda aspires to earn and save so that she can do some home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase spices, tobacco and grocery items

loans.name: Las 5 Rosas Group

texts.es:
La señora Angelina  García Gutiérrez, vive en la localidad de Emiliano Zapata, Municipio de Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México. Ella es casada  con el señor Elías Sánchez Chavarría y con quien procreo siete hijos quienes ya están casados.
El préstamo que solicito en fundación realidad es para invertirlo en la compra  de trastes de peltre como son: ollas, sartenes, visones, entre otros, nos comenta que con esta actividad lleva ocho años y cinco lo que formalizo apenas solicito un préstamo en compartamos y le fue muy, es así como ha estado trabajando todo este tiempo.
Para iniciar esta actividad lo animo una compra ya que ella le entregaba la mercancía para que la vendiera en su localidad le grado la idea y es como lo sigue practicando pero ahora ya es de ella, de lo que se siente contenta porque con ello se apoya para sus ingresos de su hogar.
Lo que Más desea es que Dios le siga prestando vida  para seguir  trabajando y así progresar con su pequeña actividad.
Las personas que integran en el grupo son cuatro señoras más y cada una se dedica a diferente actividad:
Silveria C. Guzmán: ella se dedica a la panadería
Blanca Leticia Espinosa H.: se dedica a criar pollos de rancho para posteriormente venderlo.
Manuela Gómez Hernández: engorda pollo con alimento para después venderlo.
Sofía García Sánchez: ella se dedica a la venta de tamales, de bola y hoja de guineo.
texts.en:
Angelina García Gutiérrez lives in the town of Emiliano Zapata, in the municipality of Tecpatan, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Elías Sánchez Chavarría. Together they have seven children who are already married.
The loan that the reality foundation is asking for will be used to purchase pewter dishes such as: pots, pans, and other things. She tells us that she has eight years of experience with this activity. For five years she has been asking for shared loans. It has taken her far, and in this way she has been working all this time.
To start this activity, she made a purchase. Since she had been turning in the goods to be sold in her community, the idea was supported. It is in this way that she continues practicing. But now it is hers. She feels happy because with it she is supported with the income for her home.
What she wants the most is that God will continue to give her life to continue working and therefore progress with her small activity.
The people that make up the rest of the group are four women. Each one does a different activity:
Silveria C. Guzmán: She works in a bakery.
Blanca Leticia Espinosa H.: She raises ranch chickens to sell later on.
Manuela Gómez Hernández: She fattens chickens with food to sell later.    
Sofía García Sánchez: She sells tamales, in a ball and banana leaves.

loans.use: To buy pewter dishes to later sell in the same area.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma L. A. is married with two children who are in school. He is a businessman who operates a green grocery. His business is only one and a half years old. He was previously working as a casual laborer, mining to earn a living.

Through Faulu Kenya, Juma has learned how to run his business profitably because he has been trained regarding bookkeeping and financial management. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and oranges.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and oranges.

loans.name: Adiyajav

texts.en:
Adiyajav is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in a house in Dornod province, Mongolia. His daughter is three years old and goes to kindergarten. Adiyajav manages a transportation service business in his town. He started his business three years ago after working with his father for several years. Adiyajav transports coal, wood, luggage, and goods from local markets to his customers’ homes. He is a safe and reliable driver who provides a quick and cheap service for his customers. 

Adiyajav is a hardworking and polite man who possesses good managerial skills. He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts. In the future, he is planning to purchase a much bigger truck.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar, posee una sastrería y venta de ropa, tiene casa propia donde vive en compañía de su esposa, tiene 13 años de ser comerciante y de confeccionar ropa.
Él necesita materiales de costura para lo cual solicita un préstamo y adquirir telas, hilos, botones, broches, también comprara ropa nueva para ofrecer a los clientes, esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su producción e ingresos para el hogar.
Su objetivo con el préstamo, es proporcionar lo necesario para que sea estable y que los clientes encuentren lo que necesitan, también quiere crecer económicamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar has a tailoring business and also sells clothing. He has his own house, where he lives with his wife. He has sold and made clothing for 13 years.

He needs materials for sewing, so he is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, and clasps. He will also buy new clothing to offer to his customers. This investment will help him to increase his production and his income for his household. 

His goal with the loan is to use what is necessary to be economically stable and so that his customers will find what they need. He also wants to grow economically with his family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, and clasps.

loans.name: Las Catitas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Las Catitas" porque L. iniciadora del grupo se llama Catalina, ubicado en el estado D. Toluca, México. El grupo esta conformado por 8 integrantes. L. Sra Catalina es una integrante del grupo, tiene 48 años sin estudios, es comerciante, se dedica a L. venta D. tortillas negocio que inicio hace 3 años. Tiene en total 6 hijos, 2 mujeres y 4 varones. Solicita el prestamo para comprar maiz y masa para L. elaboración D. las tortillas, su negocio es fijo ya que sus clientes le compran este producto todos los días a su casa. Al solicitar este prestamo elL. se siente contenta por L. oportunidad D. seguir invirtiendo y comprar en grandes cantidades ya que así se lo dan en mejores precios, con las ganancias que obtenga desea ahorrar para construir un local y así dar mejor servicio, también quiere apoyar a sus hijos y brindarles una carrera profesional y así tengan un mejor futuro y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Catitas" because the lady who started the group is called Catalina.  The group is located in Toluca, in the State of Mexico, and has eight members.

Catalina is one of the members of the group.  She is 48 years old and did not attend school.  She has a business selling tortillas which she set up three years ago.  Catalina has six children: two daughters and four sons.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn and cornmeal for making tortillas.  Her business is permanent as she has customers who come to her home to buy tortillas from her every day.  At the time of requesting this loan, she feels happy to have the opportunity to continue investing and to buy in large quantities since this means she will receive her goods at better prices.  With the profits she makes, she would like to save up to build business premises so that she can proviD. a better service.  She would also like to support her children and proviD. them with a professional career so that they can enjoy a better future, and support her husband with their family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn and cornmeal for making tortillas

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita is 50 years-old .  She is married and has 3 children, aged 29, 26 and 14.  In 2000, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase inventory for the store. 

In the future, Sita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 3 children. She sells various kinds of clothes at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband to pay the school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: Ekua will use the loan to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is a 51-year-old woman, married and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has one grown child. She has a corn plantation that supports the family living. She earns a total of PHP 2,000 from this activity. Because of a lack of funds, Luciana has applied a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase fertilizers for her corn plantation. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. She hopes for a good harvest and plans to extend the farm to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad 32 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con su hijo y su esposa que son sus prioridades. El va a comprar con el crédito los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con  una plantación de café ya establecida en buenas condiciones y lo quiere mejorar en condiciones de cosecha. El  con esta mejorar lo que quiere es obtener mejores ganancias para su bienestar y seguir adelante con sus proyecto de vida. También poderle dar a su familia cada día el sustento diario. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32, and and is in a common-law relationship.  He lives with his wife and son, who are his priority. He is going to use the loan to buy the necessary supplies to maintain his coffee crop. He has a coffee plantation that is already well-established, and he wants to improve his harvest. 

With these improvements he wants to earn better profits, for his well-being and to get ahead in life.  He also wants to meet his family's daily needs. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had previous loans from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR offered better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 44 years old, married and has two children.  He has been quarrying for four years and employs two people in his business.  He also sells fruits to earn extra income.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, George has grown his business and hence improved his standard of living.  He hopes to expand his business in five years and employ more people.  He has requested a loan for 30,000 kenyan shillings to buy a water pump and to hire an excavator.

loans.use: buy a water pump and hire an excavator

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 38 years old, is a garment factory worker earning $2 a day. Her husband is also working in the factory and earns $2 per day. She has two children, 17 and 12 years old. Both of them are studying at school. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on school fees, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her and her husband to travel to work. She hopes that she can have the ability to support the two children to study through high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her and her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Joe Ann

texts.en:
Joe Ann is married with seven school-aged children. Joe Ann is 42 years old and lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a general store selling grocery items, some hardware products, kitchenware, varieties of rice, school and office supplies and much more. She has run the business for over ten years and has met various personalities (gentle, stern, frank persons, etc.). Little by little she got used to it. Each month, she earns about PHP 18,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more rice for resale.

Joe Ann has been a member of GDMPC since 1995. She is a long time member of the cooperative. This current request is her 27th loan cycle recorded with GDMPC. In the future, Joe Ann hopes to widen her selling area and acquire new feasible products to sell to sustain the business. She wants all of her children to finish a degree.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for resale.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. Her husband is a crane drive and contributes, financially to the family's basic needs. Sophy has a house with neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees her children. 

Sophy has operated a tailoring shop for the past ten years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of machine break downs. She dreams of establishing another shop and employing someone else.

With the KES20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring shop. She decided to join Yehu because it helps people financially.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Joner

texts.en:
Joner is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Joner has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages.

Joner has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joner hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, breads, and beverages.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Lisa is married, 42-year- old and lives in Gala Ozamiz City. Lisa has four children who live with her.

To make a living Lisa owns and operates in the agricultural business sector. To earn a living, Lisa planted banana trees and after harvest she sell the fruits to her contract buyer. She has been doing this business for 5 years. 

Each month, Lisa earns approximately PHP 8,500 for this activities. She requested a loan for 25,000 to purchase fertilizer and other farm equipment.

Lisa has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Lisa hope to widen her banana farm for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Aba sells cooked food (wakye) at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Aba uses her income to assist her spouse to take care of her children. Aba will use the loan to purchase rice and beans to cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to cook and sell.

loans.name: Kuña Joaihu Group

texts.es:
El comité "Kuña Joaihu"se originó a través de promociones  que se realizaron en el barrio de las miembros. Todas las integrantes son amigas y vecinas del mismo barrio. Los objetivos que se propusieron fueron trabajar,  fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa. 
La Sra. Elva es la presidenta del grupo, ella trabaja en la venta de bebidas, lo cual le ayuda mucho para mantener a su familia y también en su negocio. Su deseo es aumentar su stock de bebidas y ser más rentable, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de vinos, cervezas, whiskys y demás tipos de bebidas, lo cual le será de gran ayuda. 
Ella nos dice que pondrá el mayor esfuerzo para que su comité salga adelante, y así también podrá ejecutar su plan de trabajo.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Joaihu" committee was first set up as a result of some promotional work that took place in the members' neighborhood.  All the members of the committee are friends and neighbors from the same neighborhood.  The aims that they set themselves were to work, to encourage a supportive spirit and to reach the top level of the program.

Elva is the group's president.  Her business is selling drinks and this helps her a lot in supporting her family.  She would like to increase her stock of drinks and for her business to be more profitable.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy wine, beer, whiskey and other types of drink.  This will be a big help to her.

Elva tells us that she will put as much effort as she can into helping her committee do well and she will also carry out her work plan.

loans.use: to buy wine, beer, whiskey, etc.

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Radhika, a 48-year-old married mother of two children aged 26 and 24, established her tailoring business in 2000. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. Having already received and repaid five loans from Patan BPW to buy raw materials for her work, Radhika is requesting a new loan for the same purpose. She plans to continue working to uplift the economic condition of her family, and she thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.en:
Roseline is the facilitator of the Amani group. Roseline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roseline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Roseline takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school and secure enough food for her children. In the recent 2011 season, Roseline had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Roseline was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Roseline will educate her children and save in business and livestock rearing for future use.

In 2012, the members of Amani group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Roseline is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gerarda Yony

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS ORQUIDEAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gerarda Yony; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara platos como estofado de pollos, tallarines y sopas, la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, su sueño de la socia es tener una cevicheria y ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como verduras, pollos y carne al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gerarda Yony belongs to the "Las Orquideas" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which is part of Cusco province, in Cusco department. She is 44, a widow, and has two children. 

She alternates her daily activities with a business selling meals. She prepares dishes such as chicken stew, noodles, and soups. She works as a street vendor from 8:00am to 7:00pm. With this business, she is raising her children. 

Her dream is to have a business selling ceviche (fresh raw fish marinated in citrus juices), and to expand her food-selling business. 

She is applying for the loan to buy cooking ingredients at wholesale, such as vegetables, chickens, and meat. She is happy about the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients at wholesale, such as vegetables, chickens and meat.

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Lamin. He is married to a businesswoman and has three children aged 7, 5 and 1 year old. One of his children is a school-going child. In 1999, Lamin established his jeans, polo, shirts, lacoste and trousers etc. business. He began his business because he did not go to school but rather joined his father in farming. After he fully matured, he left farming in the village for the city. In the city, he helped to sell for somebody on commission where he accumulated some funds, which he used to start his own business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,437,100 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan for Le 4,000,000.  Lamin has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase used clothing. He wants to purchase the following items:  T-shirts 2 bales @ Le 580,000, Lacoste 2 bales @ Le 650,000 and trousers 2 bales @ Le 700,000. He will use the balance of the loan to pay for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 287,420.  

In the future, Lamin plans to provide a quality education for his children, build a house and have a shop.  He felt good about taking this loan and the loan will help him to improve his business and his family's standard of living.  His major challenge is that sometimes the bales he buys contain spoiled/damaged clothing. He serves 15 customers each day. His business is popular because he sells quality used clothing. Lamin does not have any employees. His suppliers are located in Conakry and he transports his good by public transport. He buys three times in a month.  He plows back the profit into the business. He is planning to expand and this will accomplish by acquiring more loans. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo , es un humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la agricultura , esta muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic Atraves de los fondos Kiva ya que con el préstamo anterior lograr sembrar mas áreas de piña , logrando también abonar gran parte del cultivo ya establecido ; lo cual obtuvo resultado muy satisfactorios y lo mejor de todo es q ahora el tiene tres mozo a su cargo lo que lo llena de mucha alegría ya que si no hubiese sido beneficiado con Kiva el no podría llevar el pan de cada día a su familia junto a sus trabajadores , los sueños mas grande son  poder terminar su vivienda para gozar de un mejor bienestar .
texts.en: Arturo is a humble farmer in the Ticuantepe zone with his family.  His plan for his family is to improve their quality of life.  He’s been a farmer for a long time.  He’s very happy with the support he gets from Afodenic through Kiva funds because he was able to use the prior loan to plant larger areas of  pineapple crops as well as to fertilize a great part of the established plants which led to very satisfactory results.  The best of all is that he now has employed three helpers which fills him with happiness because if he hadn’t been benefited by a Kiva loan he would not be able to provide daily bread for his family and his workers.  His greatest dream is to be able to finish his house to enjoy greater wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sarat is aged 35 years and married with two children. For more than ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice and selling grocery items as primary sources of family’s income to make a living. 
Sarat has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to make her living condition better. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is looking for new business strategies and opportunities since she started sewing. She is in need of complementary funds to buy fabrics and sewing materials to sew fashionable dresses for women. Your contribution in this project will empower women's participation in the local economy.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and sewing materials

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 16 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 2 children.

With a portion of this loan, Margaret will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Margaret plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Margaret’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nyaibanda Savings & Credit Group

texts.en: Stellah is a 39 year old woman with three children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She operates a bar alongside farming to supplement her incomes. She started business in 2006 where she has managed to make tangible benefits and has paid school fees for her children. She intends to use the loan to buy Waragi a local brew and beer to sell. The biggest challenge in her business is inflation accompanied by low turn up of customer. She is a member of Nyaibanda Savings & Credit group where members offer member group guarantorship to obtain a group loan.

loans.use: to buy Waragi a local brew and beer to sell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
I sell my products in small stores and businesses around our bakery, also, some of my clients place orders with me for celebrations and other events.

The credit will help me to construct a new oven and to improve my Bakery in order to increase my production and my income.

loans.use: Buy materials to reconstruct our oven and to buy ingratiates for baking our products (Bread, Cakes, Sweet Bread, and other products)

loans.name: Blanca Petra

texts.en:
Blanca is married and lives in Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon. About 10 years ago she began a small general store solely to improve her family's quality of life, because her husband's salary just wasn't enough. With the support of her family, and with a lot of effort and dedication, she has been able to continue with her project and successfully reach her goal.

Now Blanca needs a loan for $USD925 to puchase merchandise and increase her income. Without a doubt, your generosity can help Blanca. She needs and would appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Blanca es casada y vive en la comunidad de Santa Catarina, en el estado de Nuevo León. Hace aproximadamente 10 años ella comenzó con un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, con el único objetivo de poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo esto no era posible. Con el apoyo de su familia, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ella ha logrado continuar con su proyecto, pero más importante aún, ha podido lograr su objetivo.

En éste momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares, mismos que destinará en la compra de mercancía y con esto podrá lograr un incremento en sus ganancias. Tú puedes ayudar con tu generosidad a Blanca y su familia, no lo dudes más, ella necesita de tu apoyo y te lo agradece.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina tiene 51 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es carpintero y hace diez años por cuestiones de enfermedad no podía trabajar y para cubrir las necesidades de la familia, Catalina empezó con la venta de cosméticos por recomendación de su hermana, poco a poco los clientes se incrementaron al igual que la demanda de sus productos, el esfuerzo de Catalina le llevo de ser vendedora a ser distribuidora de los productos.

Para surtir los pedidos de sus clientes Catalina necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizará para otorgar un mejor servicio y permanecer en la preferencia de su clientela, ella ofrece pagar este crédito en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante de sus logros, decídete a apoyarla.

Translated to English by Nuria Ruiz

Catalina is 51 years old. She is a hard working mom of two. Catalina's husband is a carpenter, ten years ago he got sick and was unable to work for some time. At that time Catalina was in charge of providing for the family and -following her sister advice- she started her business selling cosmetics. Little by little she grew her clientele and after some time she went from seller to distributor of cosmetic products.

She is asking for a loan of 475$ to be able to better serve her clientele. She will repay the loan in five to ten months. You can contribute to her achievement.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a new computer and printer

loans.name: Surie

texts.en: Surie S. runs a business selling secondhand clothes in Kabala, Sierra Leone.  He is forty-eight years old and married with four children. Surie’s wife also manages her own business  selling African print fabrics in the same market.  Both are working together to earn income for their children’s education and other expenses.  Surie would like a loan of $275 to increase his stock of used clothing.

loans.use: to increase his stock of clothing for his business

loans.name: Ni Komang Suarniti

texts.id:
Although no more children to raise, Ni Komang Suarniti still has to do business for her livelihood. With a loan of Rp1,400,000 (about US$155) Komang Suarniti bought 2 pig feedstock. So, now she raises 4 pigs. The stalls to raise the pigs are simple, from bamboo walls and cement floor. Besides feedstock, Rp400,000 (about $44) is used to buy pig's feed. Sometimes pig feed are mixed with traditional feed, like banana trunk, lantoro leaves and kangkoong. The house she lives with husband Ketut Kaler are owned. Besides farming, Ni Komang Suarniti husband's also sells cow's feed, like grass, that are plentiful in their yard. Ketut Kaler already has many customers. 1 bundle of grass was sold for Rp10,000 ($1.10). Ketut Kaler also often helps his wife feeding the pigs. All profit are used to pay for daily needs, and also expanding the pig business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun sudah tidak menanggung anak, Ni Komang Suarniti tetap berusaha untuk kelanjutan hidupnya. Dengan modal pinjaman Rp.1.400.000,- Komang Suarniti membeli bibit babi sebanyak 2 ekor. Jadi babi yang dipelihara sekarang menjadi 4 ekor. Kandang yang dimiliki untuk memelihara babinya sangat sederhana, terbuat dari dinding bambu dan lantai semen. Selain membeli bibit babi, uang sejumlah Rp. 400.000,- digunakan untuk membeli pakan. Kadang - kadang pemberian pakan babi diselingi dengan makanan tradisional seperti: batang pisang, daun lantoro dan kangkung. Rumah yang dihuni sekarang bersama suaminya, Ketut Kaler, adalah rumah milik sendiri. Selain bertani, suami Ni Komang Suarniti juga menjual pakan sapi yang berupa rumput – rumputan yang banyak ditanam di pekarangan rumahnya. I Ketut Kaler sudah banyak memiliki langgana. 1 ikat rumput dijual Rp.10.000,- Ketut Kaler juga sering membantu istrinya memberi makan babinya. Semua keuntungan yang didapat digunakan untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari dan juga untuk pengembangan usaha babinya.

loans.use:
To buy feedstock and pig feed

Membeli pakan dan ternak babi

loans.name: Agus

texts.id:
Together with his wife, Agus is running this business. They started since 2006. They decided on this business, since they see a good opportunity. Raw materials are obtained from production leftover of jackets and bags. The loan, is planned to be used to increase raw material inventory. Each bracelet is sold between Rp2500.00 - 5000.00 (between 30-55 US cents). Profit could reach up to Rp650,000 (about US$67)/month. They both live in a rented house. Their living expense of Rp20,000 (about US$2.10)/day was derived from this business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Bersama dengan isterinya, Agus menekuni usaha ini. Sejak tahun 2006 yang lalu mereka memulai usaha ini. Mereka memutuskan untuk menekuninya, karena melihat peluang yang bagus dari usaha ini. Bahan mentah yang mereka perlukan banyak mereka dapatkan dari sisa - sisa hasil produksi jaket dan tas. Pinjaman yang mereka peroleh, rencananya akan mereka pakai untuk menambah jumlah persediaan bahan mentah tersebut. Harga per gelang mereka jual berkisar antara Rp 2.500,00 – Rp Rp 5.000,00. Keuntungan yang mereka peroleh mencapai Rp 650.000,00/bulan Mereka berdua tinggal di rumah kontrakkan. Biaya hidup Rp 20.000,00/hari dapat mereka penuhi melalui usaha ini.

loans.use:
To buy raw materials

Membeli bahan baku.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María Victoria A. is a member of the community bank Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women). She lives in Manuel del Águila street in the district and province of Moyobamba in the region of San Martín. She has a sales stall in the central market of the city where she sells products including green and ripe bananas, a variety of beans, casava (yuca), corn flour, starch, etc. She decided to start her business because she needed to generate her own income in order to support her children. Despite having no education whatsoever, she launched this business on her own. In the beginning she had the support of the mother-in-law of one of her children. She didn't know how to buy or sell, but little by little she went along learning. Now she does both very well. She is a very hard-working and capable person.

This loan of 2000 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, will buy products including beans of different varieties in sacks, bunches of bananas, sacks of cassava, sacks of starch, corn flour, also in sacks, aguajina (a fruit juice made from aguaje, a jungle fruit) and fruits and vegetables. This will allow to to stock her sales stall well while at the same time keeping her clients well satisfied.

She is 56 years old with 12 children, now all adults. Her husband supports her in the business and is happy about the the success she has achieved. Starting the business improved her self esteem. She learned how to manage the business, her clientele grew and the business helped to improve her economic situation, giving her the means with which to provide an education to her children. Her goal is to continue in this business, have it well stocked, and continue improving it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran. Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Victoria A. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras, vive en el Jr. Manuel del Águila s/n del distrito y provincia de Moyobamba, departamento de San Martín. Tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad donde vende productos de pan llevar como plátanos verde y maduros, diversos tipos de frijoles, yuca, harina de maíz, almidón, etc. Decidió iniciar un negocio porque tenía la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos para poder mantener a sus hijos, a pesar de no contar con ningún tipo de educación ella emprendió esta actividad. Al inicio tuvo el apoyo de su consuegra porque ella no sabia comprar ni pagar y poco a poco fue aprendiendo, ahora lo hace bastante bien. Es una persona muy trabajadora y hábil.

El préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cuál pagará en 6 meses, comprará sus productos como frijoles en sacos de diferentes variedades, plátanos en racimos, yuca en sacos, almidón en sacos, harina de maíz, también en sacos, aguajina y frutas y verduras, de esa manera tener bien surtido su puesto de venta y a la vez también tener bien satisfechos a sus clientes.

Tiene 56 años y 12 hijos, pero ya todos son mayores de edad. Su esposo la apoya en su negocio y está contenta por sus logros obtenidos, mejoró su autoestima, aprendió el manejo del negocio, su clientela aumentó, ello también ayudó a que mejore su situación económica y así contar con los medios necesarios para poder brindarle educación a sus hijos. Su meta es continuar con este negocio, tenerlo bien surtido y mejorarlo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: beans, bananas, cassava (yuca), etc.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela belongs to the communal bank San Martín de Porras and she dedicates herself to the sale of clothes and beauty supplies. She offers these to her relatives and friends during door-to-door visits. The business is located in her home, in the Huaraz district of the Ancash department.

With the loan of 1,200 soles (approximately $425USD), to be repaid in four monthly installments, she would buy childrens’ tops and pants, sweaters for men and women, and cosmetics.

Marcela is 33 years old, is married and has two children. Her husband is a public employee. Both help with their cost of living expenses and they are educating their children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marcela pertenece al banco comunal San Martín de Porras, se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza, los cuales ofrece a sus familiares y amigos mediante visitas domiciliarias. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en el distrito de Huaraz, provincia Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 docenas de polos para niñas y niños, 2 docenas de chompas para damas y caballeros, una docena de pantalones para niños y niñas y una docena de estuches de cosméticos. Marcela tiene 33 años de edad, es casada con 2 hijos y su esposo es empleado público. Ambos colaboran con los gastos del hogar y están educando a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Nhâm, 47 years old, lives with her husband and 5 children in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She is a fourth year member of the TYM Fund. The family’s business is farming and animal husbandry. She buys calves and raises for few months then resells for profits. Her husband, Mr. Hoa, farms and does as hired construction labor for extra cash to pay the monthly payments. They try hard to provide education for their two children who are still in school. This time she is applying for a 650USD loan to buy young calves. The family income is 200USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhâm, 47 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 5 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Hoạt động chính của gia đình là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi trâu bò. Thông thường chị Nhâm mua nghé, bê về nuôi trong vài tháng, khi được giá chị bán thu lãi. Để có tiền trả tuần ngoài làm ruộng, anh Hoa, chồng chị, còn đi làm thuê (thợ nề, thợ xây) để có thêm thu nhập. Trong gia đình còn có hai con đang đi học nên anh chị cũng khá vất vả. Chị Nhâm đã xác định sẽ cố gắng để các con được học hành tới nơi tới chốn. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 650USD để mua thêm bê về nuôi. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Mrs. Celestina lives on Alcides Arguedas Street, in the Alto Mariscal Santa Cruz area in La Paz. Her husband works as a chauffeur and she sells sportswear. She does not have a permanent sales post though, and sells while walking down the Tumusla Streeet every day, where they have street markets/ fairs daily.

The loan she's requesting is to increase her capital in order to buy more goods and improve her income, because although it's hard to believe, Celestina sells at least three or four "track suits" and jackets daily.

She has a good credit history and is qualified for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase more sportswear in order to sell through her business. (Compra de mas ropa deportiva para su negocio de ventas.)

loans.name: Frida's Valentine Group

texts.en:
Frida has two children. She sells clothes and food, and began her business in 2002. She works daily from 7 AM to 6 PM at her business.

Frida would like to request a loan to purchase more clothes and food items for her business. She will share this loan money with her subgroup members, who deal in fruit sales and clothing merchandising.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and food items for her business.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru:
Gulruhsor M. lives in the town of Vahdat, Tajikistan. She is 43 years old and married with 4 children. Gulruhsor has been buying and selling dried fruit for more than 10 years. She has a sale kiosk at the local market in Vuhdat. Since her husband is currently unemployed, her business is the only source of income for her large family. Gulruhsor is requesting a loan to buy dried fruit from wholesale merchants. She plans to repay the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Маликова Гулрухсор жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 43 года, замужем ,имеет 4 детей.Гулрухсор занимается куплей продажей сухофруктами.Она имеет торговую точку на местном рынке города Вахдат.Занимается этой деятельностью более 10 лет. Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее большой семьи. Так как муж клиентки временно не работает.В данный момент Гулрухсор хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков товар.Для чего ей нужны деньги и она решила взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Phaung

texts.en: Phaung S. I., 34, is married with four young children living at home in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US$1 each day and her husband raises pigs. Her husband, Phin Pai, typically makes about US$2 each day as a pig farmer. Phaung S. I. would like a loan of US$600 to purchase more pigs to breed and to purchase feed for the pigs. This loan would allow for their family to increase their profits from raising the pigs.

loans.use: Purchase a pig

loans.name: Mohammad Madi

texts.en:
M. Madi lives with is own family. He is married with 4 children. Madi is uneducated. He couldn't complete his education because of the war in Afghanistan. Now he tries very hard to educate his children. He is a taxi driver and works around Kabul.

Madi has 9 years experience in driving but he wants to replace his car. He has requested an individual loan from AFSG to replace his car and improve his business.

He is happy with this loan process and he wishes to become stronger in his business to enroll his children in a better school in Kabul. He would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To replace his car

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam H., 51 and married with three children, has been operating a grocery store for the past eight years. Assisted by his son in the selling of foodstuffs including tea, soft drinks, bread, chocolates and a variety of sweets, he has established a successful business through hard and diligent work. 

Rustam’s main goal is to give his dearest children a good education and make them happy. In order to cover the higher education expenses of his younger son as he prepares to enter the university, Rustam wants to increase his working capital to expand the range of goods that he sells.  Therefore he is requesting a loan of $600 for the term of nine months. He thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time. Be an important part of the growth of Rustam’s business. He is counting on your help

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Yabo

texts.fr: Née vers 1975 dans un village de Porto Novo, dame O. Yabo a épousé à monsieur ODJO Pierre. Elle est mère de 02 enfants, Annick et Gwladys, tous à sa charge et scolarisés. Elle vend des tomates en boîtes  qu'elle achète du Nigeria et qu'elle livre immédiatement au marché à ses clientes qui l'attendent déjà. A cause de la cherté de la vie que nous traversons actuellement et de la flambée des prix, elle s'est rapprochée de notre institution pour obtenir un prêt afin de mieux se positionner sur le marché.
texts.en:
Born around 1975 in a village in Porto Novo, Mrs. Yabo O. is married to Mr. Pierre Odjo. She is the mother of two children, Annick and Gwladys, and she is responsible for both the children who are still in school. She sells tinned tomatoes that she buys in Nigeria and delivers immediately to the market to her customers who are already waiting. Because of the rising cost of living that we are undergoing at present and the price hikes, she came to our institution to obtain a loan so as to better position herself in the marketplace.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 50 cases of canned goods (tomatoes)

loans.name: Azim

texts.en: I. Azim lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. I. Azim has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007 and he done well enough to repay previous loans He runs a business raising livestock and selling meat and milk. He dreams of owning a trade outlet for the large-scale meat selling.  Mr. I. Azim asks KIVA for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months for the required capital to open a trade outlet.

loans.use: To open a trade outlet

loans.name: Djiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djiguissèmè (4 mariées et 2 veuves) ont en moyenne 45 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Ganabougou de la préfecture de Yanfolila (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Unies par des relations de parenté et de voisinage, elles ont décidé de nouer un partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 5 ans. Elles sont à leur dizième prêt et tous les prêts anterieurs ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
Le prêt actuel permettra d’acheter, 20 sacs de maïs et d’arachide, 400 kg d’oignons (frais et séchés), et une importante quantité de condiments. Les  vendeuses de céréales s’approvisionnent sur place (surtout les Mardi jour de foire) à Yanfolila auprès des producteurs venant des villages environnants. Pour les vendeuses de condiments alimentaires, elles se ravitaillent chaque semaine à Sikasso auprès des grossistes de cette localité.
Ces articles sont revendus au détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes de la ville de Yanfolila.
De ce commerce chacune des membres du groupe espère réaliser un bénéfice par cycle de 50.000 FCFA.qui leur permettra de rembourser les intérêts du prêt et subvenir à certaines dépenses du foyer telles que la scolarité des enfants, les soins de santé et l’habillement. Les membres de Djiguissèmè veulent à l’avenir ouvrir des magasins de stockage et de vente de céréales et de condiments alimentaires à Yanfolila.
texts.en:
The members of Djiguissèmè group (four married and two widows) are on average 45 years old, have 3 children, and live in traditional extended families in the Ganabougou neighborhood of Yanfolila prefecture (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Joined together by family and neighborhood ties, the women decided to establish a partnership with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. They are now on their tenth loan and all previous loans have been reimbursed without problems. The current loan will allow them to buy 20 bags of corn and peanuts, 400 kg of onions (fresh and dried), and a significant amount of seasonings. The grain retailers get their supplies on-site (especially on Tuesdays, market day) in Yanfolila from producers coming from surrounding villages. The seasoning sellers get their supplies each week in Sikasso from wholesalers in that area. These items are resold as retail, for cash, and sometimes on credit to customers who are mostly women from the town of Yanfolila. From their business activities, each member of the group hopes to make a profit of 50,000 FCFA per loan cycle, which will allow them to repay interest and meet certain household needs such as children's education, healthcare, and clothing. The members of Djiguissèmè would like in the future to open stores to stock and sell grains and seasonings in Yanfolila.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains and seasonings

loans.name: Anait

texts.en:
Anait is married and has two grown-up sons. She sells vegetables and fruits at the central market. She has been in this business for 2 years only. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person. She started selling her own produce. Then as the business grew she began to purchase the produce in bulk and re-sell it at the market.

Today her gross monthly income is 5,000 UAH. Anait would like to receive a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase bananas, oranges, apples, and other fruits. She hopes to increase her profits in order to buy a kiosk at the market. This would significantly improve her business conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell for Christmas and New Year

loans.name: Kum

texts.en: Kum Y. is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. She is a rice farmer as well as raising pigs at her home to provide income for her family's needs. She currently earns approximately  US$ 2 per day and has been running her businesses for more than three years. She takes care of two young children; both of them are single and attend school. Her husband is a construction supervisor who has employees to provide his services. Y. hopes to expand her business and ease the hard physical labor necessary for her farming, thus she needs a loan to buy more piglets to raise and a cow to use for plowing her field.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and a cow for plowing

loans.name: Kuon

texts.en:
Mr. K. lives in Siem Reap Province and is aged 49. He earns a living by working as an employed worker, carving firewood for a profit. His wife Mrs. Kimsal, 49, is a vegetable grower, as well as raising poultry from home for sale. They currently earn the amount of $4 a day to sustain their daily expenses. Together have three children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school.

To increase their income, Mr. K. and his wife have decided to request a loan of $200 to purchase more poultry like chicks and ducks to raise for sale. (K.'s wife appears in the picture because he was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more poultry like chicks and ducks to raise for sale.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr: Abiba B. est propriétaire d’une baraque au marché d’Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Abiba espère avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son entreprise en achetant plus de marchandises pour la revente.
texts.en:
Abiba B. is the owner of a stall at the marketplace in Avetonou, a village located about 100 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is married and the mother of five. She hopes to use this loan to expand her enterprise by buying more merchandise for resale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María González tiene 60 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Rosa tiene tres hijos y todos trabajan por cuenta propia. La actividad económica de Rosa es la venta de gaseosa, hielo y ropa en general. Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que inicio desde de hace mucho tiempo y con la venta de ropa que es dirigida por ella todos los días en esta actividad tiene el apoyo de su hijo mayor ya que necesitaba conseguir una fuente de ingreso. Los propósitos de Doña Rosa son de obtener otra refrigeradora incrementar su producción de hielo. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos para su pequeña venta y ropa en general. Sus deseos son proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. La cantidad que necesita es de C$ 18.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Rosa María González is 60 years old and single. She has three children, all of whom work independently. She sells soft drinks, ice and clothing. She has been running this business for more than 31 years, beginning with the sale of clothing. Everyday she manages the business, and she has the help of her oldest son, who needed a source of income. Rosa plans to buy another refrigerator to increase her ice production. The funding is for small retail and clothing products. Her dream is to make improvements to her home. The amount she needs it 18,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Muhtaram

texts.ru: Мухтарам 45 лет, она замужем и имеет 1 ребенка. У нее мелкий бизнес. Она продает сигареты, жевательную резинку, конфеты и тп. При этом не имея постоянной торговой точки она каждый раз привозит свой столик с товаром к местам скопления людей во время праздников и свадеб. Там у нее наиболее лучшая касса ее бизнеса. Муж Мухтарам нигде не работает и использует различные способы чтобы заработать. Мухтарам решила немного расширить свой бизнес и поэтому подала заявку на займ КИВА.
texts.en:
Muhtaram is 45 years old, married, and has one child. She runs a small business selling cigarettes, chewing gum, candy and other items. As she doesn't have permanent place to sell at, she she sets up her table and goods where people gather at celebrations and weddings. She has the most business there. Muhtaram's husband is unemployed and finds various ways to make a living. She decided to expand her business a little, and so is requesting a loan from Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Triumphant Women) Village Bank, a group of 19 women who meet monthly at Luisa’s house in the town of Andahuaylillas, about 40 minutes outside the city of Cusco in the Peruvian Andes. Luisa is 38 years old and lives with her partner and their five children, who are 13, 11, 6, 3, and 9 months old. Luisa works as a cook for the local Municipal. She cooks for Wawawasi (“Baby house” in Quechua), its childcare program, preparing meals for 11 babies and 55 children each day. She cooks alone, though she works with two people who help her serve the food. She cooks mostly stews.

Luisa also raises small animals like pigs, guinea pigs and hens at her home. Right now, she has one pig and 30 to 40 guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy). She raises the animals from the time they are small, then fattens them up and sells them to buyers, who travel to Andahuaylillas from Cusco and bring the animals back to the city to cook and serve in restaurants. Luisa is requesting a loan of 1800 soles to buy hens and guinea pigs. Hens cost 12.50 soles per pair, and guinea pigs cost 22 soles per pair. She expects to sell the hens for 40-45 soles apiece and the guinea pigs for 20-25 soles apiece in three to four months. Though hens sell for more when fully grown, they also cost more to feed and maintain, Luisa says. 

Luisa’s goal for the future is to open a chain of hotels in Andahuayllillas. She says there are many tourists who visit the small town to see its church (which is nicknamed “America’s Sistine Chapel” because of the elaborate 17th century frescos painted on its walls and ceiling), and she sees a promising business opportunity.

loans.use: To buy hens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Trương Thị Hải Group

texts.en:
"H. Trương Thị is a 24 year old female living in the town of Yên Phong-Bắc Ninh. H. is the group leader of a 5 member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 02 (2).

H. is married and has 2 infant aged children. To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. H. has just started operating this business and earns approximately 2500.000 IDR a month from these activities.

H. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. is requesting for the first time a loan from DINARI. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About the other borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị H. is a 36 year old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Trương Thị X. is a 20 year old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a weaving business.

3.  Trương Thị U. is a 22 year old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.

4.  Trương Thị K. is a 34 year old female who is requesting a 3.360.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

H. Trương Thị (20203050006) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 02 (2).

Trong khi không pH. chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi vịt để bán.  H. has just started operating this business.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2,500 IDR.  H. đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ DINARI.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050007) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Trương Thị X. (20203050008) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng dệt.

3.  Trương Thị U. (20203050009) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.

4.  Trương Thị K. (20203050010) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về DINARI:

Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome A. is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all males. She says some are in senior high while others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband runs a provision store in the community.

Salome is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and yam with stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells on a tabletop at the market square. She procures her ingredients from the local market. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and tubers of yam in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 52 años, vive en una casa arrendada con sus dos menores hijos de 10 y 12 años. Desde hace más de 20 año se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, todas las mañanas, junto a sus hijos procesan la papa manualmente, pelándola y haciéndola secar en el sol para venderla en el mercado principal de su comunidad. Este trabajo es muy sacrificado puesto que requiere de largas horas de trabajo bajo el intenso sol, a pesar de eso, continúa, porque sabe que esta actividad le brinda las ganancias para sostener a su familia. Martina quiere seguir mejorando su producción y para más adelante emprender otro negocio. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que tiene grandes expectativas de conocer y ser parte de esta nueva experiencia de un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de costales y el pago del transporte de la papa que va a cosechar.
texts.en:
Martina, 52, lives in a rented house with her two young children, 10 and 12, respectively. She has made a living doing farm work for more than 20 years. Every morning, with her children, she processes potatoes by hand, peeling them and drying them in the sun before selling them in the town's main market. The work is very difficult because it requires long hours of labor in the blazing sun. She goes on, despite this, because she knows that the business provides the living that supports her family. Martina wants to continue improving her production and, in the future, set up another business. This is her first MFP loan and she's very much looking forward to learning about and being part of a community bank, a new experience for her. The money that she's requesting will be used to purchase bags and to pay to transport the potatoes that she will harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for bags and transportation for food business.

loans.name: Rizal

texts.en:
Rizal J. is 33 years old and has two children. He owns a three-hectare farm that has gone far in helping him to provide food and meet his family's other basic needs. He is doing his best to make his business flourish so that he can send his children to school and pay for their books and tuition.

The moment Rizal heard about the services of Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc., he never hesitated to apply for a loan. He is requesting the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy herbicides, fertilizers and other farm supplies. He thinks that this initiative will help him improve his harvest even more.

About CEVI
CEVI helps farmers sustain their livelihoods. It provides small loans, training and insurance cover to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy herbicides, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta H. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Julieta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty snack food like fruit salad, rice cakes and others in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new products

loans.name: Kifayat

texts.en:
Kifayat is applying to Kiva for a second loan. She needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the spare parts for her husband's car. Her husband transports goods to markets. Her husband appears in the photograph.

"Thank you very much for the help."

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia K. is a client of Pearl Microfinance in Ntungamo. She is a 50 year old widow with 9 children of her own and she looks after 4 dependents. She is a business lady involved in commercial agriculture and market vending whereby she grows her own produce to sell in the market. She has been in this business for 20 years and her business has had very few competitors all along or even if they are there, her services keep her at the level she desires. She operates from three different locations but she would like to be stationed in one trading centre so that all her customers find her there for the produce. She would like a loan to help buy manure, grass and tools and to employ workers on her farm.

loans.use: Buying manure, grass and tools for her farm improvement.

loans.name: Muamko Group

texts.en:
Odila is a member of the Muamko borrower group in Sakina, Arusha, she is 32 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 12,9 and 4 years old.She also cares for other 3 dependents.

Odila has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 4 years, she works 10 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Odila`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Odila hopes to save money, pay school fess and expand her business.

Amina is another member of the same borrower group, she requested the loan amount of 300,000 in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 31 años, está separada de su pareja y vive con sus 2 hijos en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de fotocopiado y redacción de textos, generalmente para los profesores y alumnos de la escuela primaria donde está su negocio. Yanet atiende durante todo el día y cuando sus hijos tienen tiempos libre le ayudan, pues también saben manejar la máquina fotocopiadora. A pesar de que existen dificultades en su negocio, como el pago retrasado de las cuentas que le deben los docentes, siempre tiene las ganancias que le permiten sostener, ella sola, a sus hijos en los gastos que requieren. Su deseo a futuro es ampliar su negocio, comprando una fotocopiadora más con la que pueda brindar sus servicios en una universidad, ya que en esos centros académicos es mayor la demanda de su servicio. 
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy deseosa de emprender un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal, comprometiéndose también a pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad. El dinero que viene solicitando será para comprar una computadora y así mejorar su servicio de redacción de textos.

loans.use: Compra de una computadora

loans.name: Poy

texts.en: Poy L. is 28, married and has four kids who are in primary school; her husband is a local construction worker.  She has been cultivating rice since before she was married, a skill she learned years ago. After she was married her grandparents inherited a plot of land, which she uses for a farming business. Poy L. said that her entire family’s living situation is not so good because her old house has been cracked by water during the heavy rains. Therefore, Poy L. is requesting a loan in order to pay the cost of repairing her house.

loans.use: To pay the cost of repairing her house

loans.name: Adimdin Group

texts.en:
These people are Kadiatu S., Adama K., Fatu S., and Ramatu T.. They named their group 'Adimdin'. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each for the first time from Kiva Lenders through SMT. With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Kadiatu S. is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is age forty-two; she was born in Matham village about seven miles from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. Kadiatu is married with five children, all of whom are attending secondary schools. Kadiatu sells cigarettes, matches, mints, and biscuits at her home in Magburaka town. She has been in this business for seven year now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
Karin tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la confección de diferentes prendas de vestir. Su herramienta básica de trabajo es su máquina de coser y trabaja todos los días en su taller, que es su misma casa. Los pedidos que tiene son generalmente de instituciones educativas para la elaboración de uniformes escolares, pero también ofrece el servicio de arreglo de ropa, como alzado de bastas, pegado de botones y demás. Ocasionalmente, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija mayor, quien al ayuda en sus tiempos libres.
Para el futuro, Karin desea tener un taller de costura mejor muy bien equipado para que sus prendas sean de mejor calidad. 

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y a ella le gusta promover la unidad en su banco comunal, por lo que es muy apreciada por su grupo. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos, ya que en esta campaña navideña confeccionará varios vestidos para niños y los llevará a vender a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Karin, 36, lives with her husband and their two children in the house that she inherited from her parents. For eight years she has been making different articles of clothing. Her basic work tool is her sewing machine. She works in her shop, which is in her house, everyday. Generally, the orders that she has are from educational institutions to make school uniforms. But, she also offers her services to fix clothes. She raises hems, sews on buttons, and others. She occasionally has help from her oldest daughter who helps her during her free time. In the future, Karin wants to have a better dressmaking shop that is well equipped so that her clothes can be of better quality. This is the third loan that she has had with MFP. She likes to promote unity in her communal bank, and her group appreciates her for that. She will use the money she is asking for to buy fabric and needles. During this Christmas season she will make various clothes for children and take them to sell in other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 43 años, está casado con la madre de sus 2 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.
Su sueldo de profesor no es suficiente para pagar las letras de su carro; por ello, después de trabajar en el colegio por la mañana, a las 6 de la tarde inicia su labor de taxista hasta las 12 de la noche. Trabajando de este modo viene pagando las letras de su carro, evitándose así las  preocupaciones.
La labor de taxista le llena de mucha complacencia, pues cuando termine de pagar su carro  podrá ahorrar para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos, ya que por quienes trabaja arduamente.
A su vez para “sacarle provecho a su carro” como él dice, los fines de semana transporta cargas de plátanos u otro producto desde las chacras hasta el pueblo, así obtiene ganancias adicionales.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y hasta el momento no ha tenido problemas en el pago de todas sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de una gata y otra llanta de repuesto para estar prevenido cuando realiza viajes lejanos.
texts.en:
Edgar is 43 years old, married to the mother of his two children and lives with them in their own house. Edgar's teacher's salary is not enough to pay for the installments owing on his car, which is why after he finishes working at the college in the morning, he then starts his job as a taxi driver from 6pm until midnight. Working in this way means he is able to make his repayments and avoid worry and hassle. His job as a taxi driver fills him with a lot of satisfaction, as when he finishes paying off his car he will be able to save to provide his children with a good education, for whom he works arduously. At the same time, to truly take advantage of his car, on weekends he transports orders of plantain and other products from the farms to the village, from which he gains an additional income. This is his second loan with MFP and up until now he has not had any problems with the repayment of his installments.
