The loan that he is currently applying for will be used to invest in a jack and a spare tyre so he will be prepared when he goes on long trips.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a jack and a spare tyre for his car

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru L. is a 29 year old widow with 4 children who all attend school. Nuru sells tea and local sudanese bread in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more powdered milk and tea to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bigger restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to purchase more powdered milk and tea to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C., age 49, is a rice farmer. She tills a small rice field so she can have a bountiful harvest and buy her family food, clothing, and other basic needs. 

“Sometimes I have a good harvest, sometimes I have few, but I continue to grow rice, because we rely on the harvest of our farm,” she said.

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her crops.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alberto Alarcón vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su padre. 
El señor Alberto trabaja como empleado de seguridad privada en la zona sur de la Ciudad de la Paz, con una antigüedad de tres años y los ingresos que recibe es para mantener a su papa el cual es mayor de edad.
El crédito solicitado es para los trámites de propiedad de una vivienda, la cual se encuentra en juicio y necesita ser saneada para no perderla.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Alberto Alarcón lives in his own house with his father in the Llojeta area, on the western slope of the city of La Paz. He has worked for a private security firm in the south end of the city for three years. The income that he receives is used to support his elderly father. The loan he is asking for is to secure the property title on a house which is currently in the court system. The documents need to be checked so that he doesn’t lose the house. This is the second time that Alberto has requested a loan. The Bank’s socioeconomic analysis shows that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for property title costs

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia, D. 53 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, abre las puertas D. su tienda D. abarrotes para atender a sus clientes. Ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a las personas D. llevarse algo a sus casas. Su tienda es muy concurrida, ya que es la mejor implementada D. su barrio.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así se pueD. enterar D. las cosas que suceden en su barrio. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda, sin poder salir. 
Para el futuro D. su negocio espera hacer arreglar la infraestructura D. su tienda para ampliarla y que sea más atractiva.

Este es el cuarto préstamo D. Anastacia con MFP, está muy feliz D. la oportunidad y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. 
En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Anastacia, 53, is a very hardworking and cheerful woman. She lives in her own home, and what she most desires is to have a peaceful old-age. Every day, early in the morning, she opens the windows of her grocery store to attend to her customers. She is a very persuasive saleswoman, and she always convinces people to take something to their homes. Her store is very busy, since it is the best-supplied store in her neighborhood. What she likes most about her work is to chat with her customers, because this way she can stay informed about things happening in her neighborhood. She has been carrying out this activity for 15 years, and what she considers to be the most difficult part is to have to stay all day insiD. of her store without being able to leave. In the future, she hopes to make some repairs to the infrastructure of her store to expand it and so that it becomes more attractive. This is Anastacia's 4th loan with MFP, and she is very happy to have this opportunity. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time, since she wants to be able to access other loans at a later time. In her communal bank she is a member who is well-respected for the order she brings to the group. With the 1,000 Peruvian soles requested she will buy more products to better supply her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Orubu 1 Layado Esther Group

texts.en: L. Esther is the leader of her group. She is forty-two years old, married, and has eleven children, five of whom are going to school. She is taking care of two additional dependents who are also in school. She sells produce and she has been in this business for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase produce like beans and tomatoes to sell. The loan is adding to her previous stock. She is active and encouraging. Her future hope is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase produce to sell.

loans.name: Sapani

texts.en:
Sapani S. is 37 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, selling BBQ (sausages, chicken, plantains).  Sapani has many years of experience in this business.  Sapani needs a loan of WST $2000 to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business. Sapani wishes to develop her business and support her family.

Sapani joined SPBD, and this is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sapani's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sapani S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat, a 36-year-old married man with two children who go to school, has been running a bookshop located in Nakuru for three years. He also has other businesses such as dairy farming and second-hand clothes sales. A hardworking and focused man, Josephat previously borrowed kes 20,000 to expand his business and is now requesting a loan of kes 35,000 to buy a cow as well as new and second-hand clothes.  He hopes to eventually own a variety of businesses and increase his profit margin four times.

loans.use: To buy a cow, new clothes and an additional stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Fofo

texts.en:
Fofo S. is 29 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Fofo has 4 years of experience in this business.  Fofo needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fofo joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Fofo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.en:
Evgeniy is married with two children. He sells bed sheets and towels at one of the small markets in Zaporozhye city. Evgeniy has been in this business for seven years. Good communication skills and good choice of products help him a lot. Evgeniy enjoys his business very much and wants to develop it further.

Evgeniy has used microfinance loans before and found them very helpful. This time he would like to borrow 4,000 UAH to purchase more products. His goal is to be successful in both business and life.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets and towels to sell

loans.name: Awaou

texts.fr: Née en 1965 à Djougou au Nord du Bénin, B. Awaou est mariée à ADAM Maboudou et est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Awaou vit avec ses enfants et son mari à PK10, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis une dizaine d'année. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Awaou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Awaou vend depuis environs dix sept ans, divers savons de lessive et de toilette à son domicile, et quelquefois de façon ambulante. Awaou s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits qui tous été bien remboursés. Awaou désire renforcer son activité et la diversifier également par la vente d'autres produits divers, ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et d'assurer un meilleur avenir à ses enfants. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Djougou in the north of Bénin, Awaou B. is married to Maboudou Adam and is a mother of five, some of whom attend school. Awaou has been living with her children and her husband in PK10, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, for about ten years. The couple shares the family’s financial responsibility. Awaou did not attend school. In order to meet her needs and those of her family, Awaou has been selling laundry detergent and soaps at home and elsewhere for about seventeen years. Awaou stocks up at Dantokpa, an international market in Bénin. She is a former client of ALIDé, having already taken advantage of five loans, which have all been repaid. Awaou wants to build up and diversify her business by selling other types of products, which will allow her to better meet the needs of her clientele and ensure a better future for her children. This is what brings her back to ALIDé.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soaps, laundry detergent, sugar, and sardines

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. sells charcoal in both small and large quantities at Takoradi. She has received junior high education and is a single parent with one child.

Esther has been selling charcoal for some time now and is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y quines les quiere dar un buen estudio para que tengan un futuro mejor. 
Solicita un préstamo porque necesita hacer unos pagos en la escuela de sus hijos para que puedan terminar el siclo escolar. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fabrica en el área de producción.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia is a single mother and has three children for whom she is responsible. She wishes to provide her children with a good education so that they may have a bright future. For this reason, she requests a loan to help her make payments to her children's school so that they will be able to finish out the school year. She plans to pay back the loan with a portion of the salary she earns from her job at a local factory.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos escolares

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito D. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $50 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Julito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be his 4th loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Him S. is a 30-year-old married woman and is the village bank president, having been selected by the seventeen members of this group loan located in Doung TU. village in Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different businesses.  Mrs. Him S. and her husband, Mr. Din Sorn, are farmers who own 1.20-hectare of land to cultivate rice. They work very hard with their farm but they still earn too little income to support their family. In order to increase their income, Mrs. Him S. requests a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start a pig selling business. This couple has three children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah has been operating his mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, for the last ten years, selling his products to the local market. He also owns and operates a motorbike in the same area.

Josiah is 38 years old and is married with eight children between the ages of 4 months and 14 years. Six of the children are currently attending school.

Josiah has requested this loan of 85,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says that with the income from the sale of milk he will be able to provide for the needs of his family. His biggest challenges have been the high competition in the market, a lack of skills in animal husbandry, diseases, and lack of farm inputs.

In future, Josiah would like to have at least five quality cows that daily produce ten liters of milk each. He says that Juhudi is a good company that has changed people's lives a great deal and he has a strong hope for further progress with Juhudi.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Néfissa

texts.fr: M. néfissa  est une femme de 48 ans,elle est une dame très dynamique. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de tubercules d'ignames. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la localité d'anié. elle a une ancienneté de 5 ans dans ce commerce; sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle est en rupture de stock et n'arrive donc plus à satisfaire tous ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de vingt tas de tubercules d'ignames pour rehausser son stock. elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Néfissa M., 48 years old, is a very dynamic lady. She makes a living selling yam tubers. She gets her stocks in the inland locality of Anié. She has been doing this for five years, and her customer base includes anyone. Her stocks are currently depleted and she can no longer meet customer demand. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase twenty heaps of yam tubers to increase her stocks. She is married and the mother of four children.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yam tubers

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael K., age 38, is dedicated to raising animals in order to generate revenue from the products they provide. Rafael has earned a living from breeding sheep since he was young. His monthly income is about 150-230 AZN.  He is married with one child.  His low income isn’t enough to provide for his family and, for this reason, Rafael works enormously hard to improve their standard of living. Rafael needs to buy more sheep.  He also wants one milking cow for the milk and milk products which it can provide Rafael and his family, ensuring they will never go hungry and will always have at least cheese and yogurt. He has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: To buy one milking cow and six sheep.

loans.name: Herminda Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Herminda del Carmen, tiene la edad de 42 años, vive acompañada de su pareja de vida en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene con su pareja 3 hijos mayores de edad de  los cuales los dos mayores trabajan y apoyan a sus padres en los gastos del hogar, la menor estudia la secundaria y depende económicamente  de sus padres, ellos tiene una pulpería desde hace mas de 7 años, por los problemas económicos que atraviesa el país sus ventas son variables, antes trabajaba en un zona franca y con sus ahorro y su liquidación fue que inicio su negocio de venta de abarrotes, productos para el hogar, y personal.

Su hija pronto entrara a la universidad y espera tener los recursos Económicos para apoyarla a mejorar su calidad de vida, ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de  un mayor inventario de mercadería  para su negocio que garantice un incremento en sus ventas y condiciones propias para llevar a cabo los estudios de su hija menor.
Este es el tercer ciclo de la señroa con el apoyo que se le ha brindado, ha mostrado una gran mejoria economica, pues es una mejer trabajadora responsable y con mucha iniciativa en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Herminda del Carmen, 42, lives with her life partner in the Laureles North neighborhood. With her partner she has 3 grown children, two of whom work and help their parents with the household expenses. The youngest is in high school and is economically dependent. Herminda and her partner have had a general store for more than 7 years. Due to the economic problems that are affecting the country, her sales are variable. Previously, she was working in the free trade zone, and with her savings and severance pay she started her business selling groceries, products for the home and personal products. Her daughter will soon enter the university, and she hopes to have the financial resources to support her effort to improve her quality of life. Now she requests a loan to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for her business to ensure an increase in her sales so that she can support her daughter's education. This is Herminda's 3rd loan cycle, and with the support that has been provided to her she has shown great economic improvement. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman who shows a lot of initiative in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase the inventory in her store

loans.name: Pak

texts.en:
Mrs. Pak S. has been spending almost all of her life cultivating crops, a skill she learned from her grandparent who died of senility years ago. Pak S. is married with four children, three of whom are no longer in school and work in different fields, while another one attends school. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action that provides her with formal income. 

Pak S. dreams of having a vehicle; however, her income is only sufficient to support food for the family. This is the reason Pak S. requested a loan to buy a new motorcycle to serve as transportation for family. Additionally, her husband can use it to provide a taxi service for a profit.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 56 year old married man from Lebanon. He has made his living as a professional driver. He has operated a van service for students in his village, as well as neighboring towns, for over 12 years. In addition, he presents transportation services for customers upon request. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform much needed maintenance on his van, including changing the tires and repairing the engine. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new van and to employ a part time employee to work on it.

loans.use: To perform much needed maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe G., 41, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Gerry G., an employee of a printing business, and mother of four children, all of whom are already in high school. By the grace of God, Fe has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Fe, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Fe maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Fe dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her customers

loans.name: Nerea

texts.en: Nerea is a widowed mother of three. She is proud of the fact that she has been able to educate her children despite being the family's sole breadwinner, and is grateful for the support she has received from Faulu Kenya.  Her dream is to see her children through to the university level. To make this possible, she has worked very hard as a seamstress for the last 13 years. She is applying for a loan for 10,000 Kes to buy fabric, zippers, canvas and thread.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, canvas and thread for a tailoring business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 48 years old. Merlinda is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Merlinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlinda also grows pigs and ducks. She hopes to acquire more ducks and piglets to raise. 

Merlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pig feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pig feeds

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María Nelly es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Quemazón del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola habitada por personas humildes y muy trabajadoras, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Usualmente cría aves de corral, cerdos y ovejas en algunos ambientes situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo viaja hasta la ciudad de Chiclayo para venderlos en el Mercado Moshoqueque. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia, por ello María siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda responder a la demanda que durante estas fechas suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Nelly is a 25 year old mother who lives with her husband and son in the Quemazón settlement, located in the Mórrope district.  This is an agricultural zone where the people are humble and hard working.  It’s located within the Lambayeque province and is more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells animals; usually farm birds, hogs, and sheep in an area behind her house.  When they have reached a level state of development, she takes them to sell in the Moshoqueaue market in Chiclayo.  This business is an important source of income for her family’s finances, so she always tries to keep it in the best shape possible.

María wants to expand her business by buying more animals and balanced feed so that she can meet the end of year demand.  For this reason she has seen fit to request a loan for 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Animals and feed

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is 37 years old, married, and has two children.  He makes and sells handbags to earn a living.  He has been running this business for ten years and has managed to employ ten people.  Being a father of two, he works hard in his business so he can provide for his family.  He hopes to open other businesses in the future.  He needs a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy raw materials to make handbags.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make handbags

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo tiene 54 años, nació en la ciudad de Puno y actualmente vive junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq.

Luis Alfredo tiene un pequeño restaurante llamado “El Fogon" donde vende menú a S/. 3.50 nuevos soles. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Luis Alfredo que espera recibir de $ 500 USD  desea comprar artefactos como por ejemplo horno pollero, congeladora y otras cosas más.

Luis Alfredo pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.

El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito de las flores y localizándose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo, age 54, was born in the city of Puno.  He currently lives with his wife and their three children in the Wanchaq district.  Luis Alfredo has a small restaurant named “El Fogon” (The Kitchen Stove).  He sells prepared meals for S/. 3.50 nuevos soles.  He has had this business for two years, and it is going extremely well for him thanks to the great effort he puts into his work.

With the next loan Luis Alfredo hopes to receive $500 USD.  He wishes to buy items like a roasting oven, a freezer, and other things.

Luis Alfredo belongs to the “El Templo del Inca”  (The Incan Temple) Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.  The communal bank is in its second year, and it is well managed by the governing board.

The Wanchaq district is in the Cusco province in the Cusco department.  It is called the district of the flowers.  It is five minutes from the Plaza de Armas in the architectural capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is an enchanting city, which dates back to Inca times. The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

loans.use: To buy items like a roasting oven, a freezer, and other things.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 54 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 68 años, que es obrero y sus 2 hijos mayores, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 8 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, de una reconocida marca; y esta muy satisfecha pues las ganancias que obtiene le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Le gusta mucho su labor pues la desempeña visitando a sus amigas y conocidas, de esta manera  les va enseñando los catálogos para que le realicen pedidos; además paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la enseñanza en un programa de alfabetización de su zona. Esta muy contenta pues ambos trabajos le permiten salir adelante, y ya tiene muchos planes para  el futuro como el de vender ropa, pues aunque a solo veces se dedica  a este negocio sabe que es muy rentable. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Irma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de tela, pues quiere mandar a fabricar pantalones cortos y blusas para comercializar estas prendas durante el verano.
texts.en: Irma, 54 years old, lives in her own home with her 68 year old husband José, a laborer, and their two grown children. Together they work every day to get ahead. For 8 years this businesswoman has sold a well-known brand of cosmetics. She is very satisfied as her earnings that she receives have enabled her to help her husband with the household expenses. She enjoys her work as it allows her to visit friends and acquaintances, showing them catalogs from which they then order; in addition to this business she also teachers a reading program in her neighborhood. She is very content as both jobs allow her to get ahead, and she has many plans for the future such as the one to sell clothing. Even though she has only sometimes sold clothing she knows it is a profitable business. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually,  as she doesn’t want to disappoint the people who make the money possible for her to be able to continue working and becoming successful. Irma has planned to invest the money into buying a quantity of fabric, as she wants to arrange for the making of some shorts and blouses to sell during the summer.

loans.use: Buy fabric to make pants and blouses

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario C. is from the town of Tagbilaran. He is 51 years old and married. To make a living, Dario owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. 

Dario joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dario has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Dario is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou R., 57, resides with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Ou is a farmer who raises pigs, earning an income of USD 3 per day, while her husband, a construction worker, earns an income of USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 85 on other necessary expenses.

Ou is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to operate a coffee shop, and in the future she would like to use the resulting additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To operate a coffee shop

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene tres hijos y vive en la Comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Urubamba, Cusco – Perú. En la comunidad de Chicon los pobladores se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura. Antonia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros pequeños animales que sirven para el consumo de la familia. Antonia requiere el microcrédito para comprar animales y para comprar alimento. 

Antonia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Antonia has three children and lives in the community of San Isidro de Chicón located 15 minutes from the city of Urubamba, Cusco, Perú.  Chicón’s residents are mostly farmers and raise livestock.  

Antonia is a hard working, enterprising woman who supports her family.  She raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and other small animals that are used for her family’s consumption.  Antonia needs the microloan to buy animals and to buy feed.

Antonia is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicón” (San Isidro de Chicón’s Dynamic Ones) communal bank and she is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means; she also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy animals and to buy feed.

location.town: San Isidro de Chicon- Urubamba - Cusco

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new carpet-weaving frame and other important equipment

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, reside en Quelepa, departamento de San Miguel, trabaja en Fibras de El Salvador (elaboración de muebles), vive solo, es viudo y sus hijos tienen sus propios hogares, desde joven inicio como ayudante de un taller y hace 10 años instalo su propio taller donde perfecciona el oficio de trabajar con fibra de vidrio.
El necesita un préstamo para la compra de resina (barril), hierro, tubos cilíndricos, cuadrados, tornillos y otros materiales; Este préstamo le ayudara a realizar una buena compra y a un precio más bajo de lo normal.
Sus aspiraciones es crecer como microempresario, tener una buena solvencia económica para el pago de las cuotas de este préstamo y para cubrir sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives in Quelepa in the department of San Miguel.  He has a workshop called "Fibras de El Salvador" where he makes furniture made of fiberglass.  He is a widower who lives alone; his children have their own homes.  From the time that he was very young he worked as an assistant in a workshop.  Ten years ago he set up his own workshop where he perfects the craft of working with fiberglass.

He needs a loan to buy resin (a barrel), iron, cylindrical tubes, drafting squares, screws and other supplies.  This loan will help him to make a good buy at a price that is lower than usual.

He aspires to grow as a businessman and to have good earnings so that he can make the payments on this loan and also cover his personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy resin (a barrel), iron, cylindrical tubes, drafting squares and screws

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria es una cliente antigua de la institución ella tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes, la señora Victoria se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido ya que le ayuda mucho con el cuidado de su papa que ya es un señor de edad el cual vive con el en la casa, ella a parte de su actividad de venta de ropa también da en alquiler habitaciones en su hogar,  antes la señora tenia un salón de peinados en obrajes, el crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de mercadería como sacones, chompas para el día de la madre ya que sus clientes ya le están haciendo pedidos, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Victoria is a longtime client of the institution.  She has three adult children and she sells clothing to order.  The income helps her care for her elderly father who lives in her home.  Aside from her clothing business, she also rents out rooms in her home, and used to have a beauty salon there.  She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as coats, and sweaters for mothers’ day, now that her friends are making requests.  She is a hard working woman and is grateful for the support from the institution.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for mothers' day

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 27 year-old Rugiatu, who is married and has one child aged two years. In 2007, Rugiatu established her food (Tea & Achekeh) business as a means of earning income for herself and her family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month.

Rugiatu would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy provisions such as milk, sugar, tea and garri (used to prepare Achekeh). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Rugiatu plans to open a restaurant, employ workers to run the shop, and educate her children. Very determined and hardworking, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions such as milk, sugar, tea and garri for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sugar, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Erika Vanessa

texts.es: La señorita Erika  es cliente antigua trabaja a la misma vez con el grupo solidario portada desde el año 2007, durante todo este tiempo  ha demostrado ser una persona responsable ya que todos sus pagos fueron de forma puntual. Erika es soltera, se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa, chompas según a la temporada, aparte de su actividad estudia enfermería ya que tiene ganas de superarse para así poder ayudar a sus hermanos menores. El crédito será destinado a la compra de chompas y sacones para su venta  en  invierno que se aproxima, es una joven muy trabajadora viaja hasta Oruro los fines de semana llevando mercadería de la ciudad de La Paz, esta agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Srta. Erika is a long-time client who has worked with a solidarity group since 2007. Throughout this entire time, she has demonstrated that she is a responsible person who has made all of her payments on time. Erika is single and has a business selling clothes, especially sweaters according to the season. In addition to managing this business, she studied nursing and already has the will to succeed so that he can help her younger siblings.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase sweaters and coats for the upcoming winter season. Erika is hardworking young woman. She travels to Oruro on the weekends in order to bring back merchandise from the city of La Paz. Erika is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters and coats for the winter season.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 33 years-old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 3. 

In 2000, Parbati established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase inventory of her store. In the future, Parbati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Sethembiso Group

texts.en:
Hlengiwe is 31 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 10. She has been selling clothes and cold drinks from her home for the past year.  Hlengiwe has requested this loan from Kiva and WDB to purchase more stock for her store. She also receives a child support grant from the South African government to support her family.

Hlengiwe says that the biggest challenges to her business are the clients that do not properly pay for the merchandise that she sells. She would like to grow her business into a supermarket over the next 5 years. She is very excited to appear on Kiva's website and would like to thank Kiva and WDB for helping her family. In the photo she is pictured rasing her hand.

loans.use: to buy clothes and drink for sale.

loans.name: Mercedes Sebastiana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son  mayores de edad y el ultimo de 17 años que  estudian en colegio, cuatro de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella como buena esposa trata de ayudar a su esposo en lo que más puede por eso realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, él se dedica a la venta de frutas, legumbres y verduras el mismo que lo realiza cuatro días  por semana en el mercado Tarqui en Manta, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que el señor se desplaza de madrugada a dicho mercado con la finalidad de comprar a comerciantes mayoristas y luego realizar sus ventas a las personas que asistan a este centro de abastos a comprar los productos para el consumo diario.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque se divierte con sus compañeras y por la ayuda que le dan. 

Sus sueños son algún día tener un bazar o una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora (Mary Help of Christians) Loan Group meets in La Sequita parish, which belongs to Montecristi Canton, a flourishing canton in Manabi, known as the birthplace of the Viejo Luchador ("Old Fighter" and a former president of Ecuador) Eloy Alfaro, and known for its famous Panama hats, which are known in and outside of the country.

Here we met Mercedes. She is 46 years old, married and has five children. Four of them are grown, and the youngest is 17 and in high school. Four of her children still live with her. Her husband is a businessman.

As a good wife, Mercedes tries to help her husband as much as she can. That is why she is getting this loan for her husband's business. He sells fruits, legumes and vegetables himself, and he does this four days per week at the Tarqui market in Manta. Our friend Mercedes tells us that he leaves at dawn to go to this market and buy from wholesalers, and later he makes sales to people who come to this supply center to buy products for daily use.

They will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes. Mercedes has been in the Loan Group for more than ten years, and she likes it because she enjoys being with her friends and because of the help they give her. 

Her dream is to one day have a bazaar or a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy fruits, legumes and vegetables.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter de 50 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lamabayeque.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura,ganadería y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Walter  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace algunos años, el lugar donde cría  a sus animales es en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes.  Walter es una persona conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa porel bienestar de los suyos, con el anhelo de que en un futuro tenga exito su negocio.
texts.en:
Walter is 50 years old.  He lives with his family in his own home, which doesn't have water or electricity.  It is located in the rural part of the Mórrope district, which is in Lamabayeque department.  This area focuses on agriculture, livestock, and tourism.

The field that Walter works in is raising and selling sheep (ewes), which he has been doing for several years.  He raises his animals in the rear area of his house, and feeds them with balanced feed and natural pastures.  Once they reach the ideal size and weight, he sells them in different markets.  He has his own customer base, and with the income he earns he is able to cover his family's needs.

He has requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,500 New Soles to buy more animals and their respective feed.  This will allow him to keep them well fed, so as to be able to sell them to his customers for a better price.

Walter is a well-known person where he lives, because he is always focused on the well-being of his family and has the desire to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Elena's Group

texts.en:
Elena is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a builder. Four years ago with an initial investment of 500 soms, Elena started to breed poultry and pigs. At the moment, her monthly profit is 2,000 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing more chickens and pigs. She hopes that the loan will help her to improve the business. In the future with the profits gained, she plans to repair the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and pigs to breed

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, a 31-year-old tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) driver earning $8 per day, has two children, both yet too young to attend school. His wife used to sell vegetables, but has been at home since the birth of their last child. Each month, Chanthorn spends $75 on food, $5 on electricity, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

He would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a new tuk tuk for his business. His wife plans to resume selling vegetables soon.

loans.use: to buy a new tuk tuk for his business.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Angeles has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles, breads & beverages.  She has had this business for 6 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Angeles has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Angeles hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: La señora Adriana, es  comerciante de artículos de segunda mano (ropa americana y juguetes) y su esposo es rentista jubilado. Adriana con su actividad y la renta de su esposo cubren los gastos de su familia. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (calamina, clavos, madera) ya que realizara el techado de una habitación. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri  en la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que Adriana utiliza el financiamiento disponible en Kiva.
texts.en:
Adriana sells second hand American clothes and toys.  Her husband is a retired pensioner.  Adriana’s business activity and her husband’s pension cover the family expenses.

She needs the loan to buy construction material (sheets of corrugated metal, nails, and wood).  She will put a roof on a room.  She lives in her own house in the Pasankeri  area of the city of La Paz.  This is the second time that Adrian will use a Kiva loan

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal, nails, wood, and other materials to put a roof on a room in her house.
